GM Application Developer (State Street Bank and Trust Company; Boston, MA ): The GM Application Developer is a highly technical hands-on position responsible for implementing complex new features and maintaining existing features in a complex highly-scalable foreign exchange trading platform. The qualified individual will develop features and enhancements, using multiple programming languages and development environments, and support the ongoing evolution of State Street's foreign exchange trading platform and supporting services. Specific duties of the position include: leverage experience in relevant technologies to provide a high level of technical contribution and technical guidance (without management responsibilities) to peer members in a small and highly-focused local (not offshore) development team; work with business stakeholders and (when necessary) with clients to understand the requirements of the application being developed; work with the Quality Assurance (QA) team to design the test plans for the application and prioritize the defect fixing priorities; efficiently communicate instructions to the tech ops / operations team responsible for deploying the applications that the team develops; design, architect, and develop major components of complex fault tolerant, multi-threaded, real-time, performance critical (measured in microseconds), and scalable financial services systems and applications in UNIX and Windows environments using industry-standard design patterns and best practices; interact with system architects to make sure that the design fits with the overall architecture; develop complex business integration applications using Financial Information eXchange (FIX) protocol, FIX engines and libraries, web services technologies including REST and SOAP/XML, and JMS messaging technologies from multiple vendors; develop and maintain legacy applications, as well as new applications, tools, and utilities in Microsoft-stack technologies such as VB.NET, Excel VBA, C#, WinForms, and Microsoft SQL Server; develop effective solutions that bridge Microsoft-stack applications and Java-stack applications using bridging technologies such as JNI Bridge; troubleshoot SSL certificate issues that clients may encounter; develop and maintain full stack web applications using HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Angular, React, AJAX, JSON, and related technologies; implement complex database development utilizing PL/SQL for packages/stored procedures with Oracle, and access Oracle database with technologies including as JDBC, Hibernate, and iBatis, as well as SQL Server database development; quickly support issues and inquiries raised by business stakeholders, customers, customer support, integration client relations team, and QA; the highest level of written and verbal communication skills and ability is required to customize communications for each target audience. This includes representing the company in a professional manner while interacting with clients; this position requires constant communication with other developers, QA team members, and product managers world-wide, including in New York, Boston, London, Singapore, Australia and Tokyo; and to efficiently troubleshoot critical code, especially code related to client integrations for sensitive clients, must be able to be on-call 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. This includes providing a quick turnaround in patching code with short notice, such as within a day.
Minimum requirements are: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or a related technical field and 5 years of progressively responsible experience developing software.
Must have: demonstrated experience developing software in financial, insurance, or related industries; demonstrated ability to architect, design, and develop major parts of a complex financial services system using relevant software technologies, common design patterns, and industry best practices, and interact with system architects to make sure that the design fits with the overall system architecture; in-depth knowledge of Microsoft-stack technologies, including VB.NET, Excel VBA, C#, and WinForms; in-depth knowledge of Core Java and Java-based frameworks and application servers; demonstrated ability to work with .NET Java bridging technologies; demonstrated ability to work with the Financial Information eXchange (FIX) protocol on both application and session level, specifically as related to foreign exchange trading; demonstrated ability to perform complex database development tasks utilizing Oracle and related technologies, as well as MS SQL Server; demonstrated knowledge of web application development technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Angular, React; in-depth working knowledge of the JMS protocol from commercial JMS vendors in an application that relies on external clients connecting via extranet; and in-depth understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle. (Unless otherwise indicated, State Street is seeking the ability in skills listed above with no specific amount of years of experience required. All experience can be gained concurrently.)

This is an opportunity to work with one of the world’s leading research organizations to address critical challenges related to the deployment of sustainable energy technologies. You will be a key part of a dynamic team that shares a commitment to engineering excellence, combined with an excitement about sustainable energy technology.

Develop software (embedded and cloud-based) which enables research on distributed energy resources (e.g., solar generation, renewables, energy storage, building technologies, IoT sensors, etc) and smart grid technologies

The Fraunhofer Center for Sustainable Energy Systems (CSE) in Boston, MA is a leading applied contract research and development laboratory supporting our society with the transition to a sustainable energy future. Fraunhofer CSE is part of Fraunhofer USA, a 501 (c) (3) non-profit contract R&D; organization, affiliated with Fraunhofer Gesellschaft, Europe's largest contract R&D; group. The Center has active development projects in the areas of energy efficient buildings, photovoltaic technologies, and grid impact of renewable energy technologies.

The role requires a mix of technical problem solving and clear communication from an engineer who is self-directed, innovative and execution focused.


LevelUp’s “network” refers to the 100K+ restaurants where a LevelUp user can bring up a menu, place an order and have the food ready when they arrive. LevelUp does not handle fulfillment with the restaurant. Overview
Aspen Technology is the world's leading supplier of software for optimizing process engineering and manufacturing. Our products are used by tens of thousands of engineers every day to improve the design and operations of their plants and refineries. AspenTech’s customer list (over 1700 companies) includes the world’s leading companies such as ExxonMobil, Shell, Dow Chemicals and BASF. In addition, our products are taught in the Chemical Engineering curriculum of over 700 Universities around the world.

We are looking for experienced and talented individuals interested in developing integrated web UIs within the process industries to visualize process data trends, key performance indicators, and overviews of plant operations. Strong software development and design skills working with Java, Angular JS, Type Script, HTML5, SPA, and cloud technologies are important.
The ideal candidate should be comfortable operating successfully at the interface of computer science and systems engineering.

Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Design, coding, implementation, and testing of software applications and components with primary focus in the areas of analysis and summarization of plant process data.

Analyze customer requirements and develop technical specifications.
Participating in the maintenance and enhancement of existing code base.
Keep current with new and developing technologies as they appear in industry and academia, and assist in determining the feasibility of implementing new technologies.
Provide technical support to product management, product marketing, services, customer and business support on customer activities.
Qualifications
0-2 years of experience developing practical and innovative software solutions within an industrial and business settings, and a BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent is required.
Strong technical programming and software development experience with Java, C#, JavaScript, Type Script, Angular JS, HTML5, CSS, XML, and JSON is required.
Knowledge of math and statistics, design patterns, Open-source and 3rd party libraries, security, cloud technologies, and trouble shooting skills is a plus.
A track record of championing new ideas and technology.
Ability to effectively contribute to multi-disciplinary research, development, and software project teams.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, writing and presentation skills.
Demonstrated ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Knowledge of AspenTech products is desirable.
English fluency (written and verbal) is required.
Strong problem-solving ability is required.
Working well within a global team environment is required.

Do you believe that great marketing ideas are driven by breakthrough insights?


Do you believe that big data should be at the very core of these insights?


Are you passionate about the power of testing?


If you think that is you? Please read on…


We are one of most successful Internet companies of all time. Core to our continued success is having a specialized global Analytics Center of Excellence that supports us in making informed business and marketing decisions.


Analytics is at the very core of what we do. It’s driven by an all-star global team of data scientists, modellers and marketing analytics specialists who work across our marketing business, spotting opportunities to improve what we do for our customers.


As a Manager on the Web Analytics team, you will be primarily focused on build new customer site experiences as well as optimizing the existing with a customer focused, experiment-and-learn mindset. You are expected to immerse yourself in the site experience squads, thinking quickly and creatively about ways to uncover, measure and assess opportunities. You will leverage the methodology, tools, and reporting available through our existing program and augment those with your own creative solutions to evolve how we work with these teams. This role requires you to think outside the box while maintaining analytical rigor.


Your role will involve…

Being immersed in cross-functional teams (e.g., Product Owners, Designers, Developers) responsible for innovating the customer site experience where you will lead the exploratory analysis to uncover customer insights
Collaborating in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering customer value early and often
Uncovering optimization opportunities and continually bringing forward ideas and insights
Designing, executing, and analyzing A/B tests
Identifying conflicts, risks, and synergies among planned and in-flight tests
Working closely with other analytics leads to inform the development, maintenance, and improvement of tools for analyzing and executing tests
Mentoring junior analysts and guiding their work to optimize team’s overall bandwidth
In return, you will bring…

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related discipline. Master’s degree a plus.
5+ years of experience with at least 3 years in an eCommerce environment
Significant technical, analytical work experience in site analytics data and tools. Role leverages Adobe Analytics; prior experience with Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics or other web analytics platform required.
Must possess a strong understanding of statistical methods and familiarity with test design
Must be proficient in SQL. Any other programmable languages such as R or Python are a plus. The role currently leverages SQL and R.
Passion, curiosity, and adaptability complimented by an ambitious personality to drive analyses that uncover impactful insights
Strong communication skills and experience delivering technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail, and the ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple concurrent tasks and initiatives
Strong collaboration skills including communication, giving and receiving feedback, ability to work in cross functional teams, co-development experience, and shared ownership of projects
Demonstrated ability to think outside the box, think creatively about accomplishing work
Experience working with and guiding junior analysts

Why Work at Dell?

Dell Boomi is expanding our team with our newest location in Cambridge, MA.
We are the recognized leader for the fourth year in a row in iPaas, disciplined agile, and lean software development practices, we combine a Silicon Valley culture, modern development approach, and infrastructure with the organizations’ core expertise and values. Our cloud-native platform and suite of tools drive software innovation for many of the world’s most admired brands, helping customers move at start-up speeds and with greater business agility. We optimize for change and teach next-generation developers to create and build new solutions.
As a market and technology leader in integration platform as a service (iPaaS), Dell Boomi is one of the hottest tech companies in the SaaS/Cloud industry, named a Leader for the fourth year in a row in the Gartner Enterprise iPaaS Magic Quadrant. Our award-winning, patented technology is transforming the world of integration by making enterprise-class integration technology accessible and affordable to companies of all sizes. Learn more at www.boomi.com
Our methodology is about continuous improvement, in both development and innovation, and our culture is empowering. Our 500+ employees worldwide subscribe to a culture of collaboration. We make a point to bring empathy to each and every project, and are guided by a purposeful mission—to transform how the world integrates solutions.
You
You love shipping features, but know that well factored code is what lets you keep shipping features in the long run. Maybe you get antsy writing code without tests, or perhaps you’re a large-scale system operator interested in leveling-up your coding skills. You refuse to take short-cuts and are vocal when you see a better way to solve a problem. Either way, you judge your success by the success of your team; you are interested in learning about integration platform as a service (iPaas) and you are excited to work collaboratively on cutting edge technology. In the end, you understand that it’s not about delivering code, but about delivering solutions.

Us
At Dell Boomi, we transform how the world performs application integrations, and we are opinionated about how software should be built. We work hard to deliver powerful, intuitive capabilities so customers can drastically accelerate their time to value. Our engineers work in an agile environment on small teams, but feel empowered to collaborate with the entire organization.
We believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge, and refocus. Twice a year we switch gears and get working on Project Greenlight. A week-long Hack-a-Thon where Boomi engineers work on innovative projects of their own design with awards ranging from “Most Innovative” to “Most Likely to be Released to Production”. If you can imagine it, then you can build it.
Role Responsibilities
Be a key part of the full product development lifecycle of software applications offered by Boomi
Investigate and resolve complex customer issues
Responsible for design, development and unit testing of the Boomi products including enhancements and/or resolution of any issues that may be reported
Recommend best practices and techniques to customers
Research, validate and recommend key technology decisions for the core platform and other customer facing offerings
Mentoring of other Boomi engineers, including design collaboration and code reviews
Be an active member of an Agile team, collaboratively realizing features through development, test, and delivery
Work independently with a moderate level of guidance from engineering management
Requirements
Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering or Computer Science
10+ years of commercial experience in software development using the Java programming language including the use of some IDE with a solid understanding of object oriented design concepts for delivering and maintaining a software product
Experience in architecting and implementing highly scalable, high throughput web applications and backend systems
Technical understanding of SQL, JDBC, XML, Servlets, and Hibernate
Knowledge of SOA concepts is required
Technical understanding of Web Services technologies including REST, SOAP and WSDL is required
Exposure to mature development processes including use of source code control systems like Git is required
Preferences
Knowledge of RIA technologies, especially GWT is a plus
Knowledge of Agile development methodology is a plus
Knowledge of Linux/Unix environments is a plus
Good written and oral communication skills
Work experience with an enterprise software or web company is important

About iZotope
iZotope makes audio products and technologies that are used around the world. We have a wide range of customers, from the millions of consumers who enjoy our audio enhancement to GRAMMY-winning producers using our pro products to the corporations who license our technology for use in their own products. In little more than a decade, Google has created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. Using our unique technologies, along with open source tools, we keep Google's products and services running, robust and secure. Our objective is to create solutions that allow people to work and communicate in new and innovative ways – giving back to the world's technical community whenever we can.


As a Technical Solutions Consultant intern, you will be part of teams that provide technical support to Google's external partners and clients. As such, you will play a role in supporting external partners and clients, and develop tools to make our operations smarter and scalable. Your projects could range from driving analysis to determine root causes of customer dissatisfaction, building tools to automate and scale operations or developing custom solutions for some of Google's top partners.


Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.


Responsibilities
Build internal solutions, with custom front-ends (web, mobile) and backend services that automate business processes. Maintain highest levels of development practices including: technical design; solution development; systems configuration; test documentation/execution; issue identification and resolution; writing clean, modular and self-sustaining code.
Help partners in their day-to-day challenges by delivering innovative and scalable solutions, and troubleshooting their problems. Understand operational workflows, identify and define tool needs to enable operational scaling, and drive the development (initial and ongoing) and deployment of these tools with Engineering.
Create and update documentation as integration methods are applied (e.g., requirements document, technical design document, project plan, etc).
Integrate third-party products into internal systems as well as support and upgrade implemented systems. Work closely with analysts to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Solve problems that may involve access and analysis of massive amounts of data and information. Help to develop massively scalable, distributed software systems and collaborate on different smaller projects.

Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Must be currently enrolled in a full- time degree program pursuing a Bachelor's in Computer Science or a related technical field and returning to the program after the end of the internship.
Experience with web technologies and experience with HTTP, HTMP, XML.
Database design and SQL Query construction experience.
Experience in one or more programming languages: C++, Python or Java; experience with SQL and data modeling.

Preferred qualifications:
Enrolled in a full- time degree program pursuing a Master's in Computer Science or a related technical field and returning to the program after the end of the internship.
Experience in systems software or algorithms.
Some client facing experience (gained through university, part time work, etc), or proxy skills (university society membership, organizing/leading voluntary activities).
Demonstrated business savvy and effective communication skills (relevant for a technical audience).
Authorization to work in the United States.
Expected graduation date in late 2018 or Spring/Summer of 2019.

Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems is seeking an experienced Software Engineer to develop and maintain a suite of MATLAB-based applications in support of flight operations for NASA's Chandra spacecraft. The Chandra X-ray Observatory, launched in 1999, is one of NASA's Great Observatories and delivers ground-breaking science year after year, including observations of the widely publicized August 2017 event whose gravitational waves and light were detected by observatories around the world.

The Flight Operations Team operates the Chandra spacecraft from the Operations Control Center in Cambridge, MA (soon to be relocated to Burlington, MA). The team uses a variety of software to develop observation plans, execute real-time supports, analyze spacecraft performance, and prepare for future activities. A large portion of this software is MATLAB-based and is designed around a number of mission-specific graphical user interfaces.

The selected candidate will become part of the small Software section of the Flight Operations Team. The applicant should be a motivated self-starter who is able to work independently on long term development activities while also working closely with others to support time-critical spacecraft operations. Tasking will initially be focused on modernization of the code base, implementation of new features, and support of user requests. Responsibilities may increase over time to cover other software and systems.

Partial telecommute options may be available.

Qualifications
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics, or related STEM disciplineMinimum five years software development experienceProficiency in MATLAB software development including development of graphical user interfaces and object oriented constructs

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience architecting and designing software to maximize reliability and maintainabilitySVN or other revision control system experienceExperience utilizing Java objects and UI elements within MATLABPython software development experience, including embedded PythonExperience interfacing MATLAB to other languages or libraries (e.g. via mex files)C/C++ software development experienceWeb programming and database experience (JavaScript, PHP, PostgreSQL/MySQL)Unix/Linux experience

Labs @ EF Tours
Cambridge, MA, USA

Who are we and what do we do?
Labs @ EF Tours is the group of technology and creative professionals empowering EF to send groups of students and educators on guided educational tours across the world. We power every step of our customer’s journey with us, from browsing our many tour offerings and enrolling on the web, through collecting feedback after the tour. Over the course of your career with us, you’ll have the opportunity to try your hand at everything from designing beautiful customer front end interactions, to solving large scale resource allocation problems, and everything in between.

What specifically will you be doing?
You will be working with a small team of software developers as they create and expand on technology driving a slice of our business. You will collaborate with a cross-functional team of designers, UX researchers, product owners, and business stakeholders to design and build systems that enhance our customer’s experience with us as they prepare for their tours.

Who do we need right now?
We’re looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative, cooperative environment, and gets excited about trying new technologies and new approaches to enhancing the quality and value of the software we deliver. We also ask that you have:
Experience leading software development projects
Experience with a large part of the Microsoft .Net framework, and related technologies
Enthusiasm for learning, and following, best practices

What else would we really like to see?
We solve a lot of different kinds of problems for our customers, and we rely on a lot of different technologies to get the best answer. We’d love to have you on the team if you also have:
Experience with RESTful web services
Recent experience with modern front-end web technologies, such as React, npm, and webpack
Experience with relational and/or NoSQL databases
Experience with agile/scrum methodologies
Experience working on a full stack team that owned all aspects of the software they delivered
Let’s talk about The Perks.
We believe that happy people do great work. What makes us happy? Things like:
the opportunity to travel internationally with our customers (and without too, of course)
three weeks paid vacation your first year and four weeks after your first year
free language classes, taught in-house
free workout classes, taught in-house
a restaurant and bar right in the building
discounts on EF products including our travel and language programs
market-leading benefits package including top of the line health coverage, 401k with company match, tuition reimbursement, and more

For more information about this or other career opportunities, please visit www.eftech.com

EF Educational Tours offers international learning opportunities designed to provide students with firsthand exposure to the world’s cultural, historic and natural sites as they study them. For more information, visit www.eftours.com .
EF Educational Tours is a division of EF Education First, the world leader in international education. Founded in 1965, EF’s mission is to open the world through education. To date, EF has helped more than 15 million people learn a language, discover the world or earn an academic degree.

job_title: Backend Python Developer for a Machine Learning Startup
summary:
Join a team redesigning how machines can learn, making it easier to apply machine learning to medium data through cloud-based machine learning software.

You'll build backend systems and data pipelines for their product, collaborate others to define the product strategy and learn more about the machine learning sphere.

How this role accelerates your career :
1.) Hang out with seriously smart teammates . They’re mostly PhDs.
2.) Tackle complex problems. They’re working on harnessing the benefits of both Bayesian programming and of deep machine learning, thereby creating better AI systems.
3.) Be a lead individual contributor . Work independently, but also collaborate with others.

The team:
The team is made up of 13 physicists and data scientists and a couple of web developers. They split up into 2 groups-- one doing customer facing modeling in the language they wrote (which is implemented as a Python library), one in the back-end developing more of that language. It’s an informal split and they move between groups. Occasionally they also work in C.
They follow Agile processes, but not 100%.
Their work is so groundbreaking they received the single largest investment in machine learning by the federal government and closed a seed round of investment.

You might be their team’s puzzle piece if :
1.) You think machine learning sounds fascinating.
2.) You have 2+ years of backend experience, preferably but not necessarily in Python.
3.) You've already been part of a team that has built and launched at least two customer-facing web apps.
4.) You are generous -- with time, with helping other people and in the way you live your life.
5.) You work great as an individual, but also love the idea of working closely with the machine learning R&D; and biz dev teams.
6.) You are based in the Boston area or are willing to relocate.
7.) You are authorized to work in the U.S.

Special bonus for:
1.) Degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or related field.
2.) You've worked with API design or AWS in a customer data storage context.

job_title: Visual Setup Designer - Mobile, Tablet, and Web
summary:
About You


Our band is large. And while there’s plenty of room for all kinds of personalities and skill sets to succeed, there are certain qualities that will help you thrive here.


Like a never-accept-less work ethic. An exceptionally low ego-to-talent ratio (none of the first, tons of the latter). A relentless craving to push past your limits and try new things. The smarts and the humble confidence to take on big challenges, make mistakes fast and early, embrace tough feedback, then recover quickly with fresh, startlingly perfect solutions. A fearless willingness to defend great work. And a tendency to totally geek out on music.


If this sounds like you, read on and let’s connect soon.


What You’ll Do


• Provide visual design expertise for the Sonos onboarding experience 
• Work closely with designers and creative directors across the UX and ID teams 
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product managers, software developers and brand 
• Advocate for Sonos users as you strive to make the right product 
• Travel to other Sonos offices, up to 10% of time, and travel to partner locations as needed.


Skills You’ll Need


• Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline, such as graphic design, user experience design, user interface design, industrial design 
• 5+ years of professional experience 
• A proven track record in visual design, illustration and motion design for mobile apps 
• A robust understanding of the display considerations for iOS and Android 
• Ability to create and leverage visual mockups and prototypes 
• Detailed knowledge of industry standard tools, including Sketch and Adobe Creative Suite 
• Strong communication skills and the ability to thrive in cross-functional teams 
• Aptitude for taking input from multiple sources and synthesizing it into coherent designs 
• Deep experience working with software engineers in the Agile process 
• A current portfolio available for viewing


How to Audition


Apply now, include attachments or links to your portfolio. 
If there is a strong match, we'll reach out!


More About Our Band


In 2002, we set out to reinvent home audio for the digital age. Our mission–to fill every home with amazing sounding music. Yes, it was an ambitious goal. Challenging, too. And that hasn’t changed.


Since those early days, we’ve remained tirelessly focused on finding innovative ways to make listening out loud, with friends and loved ones, the truly transformative experience it should be. We’ve seen our vision capture the imaginations of music lovers in more than 60 countries, as we’ve continued to introduce products, software, and technologies that help people share the songs they love, discover new music they never knew existed, and experience richer, more musical lives.


At Sonos, we are building a team with extraordinary talent to help us fill every home with music. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related technical field is required (or equivalent experience), plus a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree. Agile experience preferred.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is preferred at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Bluefin Robotics in Quincy, Massachusetts is looking for a Software Engineer-Controls to be a member of a dynamic, energetic software engineering team designing and developing state-of-the-art applications for autonomous underwater vehicles (AUVs). You will work on software encompassing the full life-cycle of AUV operations, from embedded vehicle control code to GUI-based tools for planning and monitoring. Excellent programming skills, specifically in C/C++
User interface Web Development
Able to work both independently and as part of a product development team
Linux and Windows experience highly desirable;
Hardware experience a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Solid problem solving and troubleshooting skills

.

With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

Your Team:
Should you join American Well and the Engineering team, you can expect:
The development organization is a multi-disciplinary team of engineers dedicated to creating a state of the art TeleHealth experience on every platform we can get our hands on. Our cross-functional teams follow a pragmatic Agile methodology as we balance feature requests, strategic initiatives, tech debt, and exciting partnerships on the path to delivering a market leading product to a quickly growing customer base. We work hand in hand with the whole American Well organization to ensure that our product meets the needs of all of our users.
Whether you’re an advocate for the latest and greatest iOS and Android features, are committed to the ideal back-end architecture, or are dedicated to providing the best web usability, we have a place for you on our team.
Working at American Well
American Well is changing how care is delivered through online and mobile technology. We make online doctor visits accessible to everyone for one-off care issues like colds or infections, and chronic condition management, such as diabetes or depression. We make the hard work of healthcare look easy and that requires a mission-driven mentality. We’re a “go getter” culture that pride itself on smarts, initiative, creative thinking, and a strong work ethic.
Our corporate headquarters are located in downtown Boston at 75 State Street –in the heart of the city.  Free gym access – on-site
 Prime office space with views overlooking all of Boston
 Complimentary snacks and drinks

job_title: Amazon Web Services (DMS) - Software Developer - Boston, MA
summary:
DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) Database Migration Service is looking for rock-star full stack engineers to build world-class services for our customers. If you’re an application engineer, and you have the skills to create highly scalable, reliable, distributed applications, then AWS is looking for you. You will work on architecting, designing and implementing high performant applications that enable our customers the ability to migrate data to AWS Services and Databases.


Help us revolutionize the Cloud! AWS is the fastest growing division within Amazon.


AWS Database Migration Service helps you migrate databases to AWS easily and securely. With AWS Database Migration Service, the source database remains fully operational during the migration, minimizing downtime to applications that rely on the database.


We are looking for a Software Development Engineer to join our team and help us take the service and the tools to the next level. To apply for this role, you should possess solid analytical, design and problem diagnosis skills. Expertise with high-performance systems or service design is a plus as well as a deep expertise in one or more relational database engines. The ability to translate high-level technical requirements through all the levels of the software stack is essential. If this sounds like you, come join us in our Boston, MA campus and help AWS continue to write the cloud computing story for the industry.


More information on AWS DMS is available at http://aws.amazon.com/dms


Who you are:

· Highly-motivated and thrive in an environment where problems are open-ended.

· Enjoy engaging in passionate discussions with smart people and letting the best ideas rise to the top.

· Have built applications using Java based stacks such as Spring and Hibernate

· Strong understanding of CS fundamentals, Object Oriented Design and Data Structures.

· Genuinely excited about technology, have a strong interest in learning and playing with the latest technologies.


Help us revolutionize the Cloud! AWS is the fastest growing division within Amazon.


Basic Qualifications
Basic Basic Qualifications:

Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or equivalent, Masters or PhD preferred
3+ years (or much more for Senior Developers) professional experience in software development
Proficient in one or more modern programming languages such as Java, C++, or C. JDBC, Hibernate, or JPA. We use Java and C within the DMS team
Knowledge of data structures, algorithms, operating systems, and/or distributed systems

Preferred Qualifications
Preferred Qualifications:

Deep knowledge of the relational database engines like SQLServer, Oracle, MySQL and Postgres.
Working knowledge/experience with Relational or NoSQL databases
Knowledge and experience working with networking, virtualization and Linux kernel modules are a plus
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Motivated to drive tasks to completion and take ownership of projects.
Demonstrated passion for user experience design and improving usability.
Ability to work in a fast paced and agile development environment.

summary:
As a Technical Team Lead you will work as part of a top-performing team to deliver high-quality search engine marketing SaaS solutions to market. You will be able to work with minimal direction, balance multiple requirements, and coordinate efforts within our Engineering team, Product Management, and QA.
The individual we are looking for is a quick thinker, enthusiastic, and passionate about the web and SaaS. As a technical team lead you will be both hands-on developing and helping lead the Manage PPC development team. If you’re excited about small teams, fast-paced environments, new technologies, the open-source software stack, and you love writing code, we’d like to hear from you!
The Manage PPC feature team owns building new features, supporting existing features and supporting API upgrades for the AdWords and Bing Ads APIs. The Manage PPC part of our tool is the core engine which allows users to manage their PPC Ad Accounts, making changes to campaigns, bids, keywords, etc. The team lead owns the planning, grooming and overall delivery of this track of work.
The candidate needs to be detailed orientated, able to work with vendor API support teams, and enjoy the heavy lifting of working with complex APIs and data structures.
All of our offerings are delivered as software as a service via the web. Our technology stack includes Amazon Web Services, Google AdWords API, Bing Ads API, Python, HTML5, JavaScript, PostgreSQL, and Linux.

Equally adept at both designing/developing and leading other developers to deliver scalable, robust software solutions. Full stack developer preferred.

WordStream develops search marketing software, provides managed PPC advertising services, and shares online marketing advice through our blog. We even run and support our own GNU/Linux distribution!

About EditShare
EditShare is a leading developer of networked shared storage and tapeless end-to-end workflow solutions for the television and film industry. Our products include video capture and playout servers, high-performance central shared storage, archiving and backup software, database-backed media asset management, and even the world's first 3-platform (Windows/OS X/Linux) professional non-linear video editing application.


EditShare was founded in Boston in 2004. The principals all came from television and film production themselves and started the company with the idea that serious workflow improvements were needed in the industry. Today, EditShare has nearly 3500 customers worldwide, ranging from major broadcasters such as ION Networks in the USA and ITV in the UK; to high-end production companies such as PS 260, Atlas Media, and Sharp Entertainment in New York; and to the Oprah Winfrey Channel and Carson Daly in Los Angeles. We have installations at over 500 colleges and universities around the world. We are at cable television stations and corporate video departments large and small.


The spirit at EditShare is very much that of a rising technology powerhouse challenging the traditional players in the industry. We produce 5 product lines with a relatively modest number of developers. Everybody's opinion is valued and counts here. There are unlimited opportunities to have your good ideas incorporated into our products. Our release cycle is measured in months, not years.

EditShare is seeking a highly-talented developer eager to work on GNU/Linux-based video workflow products in our Watertown office. Technologies in our products span the entire computing stack, from low-level kernel modules and optimizations, to high-performance distributed storage and network applications, to user-facing cross-platform and web-based client applications. We even run and support our own GNU/Linux distribution!


If you love working on a wide variety of technologies with a small team of motivated engineers, then this may be the job for you.


Your responsibilities would include:
Writing software in Python for managing a Linux based network attached storage appliance

Being involved in the full software lifecycle
Working with stakeholders on design and understanding user requirements
Implementing high-quality, robust, maintainable code
Code review, both responding to review of your own code and reviewing that of your colleagues
Testing, both writhing automated tests and communicating with QA on manual testing
Build, packaging, and deployment of code
Helping to solve problems escalated by tech support

Shell scripting
C or C++
Networked or distributed systems
System administration
Installing and configuring Linux servers
User management, roles, permissions, and ACLs
Networking configuration
LDAP, Kerberos, and Active Directory
Filesystems and network attached storage
Cross platform development on Linux, macOS, and Windows
Developing web applications using modern frameworks (such as React, AngularJS, Angular, Ember, etc.)
An open source gui toolkit (such as Qt or Gtk+)
Linux packaging (e.g for Debian)

DevOps

Continuous integration
Automated testing

To apply for this open position, please send your resume, cover letter, and code samples or a link to a programming portfolio to This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it. . Also, we're always interested to hear if you have experience working with video and audio or contributing to open source projects.


About EditShare
EditShare is a leading developer of networked shared storage and tapeless end-to-end workflow solutions for the television and film industry. Our products include video capture and playout servers, high-performance central shared storage, archiving and backup software, database-backed media asset management, and even the world's first 3-platform (Windows/OS X/Linux) professional non-linear video editing application.


EditShare was founded in Boston in 2004. The principals all came from television and film production themselves and started the company with the idea that serious workflow improvements were needed in the industry. Today, EditShare has nearly 3500 customers worldwide, ranging from major broadcasters such as ION Networks in the USA and ITV in the UK; to high-end production companies such as PS 260, Atlas Media, and Sharp Entertainment in New York; and to the Oprah Winfrey Channel and Carson Daly in Los Angeles. We have installations at over 500 colleges and universities around the world. We are at cable television stations and corporate video departments large and small.


The spirit at EditShare is very much that of a rising technology powerhouse challenging the traditional players in the industry. We produce 5 product lines with a relatively modest number of developers. Everybody's opinion is valued and counts here. There are unlimited opportunities to have your good ideas incorporated into our products. Our release cycle is measured in months, not years.

Panorama is on a mission to radically improve student outcomes by helping educators act on data. Today, more than 400 school systems serving five million students use Panorama to ensure that each child is getting the support they need, so that more students succeed in school, graduate, and go on to college. Panorama helps educators monitor how students are doing across academics, attendance, behavior, and college readiness, and then coordinate action to support each child. Panorama’s platform also helps educators get data about non-academic factors that are key to each child’s success in school and in life, such as social-emotional skills, safety, teacher-student relationships, and family engagement. Panorama has raised a $32mm led by Emerson Collective as well as Spark Capital, Owl Ventures, SoftTechVC, and the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative.

Our engineers are changing history way beyond git rebase -i. The engineering team is involved in every step of the product cycle, working closely with many other teams (and our users!) to brainstorm and build solutions to education’s toughest problems. Sure, we have strong technical chops, but we make sure to constantly challenge ourselves and grow. From lunchtime guest talks and weekly book clubs ( http://engineering.panoramaed.com/our-engineering-book-club/ ) to hackathons ( http://blog.panoramaed.com/panorama-education-hackathon-2014/ ) and open-source projects (both in the office ( https://github.com/panorama-ed ) and outside it ( http://www.betaboston.com/news/2015/02/24/like-a-waze-for-the-t-mbta-ninja-lets-bostonians-crowdsource-trouble-on-their-commute/ )), we try to improve ourselves as we help schools around the world do the same.

In this role, you will:

Work on fascinating and challenging problems, like:
Learning recommendation engines that correlate educator data with community-generated content.
Optical mark recognition infrastructure capable of processing millions of sheets of paper per day.
Novel data visualizations that uncover insights from school districts’ dizzying variety of data sets.
Design, write, test, review, debug, deploy, and occasionally be frustrated by code.
Never put developer ease or convenience over making a difference to the millions of students we serve.

Our ideal candidate:

Loves to learn and be challenged.
Is a strong coder in any language (we primarily use Ruby and JavaScript, but it’s okay if you haven’t—see the previous bullet point).
Has significant experience with web app development and deployment—Unix and testing and uptime, oh my!
Is a great communicator and collaborator. We’re a close-knit team! Check out our blog: http://engineering.panoramaed.com/

Panorama Education is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive company because we serve students, educators and families from tremendously diverse backgrounds and identities across the country; we’ve seen how our product and impact are strengthened the more we reflect that diversity. In addition, we have found (and we believe the research) that diverse teams are higher-performing, and we embrace the varied perspectives that our team members share with each other.

Company Details

Building Blocks help global companies solve complex problems with digital technologies. We work with clients to identify digital opportunities that will increase revenues, develop relationships and improve efficiencies. Our design, technical and operational expertise then put those opportunities into practice - rapidly, reliably and at global scale.

We have always worked with ambitious organizations who offer their products and services internationally. We understand the need to balance centralized consistency with local flexibility and offerings to support the specific goals of local market teams. We have rolled out 100’s of websites in over 100 different local countries.

Our team sits in Boston, Manchester and Zaragoza. We are a team of 75 people and growing, quickly. Building Blocks is also part of an international group of leading digital agencies – Dept ( https://www.deptagency.com/ ) helping to expand its international presence. From our offices across Europe and the US, 500 of the most talented and experienced people in our industry combine creativity, technology and data to deliver digital products and services that build brands, grow businesses and make people’s lives easier.

Overall Purpose of the Role

We are looking for a Technical Consultant to join our growing team, working across client projects. You must be motivated to design and deliver innovative solutions that integrate and utilize our technology partners’ products to provide real business value to our clients. The role includes technical architecture, solution design, and client facing and expectation management aspects.

You will be confident and knowledgeable in a wide range of current technologies and processes, and we would expect you to develop collaborative working relationships with customers to produce solutions in a way that satisfies their expectations. In return, Building Blocks will help progress your career with training opportunities, support and experience.

The position is currently available in our Boston office and this role will require travel to client sites across North America.

Key Responsibilities


Work with business stakeholders to provide technical solutions that deliver to business needs.
Lead design, estimation, planning and implementation technology solutions.
Provide best practice points of view in a consultative manner to our clients’ senior technical leaders.
Provide technical direction for our North American team of developers.
Create documentation that can convey detailed and complicated technical matters in clear and concise way.
Deliver compelling presentations of a technical nature to client stakeholders.
Design innovative technical solutions and reusable components that can be actively sold to customers.
Investigate new technologies, creating POCs and supervising their implementation for customer.

Technical/Specialist Skills and/or Experience


At least 2 years’ consultancy or leadership experience
Preferably a Certified SDL Tridion, Sitecore or e-Spirit Developer or Architect.
Architecture and System Design experience.
Development and deployment of large, multi-lingual implementations.
Experience of Agile methodology is desirable.
Strong knowledge and experience web development project lifecycles.
Demonstrable consulting skills, including client relationships and team facilitation.
Well-developed organizational and interpersonal communications skills.
General understanding of the business environment, models and motivations.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, meeting facilitation, presentation and documentation.
Good business analysis/redesign skills with architecture and implementation experience.
Requirements analysis, conceptual, logical and detailed design skills.
Ability to manage work for multiple projects simultaneously.
Confident problem solver.
Appreciation of current technologies and techniques (.NET, CSS, SOA, AJAX, Silverlight).
Eager to learn and keep up with technological advances.
Sense of humor and ability to build relationships in a team environment.

Our core principles

We do things properly - We always focus on delivering quality, no matter what the task. We don’t cut corners and always strive to find the right solution for every challenge. We work with integrity and are dedicated to delivering excellence across the entire business.

We aim to be the best - We’re all passionate about what we do, so we focus on continually improving for the good of both our own personal development and the goals of the business. We’re confident in our ability to take ownership, and tackle everything with a proactive mind-set.

We’re open and honest - We are always approachable and transparent with our communications. Our opinions are open, constructive and respected by all members of the team, and the clients we work with.

We trust each other - We all appreciate the contribution of each and every one of our colleagues. We treat each other with respect and dignity, and know that we can rely on each other to provide help, support and guidance whenever it’s needed.

We’re all in it together - We don’t believe in blame, just in finding solutions to tackle even the hardest of challenges. We all have individual areas of expertise, and our success comes from our consistent collaboration.

Remuneration & Benefits Package

Excellent package dependent on experience

At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.
Job summary
Guide the strategic success of our customers using Red Hat's open source software. The Red Hat Open Innovation Labs team is looking for a Consulting Engineer to join us in our new, state-of-the-art Seaport office facility in Boston, MA. In this role, you will work as part of a team composed of some the of brightest developers in the open source industry, partnering with our customers to build innovative software systems. You’ll work in a residency-style engagement where consulting engineers work together with customers in small teams to build, test, and iterate over application prototypes attached to real business value. As a Consulting Engineer, you will use a variety of modern application development practices along with emerging technologies from the communities of open source to get it done. Our vision at Red Hat is to be the defining technology company of the 21st century. We're powered by open source and our culture reflects it.
Primary job responsibilities
Team up with Red Hat and the open source community to engineer Open Innovation Labs-based software solutions designed to further accelerate our customers' success at the Open Innovation Labs
Become a trusted advisor to our customers, helping them achieve business success in an ever-changing technology landscape
Use your critical thinking skills to tackle tough problems in an innovative way
Willingness to travel to customer locations up to 75%
Team up with our customers to rapidly build application prototypes in our lab, using modern application development practices and open source emerging technologies that cover the following:

Microservices, API management, and web-scale architectures
DevOps engineering and application delivery
Container-based continuous delivery (CD)
Cloud automation and everything-as-code
Required skills
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related technical discipline
Significant development and delivery experience with full-stack web and mobile application development in a variety of languages that may include HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, PHP, Node.js, AngularJS, JSON, Cordova, or Ionic
Experience in test automation for web and mobile applications
Experience converting web design into HTML and CSS
Applied knowledge of design patterns applicable to modern software development
Applied knowledge of working in agile, scrum, and DevOps teams
Ability to perform customer-facing activities in a fast-paced environment with short timeframes
Comfortable working with highly distributed teams, including interaction with open source communities
Applied knowledge of modern software test and delivery methods like test-driven development (TDD), behavior-driven development (BDD), continuous integration (CI), and CD
Solid written and verbal communication and presentation skills
The ability to quickly learn and put into practice new knowledge
Passion for open source software
Experience in design is a plus, including creating clean, modern design flats and wireframes for web and mobile

The Interactive Media Developer will play a key role in assessing, upgrading and adapting the functionality, design and contents of MTA websites, social media and other forms of electronic communications. The position calls for a combination of technical skills, including website development and design ability, along with a command of the strategic use of current social media platforms and adaptability to emerging electronic communications approaches and technologies.

Job Duties Develops, designs, maintains and edits websites and social media channels and posts content of all types. Upgrades and refines usability and technical aspects of MTA websites and social media platforms, including, but not limited to, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube and Flickr. Integrates diverse technologies into MTA websites, including video and interactive services. job_title: Amazon (AWS) - Systems Development Engineer - Cambridge, MA
summary:
Amazon Web Services

Lead Systems Development Engineer - Cambridge, MA.


We are looking for both Windows and Linux developers to design, build and launch a new AWS service. Come join the Amazon Web Services (AWS) engineering team in our new Seaport office in Boston as we revolutionize the world of cloud storage.


Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon, with over a million active customers in 190 countries around the world. AWS has been continually expanding its services to support virtually any cloud workload, and it now has more than 90 services that range from compute, storage, networking, database, analytics, application services, deployment, management, developer, mobile, Internet of Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), security, hybrid and enterprise applications. We maintain this rapid pace of innovation by treating each team like its own startup inside AWS, directly accountable for their customers’ satisfaction, service innovations, ambitious growth, and meeting revenue goals.


As a Software Engineer in this office, you will design a build a service that is secure, reliable, and scalable. Delivering a reliable and high-performance service at AWS scale requires engineers with extraordinary technical expertise and boundless creativity. At Amazon, we expect engineers like to you interact with customers, to understand our business goals, to innovate rapidly and deliver high-quality and ground-breaking functionality.


Embark on a journey with us to build a new service for Amazon AWS. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help build this exciting new service for Amazon. This is an opportunity to shape the future of a new service at Amazon scale with a team that is super smart, driven to serve customers, and fun to work with in a start-up like environment.


Basic Qualifications
Basic Qualifications:

BS degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, other technical degree, or related experience
6+ years professional experience in commercial or web-scale system engineering
1+ years of team leadership experience

Expert skill in a scripting language such as Bash, Python, or Ruby
Experience running and maintaining a 24x7 large scale production computing environment
Strong Linux or Windows system administration

Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong analytical skills, with excellent problem solving abilities
Passion for technical leadership and mentoring

Preferred Qualifications
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deployment management tools such as Puppet, Chef, or Ansible
Experience with a modern programming language such as C, C++, or Java
Understanding of network fundamentals
Understanding of distributed storage performance challenges and their solutions
Experience with secure system configuration and security principles
Experience developing a 24x7 production environment using Amazon Web Services such as EC2, EBS, and S3

Ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment For more information on Amazon Web Services please visit: http://aws.amazon.com/

As a Senior Software Engineer at CareDash, you will collaborate closely with a team of highly skilled developers, designer and managers to design, develop and maintain CareDash’s platform, products and its portfolio of media entities. You will be one of the driving forces behind the architectural design of our infrastructure and the development of new services and features. You’ll influence and shape the growth of our technology stack, and will be an integral part of a close-knit engineering team.

Who You Are:

You have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, another related field, or equivalent experience.
5-7 years of relevant web development and backend server experience.
Bonus if you are fluent in awesome scripting languages such as Python.
Experience designing scalable systems in service-oriented environments
Strong understanding of object-oriented design, software development principles and best practices.
Up-to-date knowledge of latest trends in web application development and database systems
You have a thirst for knowledge in cloud technologies like AWS.
You like to eliminate technical debt and go the extra mile to keep it low
You have worked in serious Docker DevOps environments and enjoy the challenge of building clean deployment architectures

Responsibilities may include:

Design and execute database strategies and SQL components to interact with dynamically configured database schemas.
Develop and maintain lifecycle management processes.
Work with teams to proactively identify and eliminate sources of risk in our platforms.
Implementing Microservice architecture and RESTful API designs
Proactively learn new technologies and work towards the continual improvement of our technologies.
Manage PostgreSQL and MySQL servers across multiple environments.
Develop highly optimized database solutions using tables, stored procedures, functions, views and indexes
Work closely with team members to ensure data integrity and database quality.
Participate in full testing process through unit testing and bug fixes as well implementation of automated test suites.

Qualifications may include:

Demonstrated experience and aptitude with one or more database platforms including PSQL and/or MySQL with an emphasis on schema design, query optimization, and infrastructure build out
Experience implementing full stack web technologies at scale
Excellent software engineering/computer science skills and habits: object-oriented design, unit testing, automated integration testing, data structures, etc.
Familiarity with ORM tools such SQLAlchemy and Database migration tools
Working Knowledge of system Caching techniques using technologies such as Redis, Memcached
A hands-on attitude and a willingness to get things done.
A desire to always be expanding and improving your skill-set.

Here at CareDash, we know that experience and qualifications come in many shapes and sizes. We value passion and a willingness to learn. Please consider applying if your experience is close to what we are looking for, as we believe that diversity is a fundamental strength. We are committed to adding new and different perspectives to our team which is why we encourage individuals of all races, ethnicities, religions, ages, sex, genders, sexual orientations and gender identities to apply.

Description: Vecna Cares, a humanitarian technology NGO, seeks an enthusiastic Software Developer who is passionate about making a positive real-world impact in underserved settings throughout the world. You will use your technical expertise across a variety of projects focused on implementing cutting-edge technologies in low-resource settings to create a measurable impact. Current projects include: developing an Electronic Medical Records System for refugee camps and rural health facilities in Kenya, Zanzibar, Haiti, and Nigeria; deploying a web application to monitor safe births in labor wards in Kenya; and developing and implementing a data management system to track athlete data for the Special Olympics. This position relies on a strong software development skillset coupled with a drive for creative solutions to global challenges. The Software Developer is a part of a mission-oriented, dynamic team that is determined to provide leading medical technologies in challenging areas in order to create a measurable impact.
Responsibilities:
Designing and developing flexible and scalable Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems for diverse underserved health systems;
Developing features across the technology stack for rapid deployment and evaluation in the field;
Collaborating with top UI/UX designers, project managers, hardware engineers, and quality assurance test engineers to deliver robust health system platforms.
Shaping and aligning the product roadmap with client needs and market opportunities.
Responsibilities: A qualified candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree (or a foreign equivalent degree) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or a related field followed by one year of experience as a Software Developer, Computer Programmer, or Fellow building global health information systems. The one year of software development experience, which may be gained concurrently, must have focused on using Java, jQuery, SQL, Spring, Struts, and Hibernate to develop full-stack enterprise scaled web applications. The required experience must have been in an Agile development environment using Scrum. Interested applicants should apply through our website:
https://www.vecna.com/careers

Eagle Creek Software Services is a CRM and eCommerce services firm and the largest dedicated provider of on-shore and rural sourcing services in the US. Eagle Creek Software focuses on implementing, upgrading and extending the useful life of CRM, BI, and allied technologies. People are attracted to Eagle Creek for our focus; for our success, (rapid growth since 1999); for the opportunity to work on the largest and most innovative projects in the US with Fortune 1000 clients; and for our reputation for high quality.

Since 2005, Eagle Creek has leveraged US based on-shore/off-site Consultants in our multiple Technology Centers. This has given us the ability to provide our clients with a cost-comparable alternative to off-shoring for many reasons:

Technology Centers in the heart of the United States

No more than two time zones away from the client

No more than a half day trip to inspect a project or engagement

Dedicated technological focus – CRM, BI, eCommerce

The capability of delivering any phase and any size engagement

Supported by the most extensive onsite consulting team in the industry

We are seeking individuals with experience in Java development, designing, developing, and debugging Java applications or other applications for Eagle Creek’s clients. In this capacity, you will be responsible for providing documentation when necessary on procedures and code habits. You will serve as an expert in the knowledge of development standards, procedures, and tools throughout the development lifecycle, and ensure code reusability.

Required Skills:
Two to five or more years of Java development experience.

Prior experience using a common database such as Oracle, SQL, or another similar database management system.

Bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science, information systems, software engineering, or related field, or equivalent.

Understand standard business practices.

Must be able to communicate effectively with a team, management, and anyone in Eagle Creek or our client organizations.

Must be willing to develop skills in correspondence with changing technologies.

Must be willing to work out of one of our technology centers in Eden Prairie, Minnesota, Pierre or Vermillion, South Dakota, or Valley City, North Dakota. Technology center locations vary based on need.

Desired Skills:
Experience developing code in environments using agile practices, scrum methodology, or test-driven development.

Specific technologies related to the current position.

Experience with Hibernate, Swing, or Struts.

Experience with open source frameworks.

Experience with web-based technologies such as HTML, XML, SOAP, RESTful, and Web Services.

Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.

Job Code
383057 IT Specialist
Duties & Responsibilities
The Growth Lab at Harvard’s Center for International Development (CID) seeks to answer why some countries grow while others remain mired in poverty. Our team takes government data, combines it with our research methodology on growth and turns it into interactive data tools affecting citizens and policy at the highest international levels. This is a unique opportunity for a committed and enthusiastic UI/UX & Data Visualization Designer to join a technical team innovating to improve the livelihoods of millions of people around the world

Our development team is working with large data sets, developing exploratory data visualization applications and platforms, and bringing forth insights and information in an accessible way to a variety of users, including policymakers around the world.

In this position, you will make a meaningful contribution to the development and enhancement of our online platforms, including our flagship tool, the Atlas of Economic Complexity, produced by the Growth Lab. The Atlas is an innovative online platform used by policymakers, investors, entrepreneurs and academics to interactively visualize a country’s trade and explore growth opportunities for every country worldwide.

The designer will collaborate with a small, fast-paced technology team working on the visualization of data and analysis from CID’s Growth Lab research. The designer will be expected to work closely with our current backend/data engineer, frontend developer, product manager and among an interdisciplinary group of researchers and academics to learn, solve, design, and deploy. In this role, a designer should enjoy toggling between visualization and UI/UX design on a regular basis.

This role requires a designer to take the creative lead on the design of the Atlas, sub-national Atlases and other related research projects. To do so, a successful candidate will demonstrate adaptability, reliability and mature communication and collaboration skills. On this team, a designer must be comfortable self-directing their daily activities, without micromanagement, to meet ambitious roadmap deadlines.

Position responsibilities:
Sketch, wireframe and prototype new features and experiences based on user feedback
Conceptualize and create new visualizations that support large data sets and sophisticated research methodologies
Conduct user interviews to understand various personas, workflows and user demands
Help solve a variety of related ad hoc, design-related issues encountered by CID researchers
Collaborate closely with our product manager, developers and users across the full software lifecycle: requirement discovery, planning, design, development, releasing and maintenance
Basic Qualifications
3+ years of experience designing web experiences, including data-heavy visualizations
Additional Qualifications
Strong visualization (d3.js) development skills
Comfortable navigating Adobe Creative Suite
Experience with responsive design
Familiar with HTML/CSS/JS
Familiar with Git and Git workflows
Exhibit design maturity and professionalism by: (1) Creating and maintaining design documentation, (2) Identifying and expressing trade-offs when making decisions, rather than arguing for “right” and “wrong” and (3) Positioning your work within the broader context of our daily processes, problems, and technical decisions
Experience working across a full design and development workflow from conception to prototyping to release
Ability to communicate professionally with a variety of technical and non-technical stakeholders
Eagerly adapt to an ever-changing role that’s oriented towards solving challenges the team is facing rather than staying within a single purview
Curious and self-starting when it comes to learning unfamiliar languages, tools and frameworks
Experience or interest in working with frameworks like React, Ember or Angular
Basic familiarity with Python
Fluent spoken and written English
Spanish language ability or interest in learning
Keen interest in economic and social development issues
In addition to your application, applicants should be prepared to show a diverse portfolio that demonstrates core UI/UX principles, patterns and best practices.
Additional Information
Harvard University requires pre-employment reference and background checks.
Harvard University is committed to supporting a healthy, sustainable learning and working environment.

This position is a fully benefits-eligible term appointment ending one year from the date of hire with the possibility of renewal.
