job_title: Software Engineer Intern, Adobe Document Cloud Ideation Team
summary:
About Adobe Document Cloud:
Adobe Document Cloud is revolutionizing the way the world works with documents. It’s the newest cloud offering at Adobe, and a very exciting place to be. The Document Cloud combines a collection of online services integrated with Adobe Reader and Adobe Acrobat. Our subscription base is growing rapidly and we are continually rolling out new features and services. We work in small, agile teams with considerable autonomy and we value engineers with technical competence, creativity, flexibility, strong customer focus and an eagerness for learning and collaboration.
The Challenge:
What you and your team will be doing:
* Help us build our analysis pipeline, scaling into the millions of documents
* Develop algorithms to understand the structure of documents in a variety of formats
* Help analyze the performance of various experiments and competing algorithms
* Work with Adobe’s research teams to take the state of the art in research and make great products and features
* We will also be meeting customers to learn more about how they work and what solutions we can offer. Projects will include building prototypes, validating key learnings, and ultimately putting solutions into production as new features or even new offerings. As a developer in an agile organization, you will also:
* Participate in story mapping, backlog grooming, daily standups, retrospectives, and sprint reviews on a two-week cadence
* Take responsibility for each other’s success
* Work effectively in a fast-paced and ever-evolving environment
* Learn new tools and technologies
What you will need to succeed:
Enrolled in sophomore year or higher at a college/university or any year at a graduate school and working towards a BS or MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field.
Academic or professional/internship experience with Java, Python or R with specific experience and interest in Machine Learning and Computer Vision.
Coursework that strongly reflects interests in Algorithm Design, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Statistical Data Analysis or other Data Science related areas.
Working knowledge of HTML and web technologies
Ability to quickly learn new technologies
Be a self-starter and possess strong sense of self-motivation with strong critical thinking and communication skills
At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.
If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.
Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age , sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Software Developer, Staff - 00048875 - (00048875)
Description

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

Job Highlights
Do you like smart cookies? Are you driven by a greater mission? Join MITRE IT’s Web Development department to deliver services and applications for MITRE’s employees and work with those who are dedicated to making the world a safer place. You and your co-workers, are the best and brightest engineers across a wide array of disciplines, addressing problems in the public interest.
You will play a key role in improving the findability and usability of MITRE’s wealth of knowledge. There will be opportunities to help us make a difference and expand your skills in mobile application development, data science, and machine learning as we define our future architectures. Best of all, you will be joining and supporting MITRE’s greatest resource – its engaged and savvy workforce – in MITRE’s mission to make the world a safer place.
Key Functions
Write easy to read, maintainable, testable code
Work closely with other developers, designers, testers and project leads in a supportive working environment
Develop small to medium size software application projects. You will play multiple roles in getting new projects off the ground and executing to production deployment
Enhance and maintain existing applications written in a variety of languages and frameworks
Qualifications

Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science, mathematics, or related degree, or 3+ years of experience working with enterprise web applications
1+ year of hands-on development of enterprise web applications. Preferably in Python, JavaScript/Node.js, C# or Java, but we know a strong developer is a strong developer in almost any language
Proven task and time management skills, and a proactive communicator.
Motivated to learn and teach new technologies
Experience with modern software methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
Working knowledge of Source Control systems (Git and/or Subversion), Database Systems (Oracle and MongoDB are a plus), build/deploy/Continuous Integration systems (Bamboo, Jenkins, etc.), Linux command line, and unit testing concepts and frameworks.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with PowerShell or other Windows scripting
Experience with front end JS libraries and frameworks – jQuery, React and/or AngularJS
Experience with mobile development – native iOS or Android, responsive or progressive web apps.
Experience with search technologies – SharePoint, Elasticsearch
Experience with Machine Learning technologies/algorithms
Experience with Docker is a plus
Experience with Tableau is a plus

job_title: Sr. Software Engineer - Office of the CTO
summary:
Company Overview
Riverbed solutions help companies transition from legacy hardware to a new software-defined and cloud-centric approach to networking and application delivery for the digital age. The Riverbed Application Performance Platform™ takes Riverbed’s SD-WAN solution for agile networking that really works, and adds to this digital backbone industry-leading solutions for WAN optimization and hybrid networking, for branch IT orchestration, and for end-to-end visibility from device to cloud. All these solutions are integrated in a flexible, modular, digital architecture that delivers any apps, data and services from any public or private cloud across any network to any end-point, with the best possible user experience as determined by business policy.

Riverbed is a pre-IPO opportunity with over $1 billion in revenue headquartered in San Francisco with branch offices around the globe.
About this Position
Riverbed is looking for a full stack software engineer to join the SteelScript team in the Office of the CTO based in the Cambridge, MA office.
The SteelScript team owns a suite of open source Python modules that enable fully programmable access to Riverbed hardware and software. You will have the opportunity to work at multiple levels, from low-level REST APIs in Python to single page applications in JavaScript, from data analysis modules to new visualizations.

These open source projects demand strong skills in API development, modularization, clean code, testing and documentation. You will be faced with the challenges of creating complex new features with a simple and usable interface that the non-coder can use and the advanced developer can extend.

Communication skills are key, as the SteelScript team interfaces with a variety of people both inside and outside the company. We work closely with product-specific engineering teams to build out SDK support for their APIs. We provide support to Riverbed customers as well as our own professional services teams.

In a senior role, you will be expected to be highly productive with little oversight and show strong initiative and creativity. You like to jump in and help, leading by example. You enjoy writing up your work so others can take off where you left off.

You must be good at:
Python
Django or similar web framework
Linux
Communication (both verbal and written, internal and customer-facing)
Enthusiasm for learning new things

And even better if you have:
Experience with JavaScript
Experience with data analysis and visualization
Experience with databases and big data, especially elasticsearch
Networking background - at least an understanding of basic network concepts
Customer support experience
A willingness to travel

About Riverbed
Why Riverbed Technology?
If you are a high-achiever who wants to be part of a dynamically growing, billion dollar plus company, then you should look closely at Riverbed. We offer the rewarding experience of working with the best minds in the industry that are changing the world through cutting edge technology and applications. The company has been recognized multiple years for attracting and retaining today’s top talent as a great place to work by Glassdoor, Fortune magazine’s 20 Great Workplaces in Tech and by numerous other publications.

Learn more at www.riverbed.com.

Riverbed is proud to be an affirmative action (AA) and equal employment opportunities (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
LI-JG1

We are seeking talented and motivated software engineers to join the Aras Labs team . Aras Labs is chartered with pushing the envelope of what business software can be. We lead by example, building innovative new apps and services that help shape the future of industry.


The Labs team fills a unique niche at Aras. We get input from many different sources, both within Aras and in the broader community, to rapidly gather requirements and prototype applications that solve real problems. This hybrid role also gives us the opportunity to contribute to open-source projects and communicate with other developers (think developer advocate/developer evangelist).


The ideal Aras Labs candidate is able to sling code freely, but wants to use that ability to solve real-world business problems. As a team member, you will have the opportunity to work on technologies ranging from mobile apps one day to data-intensive cloud services the next. We need smart, flexible, nimble self-starters that can absorb new concepts fast and turn them into reality even faster.


Learn more about the Aras Labs team by visiting us on Twitter ( @ArasLabs ) or GitHub ( @ArasLabs ).


What You’ll Do

Research and recommend cutting edge technologies for future development
Rapidly assess business challenges and document use cases / requirements
Design applications, including data models, UX concepts and user workflows
Develop prototypes, proofs of concept and full applications
Publish your projects to open source repositories like GitHub
Demonstrate and explain the value of your solutions
Promote technical content and engage the Aras community via social channels (Twitter, blog posts, etc.)
Interact with the open PLM community to encourage development and sharing of ideas


What You Will Need
Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar
Development experience with Microsoft technologies, including C#, Visual Studio, SQL Server. Azure is a bonus.
Web development experience using HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, XML and JSON
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Bonus points for social media skills and/or mobile development experience
A desire to take charge and innovate


Benefits

In addition to the usual benefits (competitive salary, health and dental plans, FSA options), at Aras you will enjoy a culture of learning and growth. Attend a lunch & learn or training class; pop into Boston for a developer meetup or technical conference; immerse yourself in a team hackathon. And Aras culture isn't all about the work - it's about the people too. Whether joining the annual company picnic, our (very) competitive chili cook-off, or an informal dinner with the team, you'll be feeling like part of the Aras family in no time.


At Aras, you will have the opportunity to gain a broad base of experience covering the entire software development lifecycle. If you desire a challenge and would like to explore opportunities at Aras, submit your resume and a cover letter for consideration.

If you desire a challenge and would like to explore opportunities at Aras, submit your resume and a cover letter for consideration.

At ActBlue Technical Services, we build and power the premier online fundraising platform for Democratic campaigns, progressive organizations, and nonprofits working to create a better future. We put power in the hands of small-dollar donors and make giving online as easy as possible. Since 2004, campaigns and organizations across the country have raised almost $2 billion using our tools, with an average contribution size of $30 right now. Thousands of groups from presidential candidates to environmental organizations to local school board members count on our fundraising tools to fuel their organizing work.

If you’ve ever given online to a Democratic candidate or progressive organization, chances are you’ve used our software. With midterm elections on the horizon for 2018, we’re busier than ever helping small-dollar donors resist Trump’s administration.

We are seeking a full-time devops engineer to join our existing devops team. You’ll have significant responsibility right out of the gate and a voice in designing our architecture. We offer autonomy, responsibility, and amazing in-office and remote colleagues geeking out about politics and tech all day, plus generous benefits. You could work remotely from anywhere in the U.S., or from our office in Davis Square, Somerville MA.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:
---------------------


Managing, monitoring, extending our mission critical web application infrastructure across multiple data centers in a no downtime environment.
Being part of an on-call rotation. When alarms ring we respond immediately and effectively.
Learning from alarms. After an event, we learn from it, improving our infrastructure, monitoring, or applications to keep the same issue from ringing alarms again.
Working with application developers and product “customers” to deploy and monitor new services repeatably, at scale, in cloud services.
Building visualizations of our data, to understand the performance of our systems and recommend improvements to remove bottlenecks and points of failure.
Discovering, testing, deploying upgrades to or replacement of components of our infrastructure, from simple OS packages, to database version upgrades, to wholesale replacements. (Maybe it’s time to move from Apache to nginx? Choose between monit and upstart?)

WHAT YOU'LL BE WORKING WITH:
----------------------------


Our stack: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Node.js, Redis, Graphite
Hosting: Rackspace and AWS clouds.
Configuration Management in Chef
Monitoring: Statsd, Graphite, New Relic

WHAT YOU'LL BRING:
------------------

Very experienced with Linux system administration. We run Ubuntu. Substantial experience with a programming language like Ruby or Python. Experience developing and monitoring mission critical web applications. Knowledge of and a passion for repeatable configuration management using tools such as chef, puppet, or ansible. We use Chef. Bonus: experience configuring and monitoring CDNs. We use Fastly. Bonus: experience tuning and administering PostgreSQL databases.

OUR ENGINEERING VALUES:
-----------------------


We believe that ideas are more important than technologies.
We understand that the tools we build have real-world consequences for millions of people and take that responsibility seriously.
We know that code isn’t just a set of instructions for machines, but communication with other humans; style, elegance, and respect are important.
We believe that an ability to balance paying off technical debt and rapidly completing a project contributes to the health of the codebase, engineering team, and organization.
We believe that being correct isn’t enough; respect for your colleagues and users is fundamental.

"High Volume" means different things to different sites. To us it means ten thousand simultaneous active users, handling over $1M a day, processing four credit card transactions per second, mailing checks/doing wire transfers to 2000+ groups a week. We use best in class tools (rails, postgresql, react, sidekiq/redis, memcached, jquery, chef) and methods (github, extensive automated testing, continuous integration, deployment, cloud hosting) to deliver the best technology in politics.

We’re a small (but growing!) team that has a big impact on the future of our country. Each and every one of us is fully committed to our mission and we are looking for new team members who match our passion and are ready to dive in! If you're interested, send your resume to techjobs@actblue.com!

Follow us on:
Github: https://github.com/actblue ( https://github.com/actblue )

Twitter: @ActBlue ( http://actblue/ ) & @ActBlueTech ( https://twitter.com/ActBlueTech )

We offer a competitive salary and a generous compensation package, which includes commuter benefits, fully paid health, dental, and vision insurance, an employer-sponsored 401k contribution plan, and a flexible time off policy.

Women, people of color, LGBTQ individuals, and members of other minority or marginalized groups are strongly encouraged to apply. ActBlue is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against candidates on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status.

ActBlue cannot at this time sponsor work visas.

This is an opportunity for you to have a real impact on the creation of our automation platform and work across many areas in the tech stack.

In a "typical" day you could be implementing cloud and client side applications that coordinate work between mobile robots, or authoring, testing, debugging reliable, production quality source code and participate in the design and architecture of major features.

Typical things that we look for:

Experience leading teams of developers to deliver exceptional products
7-10 years of full stack software development experience
Familiarity with a variety of languages and the flexibility to pick up new ones. Our current technology suite includes Typescript, NodeJS, Angular, C++ and ROS.
Experience with scaling server side applications, concurrency, system reliability or complex business process logic.
Commitment to rigorous testing & validation practices (we write lots of unit tests)
Strong organizational, communication, and planning skills
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment
Bonus: Experience with building modern web applications, Docker containers, messaging systems, caching and database layers

------

We have a future to create, so join Aclara as we harness science and engineering to make a difference. We're at the intersection of communications, data technology, energy, and national resource engineering.
Over 800 energy and utility customers across the globe ask us to solve complex challenges from making the power grid smarter, to delivering clear water, to empowering their customers to conserve energy. We're a hardware, software, and network engineering company building new solutions to hard problems. We're big data gurus and in the field problem solvers.
Sound like your kind of challenge? Then join us. We'll offer you a great work environment and competitive benefits such as medical, dental, and vision care, flex spending, 401k, tuition reimbursement, vacation, holiday and personal time, and we're committed to diversity and our veterans.

Purpose:
To provide senior level software design and development for a family of multi-tier 24x7 Azure Cloud hosted web applications that scale to a large number of web users and large backend databases. The applications focus on the consumer engagement through the analytics of utility usages such as billing data for electric, gas, and water consumption. Develop applications in Microsoft .NET technologies, SQL Server database, Cassandra NoSQL database, Azure Cloud Platform services, Azure Data storage, Web APIs, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks, such as Bootstrap and AngularJS. As a senior full stack developer, you will work in a scrum team. You will be responsible for design, development, testing, maintenance, and enhancements of the ACE applications written in high level languages (C#, AngularJS, T-SQL, CQL). In addition, this role includes designing, coding, and testing for web application security, performance, and scalability.

Essential Functions:

Work closely with SMEs and Product Management to validate functional and non-functional requirements to satisfy the product use cases.
Troubleshoot and resolve production issues. This requires you to work with cross-functional teams such as Professional Services, Support, and Sales.
Author and review artifacts of all phases of a project, such as: use cases, estimates, high- and low-level designs, code, and test cases to make sure they meet requirements. This requires working with the architect to ensure that product architecture is cohesive and adhering to the required functional and non-functional requirements like performance, scalability, and security.
Review new product requirements, gap analysis provided by professional services, then work with the Pod leader and the Product Owner to create user stories to address these requirements and use cases.
Ensure software quality responsibility through demos, creation of solid testing plans, execution and reporting on the test results.
Serve as technical conduit responsible for ensuring clear communication, solid commitments, and clear accountability by all groups involved: Project Management, Product Management, Software Engineering, and the Professional Services team.
Mentor junior engineers and provide them with technical oversight.

Additional Responsibilities:

A global company with offices in Cambridge, MA, Portsmouth, NH, Dublin, Ireland, Sydney, Australia, Singapore, Tokyo and soon to be Berlin, HubSpot transforms how organizations market and sell. The Professional Services team is looking for the next recurring services Technical Consultant to join the team and support our highest value Premier Services customers. This role is open in either Cambridge, MA or Portsmouth, NH.

HubSpot's Professional Services exists to drive organizations to see remarkable growth through inbound, delivering tangible customer value by building impactful customer relationships and providing innovative strategic and technical advice. Come work with one of the best teams at HubSpot.

TetraScience is a Boston-based cloud software company and rapidly growing startup that is applying the Internet of Things (IoT) playbook to lab research. We build both hardware and software components that allow research organizations to connect their existing lab instruments to a single online dashboard where they can coordinate experiments, monitor equipment parameters, and manage experimental data. With the insights and extra control provided by TetraScience, research organizations can more intelligently plan for future research cycles thereby alleviating equipment and process bottlenecks. In short, our goal at TetraScience is to use IoT to reduce the cost of doing science and while simultaneously increasing researcher efficiency overall.
Because our goal at TetraScience is to effect industry-wide change, we have intentionally built a team of passionately curious members of diverse backgrounds who support science and value scientific advancement. As a result, our team is an excellent counter-example to the claim made by Jeffery Hammerbacher the founder of Cloudera when he said “The best minds of [our] generation are thinking about how to make people click ads.” In a time when aspects of common consumer technology has created problems like filter bubbles and fake news, TetraScience empowers researchers to seek truth from fact.
We are looking for a rock star solution engineer to join the team who love to build, who share our interest in facilitating scientific advancement, and who wants to be an early and significant contributor to such an ambitious and impactful venture. This role will have a lot of hands on responsibilities and you in the driver seat of shaping the lab digitization and how the life science industry evolves in terms of leveraging Internet-of-Things and Cloud!
As a member of the Client Solution Engineering team you will work under the guidance of our Solutions Architects to lead the engineering effort required to integrate our client's instrument and software system, and ultimately take them live with our suite of product offerings. This is a fast-paced role that sits in the intersection of engineering and business that requires a passion and desire for developing both hard and soft skills. As a client-facing technical role, you will need to interface with our customers, understand their need and provide solution to solve their pain points. In addition to taking clients live you will be responsible for the enhancement of the current client onboarding infrastructure. This includes but is not limited to developing internal applications, writing scripts to automate processes, making improvements to DevOps tooling, and refactoring existing applications/tools used in the client onboarding process.
You will be responsible for

Develop and implement client-specific data extraction, file parsing, input validation and system integration.
Participate during the discovery process for new clients to understand their informatics infrastructure and data flow need.
Work closely with Solutions Architects to understand client specific business requirements and build appropriate solutions.
Participate in the development and implementation of the core platform and integrations.
Support client on boarding process, including training and set up.
Support client after go-live.
Travel to client sites with the implementation team to develop and foster strong stakeholder relationships.
Identify technology and process gaps in the onboarding process and build internal.
Applications/tools to streamline client go-lives.

Requirements:
Basic requirements:

3+ years of software engineering / professional software development
Experience developing applications in a *nix environment
Experience working with databases such as Postgres, Elasticsearch and etc.
Proficiency in a major programming language (Node.JS/Python or equivalent)
Capacity and willingness to work collaboratively with other developers
Ability to identify, analyze, discuss, and confirm application / system requirements from customers and relevant stakeholders
Strong communication skills with the ability to produce clear documentation to be understood internally and with clients
Aptitude for maintaining work quality while under deadlines in a highly dynamic environment
A self-starter with a GSD attitude

Nice to have:

Experience working in life science informatics/IT
Consulting and/or professional services experience
Experience with the following: Postgres, R, Python, NodeJS, Amazon Web Services (S3, EC2, ELB, EMR, SQS, R53, Lambda, VPC), Elasticsearch, Docker
Experience working with major ELN/LIMS system
Experience with agile development methodologies
A computer science degree or equivalent
Experience working in a compliant environment

Benefits:

Red Line, Boston Commons, and a variety of lunch and happy hour options (design meetings in the park, anyone?)
A culture of continuous improvement. At TetraScience we have weekly technology/science talks whereby you or your colleagues present on new technologies, software concepts and trend in life science with the goal of raising the bar. In addition, we have a weekly brown-bag book club where engineers discuss a few chapters of a book that is related to what we are working on.
Diverse and supportive colleagues: team members at Tetrascience are from a myriad of backgrounds and thus no single stereotype applies. We strive for fairness in hiring and advancement, and promote the success of our employees regardless of whether they identify as a Foo, Bar or Baz or the color scheme of their shell. And we understand that teams are more productive and creative when individuals can work through ideas and give honest feedback while showing respect for differences and maintaining a positive atmosphere.
Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
Unlimited PTO
Generous Parental Leave Policy
Catered team dinner every Wednesday
Competitive salary and equity and in an extremely fast growing company

If you could change one thing about travel, what would it be? At Amadeus, you can make that happen!
Travel makes the world a better place and we are fully dedicated to improving it and making it even more rewarding. We are one of the world’s top 15 software companies: we provide technology solutions and services within the travel industry.
Do you have ideas on how to improve travel for everyone? Do you find the idea of working in a diverse, multicultural environment exciting? Are you ready to make an impact across the world? Great, then join us! Let’s shape the future of travel together. #shapethefutureoftravel@Amadeus
Duration: 3 to 6 months
I. Summary of the role
Amadeus provides the technology which keeps the travel sector moving -from initial search to making a booking, from pricing to ticketing, from managing reservations to managing check-in and departure processes.
Our products and solutions help to improve the business performance of our customers; travel agencies, corporations, airlines, ground handlers, hotels, railways, car rental companies, airports, cruise lines and ferry operators.
Amadeus works in more than 190 markets with worldwide team of more than 14,000 people.
An internship offer entitled "PNR Cloner" has just opened up at Amadeus North America in Waltham MA.
You will join the RES department of Amadeus in North America. This department supports the development activities for the airline reservation industry in the American market, including projects with SouthWest Airlines (who transitioned recently to Amadeus Altea solutions), United Airlines, Delta, Air Canada and others.
In the airline and travel industries, a passenger name record (PNR) is a record in the reservation system that contains the information related to a trip (name, itinerary, contact elements, special services, seats, remarks...)
This internship aims at building a dynamic algorithm that can analyze an existing PNR from our Production environment and reverse engineer it. The purpose is to conclude a set of steps that can be followed in order to create an artificial yet realistic copy of this PNR for our TEST purpose. This smart algorithm should be able to operate by mining existing data and analyzing it (either using machine learning or statically).
II. Main Responsibilities
Benefit:
Provide sanitized PNRs (without personal or sensitive data)in TEST
Provide actual PNRs (created with a sequence of actions and not blindly copied)
Enable investigators to replay the steps of a PNR creation prior to a corruption
Facilitate developers and quality engineers workflow by enabling them to reproduce any PNR in the system
Tasks and accountabilities:
Understand the airline industry standards related to PNR data (IATA)
Understand Amadeus distributed architecture and technologies
Develop a smart algorithm that can Analyze PNR and deduce steps to reproduce it in TEST systems
III. Requirements
Software Development or Web Development knowledge (you will have to develop new UIs)
Machine learning knowledge is a plus
Strong synthesis and pedagogical skills
Strong communication skills are needed,as you will have to liaise with business analysts, QA engineers and Software developers
You are autonomous
Any duplication and display of partial or full content of our job advertisement on any support, such as brochures, websites, mail, emails, this list is not exhaustive, is strictly forbidden without prior formal Amadeus’ authorisation.
Recruitment agencies: Amadeus does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Amadeus employees or any other company location. Amadeus is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Amadeus strives to achieve outstanding results through a diverse workforce. Our employees represent over 123 nationalities. We welcome and embrace individual differences to bring out the brilliance in ourselves, our customers and each other. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We are seeking talented and motivated software engineers to join the Aras Labs team . Aras Labs is chartered with pushing the envelope of what business software can be. We lead by example, building innovative new apps and services that help shape the future of industry.


The Labs team fills a unique niche at Aras. We get input from many different sources, both within Aras and in the broader community, to rapidly gather requirements and prototype applications that solve real problems. This hybrid role also gives us the opportunity to contribute to open-source projects and communicate with other developers (think developer advocate/developer evangelist).


The ideal Aras Labs candidate is able to sling code freely, but wants to use that ability to solve real-world business problems. As a team member, you will have the opportunity to work on technologies ranging from mobile apps one day to data-intensive cloud services the next. We need smart, flexible, nimble self-starters that can absorb new concepts fast and turn them into reality even faster.


Learn more about the Aras Labs team by visiting us on Twitter ( @ArasLabs ) or GitHub ( @ArasLabs ).

Rapidly assess business challenges and document use cases / requirements

Attend a lunch & learn or training class; pop into Boston for a developer meetup or technical conference; immerse yourself in a team hackathon. And Aras culture isn't all about the work - it's about the people too. Whether joining the annual company picnic, our (very) competitive chili cook-off, or an informal dinner with the team, you'll be feeling like part of the Aras family in no time.


At Aras, you will have the opportunity to gain a broad base of experience covering the entire software development lifecycle. If you desire a challenge and would like to explore opportunities at Aras, submit your resume and a cover letter for consideration.

In little more than a decade, Google has created one of the world's largest global computing infrastructures for both internal and external use. Using our unique technologies, along with open source tools, we keep Google's products and services running, robust and secure. Our objective is to create solutions that allow people to work and communicate in new and innovative ways – giving back to the world's technical community whenever we can.


As a Technical Solutions Consultant intern, you will be part of teams that provide technical support to Google's external partners and clients. As such, you will play a role in supporting external partners and clients, and develop tools to make our operations smarter and scalable. Your projects could range from driving analysis to determine root causes of customer dissatisfaction, building tools to automate and scale operations or developing custom solutions for some of Google's top partners.


Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.


Responsibilities
Build internal solutions, with custom front-ends (web, mobile) and backend services that automate business processes. Maintain highest levels of development practices including: technical design; solution development; systems configuration; test documentation/execution; issue identification and resolution; writing clean, modular and self-sustaining code.
Help partners in their day-to-day challenges by delivering innovative and scalable solutions, and troubleshooting their problems. Understand operational workflows, identify and define tool needs to enable operational scaling, and drive the development (initial and ongoing) and deployment of these tools with Engineering.
Create and update documentation as integration methods are applied (e.g., requirements document, technical design document, project plan, etc).
Integrate third-party products into internal systems as well as support and upgrade implemented systems. Work closely with analysts to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Solve problems that may involve access and analysis of massive amounts of data and information. Help to develop massively scalable, distributed software systems and collaborate on different smaller projects.

Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Must be currently enrolled in a full- time degree program pursuing a Bachelor's in Computer Science or a related technical field and returning to the program after the end of the internship.
Experience with web technologies and experience with HTTP, HTMP, XML.
Database design and SQL Query construction experience.
Experience in one or more programming languages: C++, Python or Java; experience with SQL and data modeling.

Preferred qualifications:
Enrolled in a full- time degree program pursuing a Master's in Computer Science or a related technical field and returning to the program after the end of the internship.
Experience in systems software or algorithms.
Some client facing experience (gained through university, part time work, etc), or proxy skills (university society membership, organizing/leading voluntary activities).
Demonstrated business savvy and effective communication skills (relevant for a technical audience).
Authorization to work in the United States.
Expected graduation date in late 2018 or Spring/Summer of 2019.

A global company with offices in Cambridge, MA, Portsmouth, NH, Dublin, Ireland, Sydney, Australia, Singapore, Tokyo and soon to be Berlin, HubSpot transforms how organizations market and sell. Through its unique approach to company culture, HubSpot has also redefined how people work and live. Our commitment to autonomy, flexibility, and transparency prompted the creation of ourCulture Code ( http://t.sidekickopen30.com/e1t/c/5/f18dQhb0S7lC8dDMPbW2n0x6l2B9nMJW7t5XZs8qCmnFN3My7zzd7tfRW7gbMDs56dFX3f271nfP02?t=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.slideshare.net%2FHubSpot%2Fthe-hubspot-culture-code-creating-a-company-we-love%3Fref%3Dhttp%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fblog%2Ftabid%2F6307%2Fbid%2F34234%2FThe-HubSpot-Culture-Code-Creating-a-Company-We-Love.aspx&si;=5769465310478336π=f23296d5-cf58-4bc0-86e5-06b3b72358fb ), which has gone viral, amassing more than 2M views. Ensuring that our customers and employees are continually growing and learning has helped make HubSpot a Best Place to Work in the eyes of Glassdoor, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc. The Boston Globe, and the Boston Business Journal.

---------------------

Technical Consultant:
---------------------

The Professional Services team is looking for the next recurring services Technical Consultant to join the team and support our highest value Premier Services customers. This role is open in either Cambridge, MA or Portsmouth, NH.

In this role, you’ll work with some of HubSpot’s most sophisticated customers as their single technical point of contact.

About the Professional Services team

HubSpot's Professional Services exists to drive organizations to see remarkable growth through inbound, delivering tangible customer value by building impactful customer relationships and providing innovative strategic and technical advice. Come work with one of the best teams at HubSpot.

Responsibilities:

In the role of Technical Consultant, you will work directly with clients, helping them solve their ongoing HubSpot implementation, integration and support needs.
You will build business relationships with your clients and have impact on their continued success as both a business and HubSpot customer.
You will implement your problem solving and solution design skills as the main technical point of contact for your customers.
You will provide full and complete answers for these clients, primarily consulting on advanced HubSpot usage, front-end work and architecting system integrations and processes.

--------------------
What you’ll do
--------------------


Deliver remote consulting and support for customers
Provide project management and guidance for technical implementations
Collaborate with Services team members to support customer success
Provide HubSpot product training
CRM Integrations/Salesforce assistance
Website/Forms Integrations
Build email templates
HTML/CSS/JS assistance
Training for web developers/designers
API assistance & solution design
Scoping services needs with HubSpot’s Sales and Customer Success teams

----------------------
What you’ll need
----------------------

At its core there are three overarching categories that make a successful TC: technical knowledge, communication skills, and problem-solving ability. The ideal candidate for the role possess some combination of the below skills and has a drive to develop in all areas.

Technical Knowledge & Software Experience


Knowledge of common CRM and Marketing Automation system functionality, implementation patterns and integration requirements
Advanced Salesforce knowledge a plus
Knowledge of REST APIs and HTTP in general, how they work/how programmers work with them, designing solutions, and specifically what HubSpot’s APIs can or can’t do
Frontend Design/Development - Comfort with HTML, CSS, and familiarity with templating languages (HuBL) and JavaScript/jQuery. You don't need to be a developer, but have an interest in code.

Communication Skills


Proven ability to learn and clearly communicate technical concepts
Very comfortable speaking with clients on the phone and in written communication, leading and controlling these communications.
Ability to run product training for customer technical teams
Ability to present to and communicate with multiple roles within your customer’s businesses and within HubSpot
Ability to build and maintain rapport with high value HubSpot clients
Can intuitively prioritize new and urgent customer issues

Problem-Solving Ability:

Think outside the standard use cases of the HubSpot product
Design scalable, maintainable solutions using your HTML/CSS/Javascript skills
Design and plan implementation for complicated systems integrations
Find ways for customers with internal roadblocks to get maximum value from HubSpot’s software

Relationship building and consulting skills


Ability to project manage technical onboarding for new customers
Ability to develop long term technical solutions for customers
Ability to actively listen, ask good questions and challenge customers appropriately
Ability to work closely with internal account stakeholders

Company Details

Building Blocks help global companies solve complex problems with digital technologies. We work with clients to identify digital opportunities that will increase revenues, develop relationships and improve efficiencies. Our design, technical and operational expertise then put those opportunities into practice - rapidly, reliably and at global scale.

We have always worked with ambitious organizations who offer their products and services internationally. We understand the need to balance centralized consistency with local flexibility and offerings to support the specific goals of local market teams. We have rolled out 100’s of websites in over 100 different local countries.

Our team sits in Boston, Manchester and Zaragoza. We are a team of 75 people and growing, quickly. Building Blocks is also part of an international group of leading digital agencies – Dept ( https://www.deptagency.com/ ) helping to expand its international presence. From our offices across Europe and the US, 500 of the most talented and experienced people in our industry combine creativity, technology and data to deliver digital products and services that build brands, grow businesses and make people’s lives easier.

Overall Purpose of the Role

We are looking for a Technical Consultant to join our growing team, working across client projects. You must be motivated to design and deliver innovative solutions that integrate and utilize our technology partners’ products to provide real business value to our clients. The role includes technical architecture, solution design, and client facing and expectation management aspects.

You will be confident and knowledgeable in a wide range of current technologies and processes, and we would expect you to develop collaborative working relationships with customers to produce solutions in a way that satisfies their expectations. In return, Building Blocks will help progress your career with training opportunities, support and experience.

The position is currently available in our Boston office and this role will require travel to client sites across North America.

Key Responsibilities


Work with business stakeholders to provide technical solutions that deliver to business needs.
Lead design, estimation, planning and implementation technology solutions.
Provide best practice points of view in a consultative manner to our clients’ senior technical leaders.
Provide technical direction for our North American team of developers.
Create documentation that can convey detailed and complicated technical matters in clear and concise way.
Deliver compelling presentations of a technical nature to client stakeholders.
Design innovative technical solutions and reusable components that can be actively sold to customers.
Investigate new technologies, creating POCs and supervising their implementation for customer.

Technical/Specialist Skills and/or Experience


At least 2 years’ consultancy or leadership experience
Preferably a Certified SDL Tridion, Sitecore or e-Spirit Developer or Architect.
Architecture and System Design experience.
Development and deployment of large, multi-lingual implementations.
Experience of Agile methodology is desirable.
Strong knowledge and experience web development project lifecycles.
Demonstrable consulting skills, including client relationships and team facilitation.
Well-developed organizational and interpersonal communications skills.
General understanding of the business environment, models and motivations.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, meeting facilitation, presentation and documentation.
Good business analysis/redesign skills with architecture and implementation experience.
Requirements analysis, conceptual, logical and detailed design skills.
Ability to manage work for multiple projects simultaneously.
Confident problem solver.
Appreciation of current technologies and techniques (.NET, CSS, SOA, AJAX, Silverlight).
Eager to learn and keep up with technological advances.
Sense of humor and ability to build relationships in a team environment.

Our core principles

We do things properly - We always focus on delivering quality, no matter what the task. We don’t cut corners and always strive to find the right solution for every challenge. We work with integrity and are dedicated to delivering excellence across the entire business.

We aim to be the best - We’re all passionate about what we do, so we focus on continually improving for the good of both our own personal development and the goals of the business. We’re confident in our ability to take ownership, and tackle everything with a proactive mind-set.

We’re open and honest - We are always approachable and transparent with our communications. Our opinions are open, constructive and respected by all members of the team, and the clients we work with.

We trust each other - We all appreciate the contribution of each and every one of our colleagues. We treat each other with respect and dignity, and know that we can rely on each other to provide help, support and guidance whenever it’s needed.

We’re all in it together - We don’t believe in blame, just in finding solutions to tackle even the hardest of challenges. We all have individual areas of expertise, and our success comes from our consistent collaboration.

Remuneration & Benefits Package

Excellent package dependent on experience

Apply now

Email your CV to careers@building-blocks.com

No Recruitment Agencies

Application Developer Consultant (State Street Bank and Trust Company; Boston , Massachusetts): The Application Developer Consultant works on the Iaas+ Cloud platform on Anti-Money Laundering (AML) initiatives. He or she will apply knowledge of application development, and leading IT technologies in particular J2EE, RDBS, Cloud, and web development. Specific duties include: carrying out analysis, design, and development activities related to assigned tasks as part of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC); developing integration modules and software programs using Java/J2EE and any other required technologies; understanding Sanctions and AML screening requirements from the business SME's, and designing and developing screening solutions using Fircosoft Trust and Continuity application products; developing any required functionalities using Autosys, Shell scripts, etc. to support daily operations; deploying and managing code artifacts with the configuration and change management discipline using source control and rational clear case; analyzing business requirements and developing solutions to meet the business’ needs for downloading and managing AML and Sanctions lists published by regulatory agencies such as OFAC; and working as part of a larger team with both on-site and offshore resources for development and production support activities.
Minimum requirements are: Bachelor’s degree or its equivalent in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field, and 5 years of relevant experience.
Must have: proven in-depth knowledge of J2EE, RDBMS, Web Development, UNIX and Cloud Technologies; demonstrated strong domain knowledge in the area of regulatory compliance such as Transaction/Communications monitoring or Anti-Money Laundry and Sanctions screening; proven in-depth knowledge of object oriented design methodology and patterns; proven ability to analyze business requirements and develop solutions that meet the business needs; demonstrated ability to communicate effectively both written and orally; proven ability to multi-task and meet aggressive deadlines; and demonstrated experience in professional software development. (Unless otherwise indicated, State Street is seeking the ability in the skills listed above with no specific amount of years of experience required. All experience can be gained concurrently.)
A pply online at statestreet.com/careers . State Street Job ID: R-568517 . An EOE.

job_title: Freelance Lead Web Developer - CRAFT Boston
summary:
YOUR ROLE

As a Lead Web Developer, you will have 5+ years of full-stack experience building high quality software. You will have a strong academic background and should be able to define and implement custom solutions for internal and external clients. You must be flexible, creative and be able to implement new ideas quickly, work across different development platforms and frameworks, while respecting the commercial and practical realities of the business.

We are seeking a proactive thinker able to work in fast-paced, agile environment and be a regular contributor of ideas and solutions to the creative and design teams. You must be passionate about technology and maintain leading edge insights into development trends.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

Hand-on development with technologies such as PHP, MySQL, jQuery, AppleScript and Linux
Assist the Tech Lead in design and implementation of software tools, automated workflows, and processes to increase efficiency and reduce costs
Ensure high quality, accuracy and on-time delivery on all web development projects
Identify and deal with problems as they arise, escalating and involving peers, senior management or IT support where appropriate
Become a subject matter expert on multiple systems and have the ability to problem solve when unique client or account challenges arise
Understand the capabilities and limitations of systems and how they are deployed to support the business
Assist the Tech Lead in selecting new technologies and methods to help streamline support, development and digital production
Promotion of a culture that celebrates the key pillars of Craft’s offering - Craftsmanship, Intelligence and Community Craft Worldwide Network
Maintain a documentation and persistent code repository for all production processes and applications

WHO WE ARE

At CRAFT Worldwide, we’ve been fortunate enough to assemble a team of the industry’s best craftspeople, each with a rich and robust background in advertising, adaptation and production. Over 1,000 employees in 120 countries and 25 markets make up this talented network with specialty in global broadcast/video production, print production, digital production and global translation.

Within the CRAFT network, our CRAFT Boston agency is unique — our team includes passionate, experienced creatives and production talent. We love a strategic challenge. We are problem solvers, collaborators, and incredibly good people. We work hard, fast and smart to produce well-crafted work for our clients. To make it all happen we live by this simple commitment: Be the best version of you every day.

Bachelor’s in Computer Science
Knowledge of test driven development, test automation and continuous integration
Self-starter and a team player
Ability to work in a variety of client settings and platforms
Ability to work independently and efficiently
Strong OO design knowledge
Strong knowledge and experience with databases
Solid HTML and CSS ability
Excellent understanding of MVC application development methodology

CRAFT Boston is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Experience in web programming languages such as PHP, MySQL, Java or C#

Experience with Linux system administration

PREFERRED

Experience with Javascript libraries such as jQuery and Greensock
Experience integrating with CMS platforms, 3rd party APIs, social media products, etc.
Experience building and maintaining internal infrastructure systems using open source build, dependency and scaffolding tools such as Gulp, Bower and Yeoman.

job_title: Systems Developer/Blackbaud - Asst. Dir. of Development
summary:
Mass General Hospital is seeking an Assistant Director, Systems Developer to support the technical needs of the Information Management (IM) team and the overall Development Office. In coordination with the Director of Development, Information Management and the Partners Development Application Team, the Assistant Director will assist with managing the identification, design, development, Q&A;, support, and maintenance for all technology systems and components that support the fundraising efforts. This position will facilitate and provide hands-on assistance with data movement between systems, applications and technologies, as needed, and serve as a liaison to vendors and partners, and the Department’s primary developer of customizations in Blackbaud CRM.


The position requires knowledge of IT environments including LAN/WAN communications, technologies and system hosting infrastructure. In addition, experience providing support in a web development environment is desired, with strong knowledge of web based networks, Internet systems, data transfer functions and web hosting infrastructure.


The ideal candidate will be a detail-oriented self-starter with strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to work productively in a mission-critical team environment, and to produce quality work consistently. He/she will have a robust understanding of the business of fundraising and work well with all IM team members to advance the philanthropy efforts at Massachusetts General Hospital. Must be able to manage assigned responsibilities with limited input as well as design, manage, support and maintain all IT infrastructure needs.


All applicants must apply online via
www.massgeneral.org
. Applications must include a current resume and a cover letter detailing applicable experience and accomplishments.


About us

Massachusetts General Hospital
is one of the world’s top academic medical centers. Founded in 1811, it is the third oldest general hospital in the United States and the original and largest teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, where nearly all our staff physicians serve on the faculty.

We are looking for Lead Full Stack Web Developer for an immediate need. The applicants should have strong experience in Java, HTML 5 and CSS 3. This is a client facing role & the candidate will have regular interactions with various client managers.

Mandatory Skills:

· Software development team lead with experience developing cloud-hosted, responsive, single page web applications using JavaScript, Java, HTML5, CSS3
· High proficiency with client side JavaScript frameworks (preferably React/Redux), server side frameworks (preferably NodeJS) and NoSQL databases (preferably MongoDB)
· Able to integrate with and managing APIs exposing microservices (REST, SOAP) including development and support of Java/JavaScript services
· Familiarity with event-based System of Engagement architectures
· Experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum, Lean Startup, Kanban, XP) and cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Developers, Designers, Test Engineers)
· Demonstrates leadership and active pursuit of optimizing CI/CD process and tools, testing frameworks and practices (preferably GitHub, Jenkins/Bamboo, Mocha/Karma, etc)
· Ideally familiar with Design Thinking, Behavior and Test-Driven Development
· Familiarity with test-and-learn approaches using web and customer analytics data, understanding how these drive hypotheses-based development
· Strong leadership, communication and collaboration skills with track record of taking solution ownership
· A Bachelors or Master's degree in technical or business discipline or equivalent experience.
· 8+ years of professional software development experience

Desired Skills:

AWS Services
Should be able to drive a team
Excellent communication skills ‐‐ written, verbal and graphical
Ability to work independently and as a key contributor in small teams

Roles & Responsibilities:

Able to work on sizeable individual efforts as well as on teams using Scrum or other agile methodologies.
Develop prototypes, proofs of concept in addition to production‐quality solutions
Translate complex business needs into innovative technical solutions
Ensure efficient performance and scalability of solutions

We are looking for applicants who have a flair for technology and are willing to take up challenging assignments.

***Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to leverage the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to excellence instilled in them through participation in military service.

**Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (such as an H-1B visa) for this opportunity.

The Massachusetts Medical Society is the statewide professional association for physicians and medical students. We are dedicated to educating and advocating for the patients and physicians of Massachusetts. We offer online CME courses and live events that award continuing medical education credits. The Society, under the auspices of NEJM Group, publishes the New England Journal of Medicine, a leading global medical journal and web site, and NEJM Journal Watch alerts and publications covering 13 specialties.

We are currently seeking a Sr. Developer, Digital Development Solutions to work in our Waltham, MA office.

The Sr. Developer, Digital Development Solutions partners with business and editorial stakeholders, technology staff, and external vendors to advance and support online platforms and service initiatives. He or she develops and integrates disparate technologies and services, interfacing with cloud and on-premise infrastructure. He or she also utilizes internal standards, technologies and development methodologies to ensure the successful integration of projects to meet business needs.

Responsibilities

Develops code and contributes technical expertise on a variety of technologies, with a major focus on front-end and middle tier applications and services.

Serves as a technical resource for team members through all phases of the software development life cycle, including product design, planning, development, implementation, and product/system test.

Works with solutions architects, business analysts, and other stakeholders to identify, review and make recommendations on development approaches that are most suitable to current and future business needs.

Creates new APIs and microservices on our internal and cloud platforms to support online products and services.

Other responsibilities as assigned.

Required Skills

Required Experience

A Bachelors’ degree and five or more years of related software development experience are required.

Excellent interpersonal, communication, problem solving and multi-tasking skills, and the ability to independently accomplish responsibilities as a member of multidisciplinary teams are important.

An interest in learning and embracing new technologies, products and applications, and flexibility to adapt to changing tasks/priorities to support business needs are critical.

Related professional certifications are a plus.

Object-oriented application building experience with a major focus on front-end and back-end technologies e.g., Angular 2, Node.JS is highly desirable.

Experience with ASP .Net and/or Java is highly desirable.

Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodologies, and ability to function as a member of a multi-disciplinary team is necessary.

Understanding of relational and No SQL databases, such as SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB or MarkLogic is desirable.

Experience in test automation and test-driven development is preferred.

A background in containerized development and cloud technologies is a plus.

Experience in publishing industry is a plus.

Are you the perfect blend of left and right brain talent? Are you excited to be part of a growing and dynamic team that is revolutionizing the way small business owners market their business? Do you get excited when you work directly with customers and develop products that solve their problems? If you answered yes to all the above, you should join the Vistaprint Site Experience Team.


As a Lead Software Engineer, you will imagine, design, and build a shopping experience that helps small business owners find and buy the products that make them look great. You’ll work in a tight-knit agile team of engineers, designers and analysts to create new concepts from the ground up and test them live, in front of 20 million customers a month. While your primary focus will be on building incredible customer experiences for the web, you’ll have an opportunity to learn and contribute across the whole stack, from styling to services.


At Vistaprint, you will:

Work in a cross-functional, autonomous team to build a tailored, flexible, and inspiring e-commerce experience
Collaborate with business owners, designers, and analysts to build and develop highly impactful customer-facing features
Mentor junior developers and help them grow

What you will bring to the role:

BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Strong industry experience (5+ years) in full-stack web application development
Deep understanding of modern JavaScript and experience with JavaScript UI frameworks (Backbone, React, or Angular, etc.)
Experience with object-oriented programming languages, such as C#, Java, or Node.js, etc.
A solid understanding of continuous integration and deployment tools and processes (We use Jenkins, Artifactory and others)
Experience running cloud-based applications in production (AWS, Azure, etc.)
Experience with database design and querying a plus
Experience with content management systems a plus
Practical application experience with agile/lean software development
Curiosity, and an ability to pick up new technology quickly
Great team skills: communication, collaborative thinking, and the willingness to give and receive open and honest feedback.

Who we are:


At Vistaprint, our business model and strategy have evolved in a big way. If you think of us as the Free Business Card company, you’ll have to come take a look at the new Vistaprint. We have an exciting product assortment and an aspiration to empower small business owners to achieve their dreams. The process of customizing marketing materials for a small business is a daunting and overwhelming task. We believe we can enable our customers to market their business and their brand in an exciting way and we intend to wow them with how easy it is for them to achieve this. Customer experience will be a differentiator for us and we have prioritized evolution of our Site Experience as a top strategic priority to enable us to accelerate the pace of change.

Tapjoy's Maximum Impact PlatformTM provides mobile engagement and monetization services for leading advertisers and app developers. Advertisers rely on Tapjoy's diverse suite of rewarded InterplayTM ads including video and rich media to impact performance. Developers utilize our technology and mobile expertise to acquire and monetize users. The Tapjoy SDK is currently embedded in over 15,000 mobile apps, reaching 520 million monthly active users. A 2016 comScoreTM study confirmed Tapjoy Interplay® ads deliver an unprecedented 3x lift across all brand metrics. The company works with Fortune 500 brands and the Top 200 grossing app developers. Founded in 2007, Tapjoy is a global organization with more than a dozen offices worldwide and is headquartered in San Francisco.

Tapjoy is backed by top-tier investors, including J.P. Morgan Asset Management, Rho Ventures, North Bridge Venture Partners, InterWest Partners and D.E. Shaw Ventures. Headquartered in San Francisco, the company also has offices in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Santa Barbara, Boston, London, Beijing, Shanghai, Seoul and Tokyo.

Position Title - Staff Software Engineer, Operations

Position Description/Responsibilities:
You’ll work with a team to design, build and maintain Tapjoy’s core infrastructure.You’ll debug production issues at every tier of a massive distributed system, across dozens of services. Build and improve infrastructure management tools.
Devise creative solutions to problems and either implement them yourself or work with other teams to do so.

Service Orchestration Tools - Envoy, Istio

Performance Monitoring & Profiling
Cloud Service Engineering - Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform

You have a BS in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)
5-7 years of related professional work experience

Who We Are
MedTouch is an award-winning online strategy and technology company headquartered in Boston, MA. Focusing exclusively on hospitals, health plans and physician groups, MedTouch combines creative and technical expertise to ensure our clients achieve results that matter. Our services and solutions include healthcare specific content management solutions, user experience design, results driven search marketing, content strategy services, consumer facing websites, employee oriented intranets and more.
We are a fast-paced, innovative company and we take pride in the quality of our people as well as our work. Although we are growing steadily, we strive to retain a relationship-based, people focused environment. We are committed to creating a welcoming and rewarding workplace for clients and employees alike.
The Role
As a Sitecore Tech Lead at MedTouch, you will lead a team of developers to deliver the technical architecture and project implementation of Sitecore websites. You are inquisitive and thorough by nature. When confronted with a complex and large-scale setback, you quickly identify a solution that satisfies a majority of the client’s priority issues, acknowledging the tradeoffs and articulating the long-term solution. We are looking for an accomplished technical leader capable of thriving in a fast-paced, constantly evolving technology environment.
You will:
Lead the technical development components for multiple Sitecore projects at a time, using latest industry standards and best practices.
Architect and document solutions for each project and oversee the implementation.
Act as the technical point of escalation on critically impactful projects with demanding clients, translating and communicating complex issues to a non-technical client team.
Develop a strong understanding of our product code and expertly advise your team on module customizations and interactions.
Code review the work of all developers on the team, evaluating maintainability, performance and security standards compliance.
Gather client requirements and communicate them effectively to team members and project managers.
Mentor and train developers on the team, optimizing their performance.
Deliver projects consistently on time and under budget.
Consistently acknowledge and appreciate each team member's contributions.

The Fit
This role may be just right for you if you have:
7+ years of development experience with Microsoft .NET.
2+ years of development experience in a CMS, such as Sitecore, Ektron, Kentico, Umbraco, Sitefinity, Drupal, Adobe AEM or similar.
A penchant for problem solving and ability to provide quick solutions for critical issues and long-term solutions to prevent their recurrence.
Expertise working in a Microsoft .NET development environment.
Experience working in source control, like Subversion, or GIT.
Web development skills using ASP.NET (C#), MVC, SQL Server, and web services.
A working understanding of Windows Server and IIS setup and configuration.
Understanding of presentation layer technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript/JQuery, AJAX.
A strong aversion to re-writing the same code over again on sequential projects; you want instead to build beautiful, re-usable code!
A strong inclination toward finding the smartest and most efficient way to do something.
An infectious, positive, can-do attitude and a relentless aspiration for improvement.
Completed a bachelor’s degree or certification in a related area.
Bonus Points
Sitecore Certification
Sitecore MVP
Microsoft Web Application or Azure certifications
Experience working in an agile development environment


What We Can Offer You

Description
POST-OFFER BACKGROUND CHECK IS REQUIRED

Applicants must meet the eligibility requirements to obtain a Security Clearance for access to classified information.

PRIMARY FUNCTION(S)

Our customer specializes in advanced network and communications systems development, with a focus on rapid prototyping of radical next generation tactical mobile, military airborne communications systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

Odyssey Systems is seeking to hire a Visualization Software Developer that will participate in developing and deploying visualization software for successful execution of tests conducted for various wireless communication systems. The group develops novel wireless waveforms and is involved in conducting performance analysis for these waveforms via emulation and field tests. The key of this performance analysis depends on automation, visualization and data processing tools that interface with actual waveform. This individual will be a key member of the overall wireless waveform development team, and will work closely with waveform designers to create an interface to collect key metrics, store these metrics in a non-volatile location (databases) and develop a front-end user interface where these metrics will be displayed, both in real-time as well as produce detailed post analysis charts.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Must be a U.S. citizen with the ability to obtain a secret clearance
BS in Computer Engineering or Computer Science plus 5 years minimum experience.
Strong experience with Linux shell based tools
Strong experience with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Javascript, PHP
Strong experience with UI design
Strong experience with databases
Experience with field tests
Experience with co-ordination tools such as XMPP chat
Experience with unit testing and version control systems
Experience with virtualization tools

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with CSS, D3, SVG
Experience with KML or Cesium
Knowledge of MySQL or other SQL based languages
Knowledge of other database tools such as InfluxDB and Redis
Full stack web development experience – front end, back end and storage
Knowledge of version control tools such as GIT
Knowledge of virtualization tools such as VMWare, Docker and Vagrant

Data Scientist - Digital Attribution Developer - 4511
Analytics - USA Boston, Massachusetts
Understanding marketing effectiveness is critical to success of businesses across all verticals. As the world’s largest research organization, Nielsen is powered by talented, creative scientists and researchers. Visual IQ/Nielsen associates come from diverse disciplines that include business, economics, engineering, mathematics, operations research, and statistics. These professionals drive innovation and insight through continual ideation, complex analyses, and delivery of insights to our clients. Because measurement is at the core of Nielsen's business, our products have high visibility and make a direct impact on our clients.
Our team in Needham has an opportunity available for a Data Scientist. The ideal candidate must have work experience in the development of machine learning algorithms, expertise in modern analytics programming, digital advertising across multiple devices, a solid foundation in developing solutions for marketing, advertising organizations and/or pricing, and the capacity to work in an agile development environment alongside software engineers.
Responsibilities
Design market response analytics models and approaches as applied to massive volumes of addressable data such as data created from digital advertising platforms
Design and write modules for Visual IQ/Nielsen’s modeling and analytics platforms using a variety of high level programming languages including R and Python
Extraction and handling of large volumes of data using SQL as well as big data technologies
Create various prototypes for research and development purposes
Document and present methodology inside and outside the company
Partner with our Software Engineering department to build best-of-class web-based analytical solutions
Requirements
Ph.D. degree in Statistics, Economics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or other Quantitative Field of Study
2+ years work experience in delivering analytics software solutions in a production environment
2+ years work experience in machine learning as applied to marketing analysis, with an emphasis on statistical, econometric and predictive analytic research that drives analytic product Innovation and implementation
Proficiency in SQL and big data technologies
Expertise in analytics programming using R. Proficiency with other high level languages such as Python is highly desired.
Exceptional problem solving skills
Well-organized and capable of handling multiple mission-critical projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Desired
Experience in marketing attribution modeling
Experience in cross device analytics
Experience in marketing mix modeling with Nielsen or IRI syndicated data
Experience with household/person-level loyalty card analytics
Experience with big data analytics and/or machine learning techniques, including Apache Spark
Experience with Scala and/or any other open source programming
Short-release life-cycle experience (agile processes including scrum)
About Nielsen:
Nielsen N.V. (NYSE: NLSN) is a global performance management company that provides a comprehensive understanding of what consumers Watch and Buy. Nielsen’s Watch segment provides media and advertising clients with Total Audience measurement services across all devices where content — video, audio, and text — is consumed. The Buy segment offers consumer packaged goods manufacturers and retailers the industry’s only global view of retail performance measurement.
By integrating information from its Watch and Buy segments and other data sources, Nielsen provides its clients with both world-class measurement as well as analytics that help improve performance. Nielsen, an S&P 500 company, has operations in over 100 countries that cover more than 90 percent of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.nielsen.com
Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.
