Mobiquity is a digital engagement provider for more than 200 of the world’s leading brands. We are a collective of consultants, designers, developers, cloud advisors, and data scientists - spread across 3 continents and 9 offices - who create compelling digital experiences to help clients show they care to the people who matter most - their consumers, patients, and employees.
Mobiquity is looking for Experience Designers who are passionate about customer experience design, information architecture, interaction design, user research, and mobile.
As an Experience Designer in this role, you will bring together business objectives, user insights, and an understanding of sophisticated technology to create customer experiences that drive commerce for a prominent financial company based in the Philadelphia area.
Your decisions are informed and validated by both quantitative and qualitative research methods including surveys, card sorting, comparative analysis, usability studies, field research, and technology surveys. You work directly with the clients to understand what drives their business, reach a shared vision of how to solve their problems while serving their customers, and ultimately to help them to succeed. Throughout this effort you will create clear, usable documentation that captures and articulates research findings, proposed solutions and the consumer goals they serve.
For this role, you will be expected to be a strategic leader for an on-site, multi-disciplined client team, guiding process and concepts to POC completion. You will be working on-site at a client innovation center in downtown Philadelphia and may occasionally need to work from Mobiquity’s office in Wayne, PA.

Key Responsibilities
Conduct stakeholder and user interviews
Collect and document business and design requirements
Plan, conduct, and/or participate in user research such as analyze usability lab observations, perform task analyses, conduct card sorting, design and analyze quantitative surveys, interpret web analytics, and perform and analyze field research
Conduct competitive and/or heuristic analyses
Translate business needs and capabilities into an effective information architecture that resonates with customers, aligns with their expectations, and helps them to achieve their goals.
Craft solutions that will meet user and business goals while also fitting into the constraints of brand, time, budget and technology.
Define the categorization, organization and navigational conventions used throughout the experience.
Map the user experience, define the details of the interface, and correlate a system’s features to user tasks, needs & functional requirements.
Collaborate with developers to ensure proposed designs are technically feasible and then properly executed.
Collaborate with art directors and designers to optimize the visual experience and ensure that user and business considerations are met.
Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices in order to facilitate discussions and guide the decision making process to meet project objectives.

Typical deliverables
Wireframes documents (both low- and high-fidelity), which will include detailed functional annotations, as well as illustrations and descriptions of page states and system responses.
App maps, user workflows, scenarios, and task analysis
Heuristic reviews, competitive analyses, and content audits
Taxonomy & product metadata recommendations
User research insight reports and briefs
Client presentation materials

Requirements
Experience Designer: 7+ years of experience as an Experience Designer or related field
Proven ability to design methodologies for gathering user data, interpreting the results, and translating them into solutions.
Extensive experience collaborating with design and development teams on large-scale dynamic ecommerce websites, transactional applications, retail systems design, mobile experiences, or content delivery systems.
The ability to effectively communicate your research findings and designs to both internal teams and the clients, including executive stakeholders.
Bachelors or Masters Degree in Human Computer Interaction, Information Design, Digital Media, Communication Design, Interaction Design, Psychology or a related field.
Detailed familiarity with current wireframing, design, and prototyping tools like Sketch, Omnigraffle, Marvel, InVision, Adobe XD, and/or Proto.io.
Proficient user of iWork (especially Keynote) and Microsoft Office.
A portfolio of work is strongly preferred, demonstrating the depth and breadth of your experience.
Interactive agency experience is preferred.

About You
You posses a strong desire to make the complex clear.
You have a deep understanding of usability and interaction design best practices for mobile, ecommerce and beyond.
You use this knowledge in order to take design risks that balance usability and innovation.
You have the ability to learn from mistakes and a willingness to revisit past solutions for further improvements.
You have a collaborative working style; focused on getting the best solution rather than your solution.
You have expert conflict resolution skills, particularly in negotiating win-win solutions with stakeholders.
You are flexible, steady under pressure, and willing to switch gears quickly.
You are organized, self-directed, efficient and able to manage complex projects in a timely manner.
You are detailed oriented and can find clarity despite ambiguity.
You have superior written and verbal communication skills and are comfortable presenting.
You are comfortable developing a direction and then motivating the organization to the point the vision is realized with little intervention from others
You can plan, organize, and lead presentations, workshops/working sessions, and discovery sessions with C-level stakeholders
Recruiting Agencies: While we really do appreciate what you do, and how challenging it can be, don’t do it. Please do not send us unsolicited resumes, either to our employees, job listings, or recruiting team. (We call those “free leads”). Mobiquity is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Mobiquity is an equal opportunity employer. We feel strongly that the best ideas come from all sorts of directions and sources, and cutting ourselves off from anyone due to our own biases is simply bad business, as well as bad citizenship.

Company Overview
Cell Signaling Technology, Inc. (CST) is a worldwide leader in the development and commercialization of antibodies, assays and research tools. As a company of scientists for scientists, we have developed PTMScan®, a technology to discover protein post-translational modifications, PhosphoSitePlus®, an online resource for investigation of post-translational modifications, and XMT® technology, a proprietary method to develop exceptional monoclonal antibodies. We are fully committed to developing new research tools to help define the mechanisms underlying cell function and disease, thereby broadly accelerating progress in biomedical research and medicine.
Position Summary
We are seeking an experienced Senior Front End Developer to support Cell Signaling Technology’s Commercial Systems team. The Senior Front End Developer will be a key member of the web/eComm and PIM agile teams and will be responsible for developing aesthetically-pleasing and functional designs, building new functionality utilizing rapid prototyping and iterative design methodologies, and documenting JavaScript and HTML/CSS best practices. In addition, the Front End Developer will work collaboratively with Marketing and IT to enhance and optimize the interactive user experience of the web/ecomm platform.
Responsibilities
Engage with internal customers (Marketing, IT, team stakeholders, and end-users) to optimize existing web based functionality
Develop understanding of a complex product and application domain and create a web experience for demanding users
Take a high fidelity mock-up and quickly and efficiently build into a working user interface
Create a compelling and engaging web user experience
Collaborate with the development team, content editors, graphic designers, users, and others to develop clean and intuitive UI application designs
Collaborate with the web backend and data teams to develop a data and platform strategy that enables a great user experience
Ensure digital assets managed within CST’s PIM system to ensure accurate presentation in multiple channels (web, email, social, or print)
Responsible for production ready, large-scale cross-platform, cross-browser compatible JavaScript-based applications that run in multi-device web browsers
Set and enforce best practices for JavaScript, HTML, Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
Required Skills/Experience:
BS/BA with emphasis in web/graphic design, computer science, related technical field or equivalent work experience required
8+ years' experience in Web and Graphic design, with preferred emphasis in web layout and design; catalog and form layout; and workflow design a plus
Experience with XHTML, HTML, CSS, JavaScript (jQuery), Bootstrap, as well as hands-on experience with content management systems
Experience with REST and SOAP services (with ability to create services preferred)
Understanding of databases and data access technologies
Experience with version and source control, preferably Git and Github and Jira
Demonstrated proficiency with Responsive Web Design
Knowledgeable in WCAG 2.0 and 508 / accessibility guidelines
Experience working in an Agile team structure
Skilled in collaborating with others in a fast paced team setting
Ability to create and understand technical documentation

Preferred Skills/Experience:
Strong communication and consulting skills that include leading design-related conversations, ideation on project requirements, ability to build and nurture good relationships and foster environments for open, productive collaboration
Ability to layout web pages with well formed HTML code and CSS across all browsers and platforms
Native Mobile Application development experience

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Front End Developer
summary:
Are you searching for a career where your efforts truly make a difference? At Casenet, we help improve the lives of millions of people – every single day.


Our mission is simple. We create and deliver world class, enterprise software solutions enabling our customers to offer high quality healthcare to their clients at lower costs. Our message and solutions have been exceptionally well received in the market, and we are experiencing explosive growth, both domestically and internationally.


We’re searching for talented, energetic, exceptional people to join our team and drive our continued success. If you’re searching for a rewarding, challenging, fast-paced environment and the opportunity to work on a highly collaborative agile team while making a positive social contribution, you’ve found it!


JOB DESCRIPTION:


Join our team as a front-end web developer responsible for building a new HTML5-based front end for Casenet’s flagship healthcare product, TruCare. In this role, you will work as part of a Scrum team, collaborating with Product Owners, UX, QA and other developers.

Work with product management and drive the definition of improvements based on business need and architectural improvements
Meet with business partners to understand business needs
Responsible for overall technical design of solutions
Design, build and test applications
Conduct root cause analysis and advanced performance tuning for complex business processes and functionality.
Contribute to evolving software excellence, architecture, design, coding standards, testing, patterns, automation, tools, etc.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, related field or equivalent experience
5+ years’ experience developing front end for multi-tiered enterprise-grade web applications using HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript and JQuery
Strong Working knowledge of Angular 2+ or other TS- or JS-based UI frameworks
Strong understanding of UI, cross-browser compatibility, general web functions and standards
Strong understanding of RESTful web services
Understanding of Relational DBMS, ability to write SQL queries
Understanding of OO concepts
Demonstrated ability to lead medium-size development efforts
Grasp of Responsive Design
Nice to have: knowledge of state management via Redux or NGRX
Strong communication skills

Applicants must have unrestricted authorization to work in the United States.

The iboss Distributed Gateway Platform is backed by more than 100 patents and protects over 4,000 organizations worldwide, making iboss one of the fastest growing cybersecurity companies in the world.

Wayfair is looking for an experienced Engineering Leader to join our Enterprise Software engineering team. The Enterprise Software team’s mission is to drive productivity and work automation solutions across our 8,000+ employees by providing a blend of in-house custom developed workflow management tools as well as 3rd party integrations where needed. In this role, you’ll drive build-versus-buy discussions with other leaders across Wayfair and partner with our product team to identify, quantify and solve business needs.
We work across the stack, from internal full-stack applications to back-end systems responsible for data processing and API integrations. Our ideal leader has a background working with web applications and fast iteration in an agile environment. We deeply value: curiosity, collaboration, and an eagerness to make an impact on the business. What you’ll get to do:

Develop the next generation of case management solutions to reduce customer issue time-to-resolution.
Integrate a new HCM platform and optimizing Talent Acquisition processes.
Build, productionize and iterate on a custom workflow management platform.
Manage and expand multiple Enterprise Software sprint teams focused on building custom software and integrating 3 rd party software to drive efficiency and workflow process across Wayfair.
Collaborate with stakeholders from every org along with your product management partners to understand their business challenges, discuss tradeoffs and creatively solve as we continue to push for greater customer satisfaction.
Drive build versus buy decisions.
7,000+ internal customers will use your solutions as we strive to delight 8.9 million active external customers

About you:
5+ years experience as a software developer on any web stack.
3+ years experience managing and mentoring teams.
Strong instinct for understanding business value and prioritization
Passion for leading teams and growing their capabilities through mentorship

Experience with PHP, MSSQL, JQuery, React
Ecommerce background

About Wayfair
Wayfair Inc. offers an extensive selection of home furnishings and décor across all styles and price points. The Wayfair family of sites includes:
Wayfair , an online destination for all things home
Joss & Main , where beautiful furniture and finds meet irresistible savings
AllModern , unbelievable prices on everything modern
DwellStudio , unexpected modern design for everyday life
Birch Lane , a collection of classic furnishings and timeless home décor
Wayfair generated $3.6 billion in net revenue for the twelve months ended March 31, 2017. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts with operations throughout North America and Europe, the company employs more than 5,700 people.

Company Description:
Quick Base provides a cloud-based platform that empowers problem solvers to quickly turn ideas for better ways to work into apps that make their organizations more efficient. For nearly 20 years, people of all technical backgrounds have been using the Quick Base platform to create solutions that streamline processes, capture real-time data, and improve company operations while working in concert with existing IT systems. Based in Cambridge, MA and a former division of Intuit, Quick Base has a 6,000+ customer universe of app-enabled businesses that spans all industries and company sizes, and includes more than half of the Fortune 100. Come join us as we grow.
About the team:
At Quick Base, we believe that exceptional employees are not only the key to our success, but also to our customers’ success. Our teams are small, diverse, nimble and highly empowered to drive Design excellence. Each team owns its own commitments and outcomes. Our employees enjoy interesting challenges, learn fast, and strive to do the best work of their life.
Position Overview:
Join the Quick Base Experience Design (XD) team as a Visual Designer to set the course of the visual language for Quick Base, the no-code application development platform that allows business users to rapidly create powerful business apps without the need for technical assistance or coding.
You’ll work with interaction and content designers to revolutionize Quick Base via an updated design vision and visual treatment. Taking direction from a senior visual designer, you’ll support exceptional visual design, democratize that design through patterns, and document it in a visual design system. You’ll work with product managers, interaction designers, UX content writers, and front-end developers to create innovative product experiences based on deep insights into customer and market needs.
Responsibilities:
Extend the visual language for Quick Base.
Using Sketch, build a responsive library of the different patterns.
Create interaction animations and transitions.
Build out the Quick Base iconography.
Provide visuals and animations for short video tutorials.
Help the UX content writers with visuals for online help and user assistance.
Work with front-end developers to incorporate patterns into re-usable components.

Qualifications:
Online portfolio showcasing examples of outstanding visual design and a systematic thought process, with deliverables for Web and mobile.
A degree in graphic or interactions design, or a relevant field.
At least 2 years’ experience delivering graphic design assets.
Significant experience with Sketch to produce designs, icons, and visual artifacts.
Experience with Adobe Products (mostly Photoshop, Illustrator; After Effects is a plus).
Proven track record of executing visual design, with an emphasis on simplicity and clarity.
Organization skills and self-discipline to work through a systematic design language.
Practical knowledge of visual design systems, trends, principles and best practices.
Comfort with managing code and files via GitHub or Storybook repositories is a plus.
Experience with HTM5, CSS/Sass, and JavaScript is a plus.
Interaction design experience is a plus.

Behavioral and Interpersonal:
Strong organizational, analytical skills and problem solving ability – both strategic and tactical planning
Self-starter, resourceful and intellectually curious
Natural ability to be transparent and open to feedback
Sense of urgency without sacrificing quality
Capacity to work in a high growth, fast-paced environment
“Can do” attitude and intense desire to excel
Collaborative, team player with high standards and ethics

The Principal UI Software Engineer position functions at an expert level and will lead the development of a user-friendly, highly interactive user experience for our enterprise-level web applications as well as steer UI and UX for both legacy and new development of web-based systems. Working closely with multiple development teams, this role takes ownership of usability throughout the entire development process, from brainstorming new features through release. This role also works closely with product managers and the User Experience team, to understand users of the software. The Principal UI Software Engineer will use the latest web technologies to translate complex analytic concepts into responsive, accessible front-end solutions. This includes applying modern web-based UI design methodologies, software architecture theories, and quality testing concepts in a software-as-a-service engineering environment. This role represents the software engineering project/team as a senior UI contact and often performs in a leadership role.


Job Responsibilities:

Lead UI development providing user interface expertise (specifications, design, creation, maintenance and quality) and innovation.

Collaborate and influence product, user experience, and development teams to establish functionality and design specifications for enhancements to the UI framework and new product interfaces.

Set technical project direction, including base architecture standards, technology platform, analysis and design as well as leading the implementation of user interfaces.

Collaborate and influence product ownership to drive UI and UX solutions that solve complex business problems.

Create wireframes and prototypes based on functional requirements from Product Owners.

Create, enhance, maintain, and test significant software UI framework components.

Lead and write front-end unit tests.

Identify and champion opportunities for the company to advance our UI designs and technology.

Technical leader in an environment that includes the refactoring of a legacy ASP.NET UI framework to a modern UI framework.

Represent the team in cross-organizational activities and recognized within the Development organization as a senior technical expert in one or more key areas of technology.

Job Requirements:

Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Applications, Information Systems or closely-related scientific field (or equivalent foreign degree)

2 years of experience as a Software Engineer/Developer or User Interface Engineer.

Qualifying experience must have been in front-end software applications development of enterprise-level Human Capital Management software products in a web-based environment (including cloud-based software-as-a-service configurations), distributed systems and mobile technologies and within the defined Agile Scrum methodology and software development practices.


Qualifying experience, which may have been gained concurrently, must include:

 2 years of user interface coding experience encompassing HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JavaScript Closures, Themes, and Minification and Obfuscation techniques.

 2 years of experience defining software specifications (functional, design, etc.) as well as accessibility standards such as WCAG

 2 years of experience working with UI related frameworks including core JavaScript, jQuery, Prototype, CSS pre-processors, JavaScript unit testing and YUI JavaScript test framework

 2 years of experience working on server-side Java technologies including JSP (JavaServer Pages) and Velocity templates; and

 2 years of experience working on user interface asset build and bundling tools including Ant and MSBuild.


Qualified candidates for consideration will have and must be able to demonstrate the following:

o Subject matter expertise and knowledge of Talent Management software (Recruiting, Performance Management, Succession Planning, Compensation, etc.).

o Knowledge of cross-browser standards compliancy.

o Knowledge of HTML DOM and Ajax.

o Knowledge of Microsoft related technologies including C# and ASP.NET MVC

o Ability to identify and implement design patterns and best practices that promote maintainability

Duties & Responsibilities
The Growth Lab at Harvard’s Center for International Development (CID) seeks to answer why some countries grow while others remain mired in poverty. Our team takes government data, combines it with our research methodology on growth and turns it into interactive data tools affecting citizens and policy at the highest international levels. This is a unique opportunity for a committed and enthusiastic backend/data specialist to join CID’s Growth Lab to improve the livelihoods of millions of people.

Our development team is working with large data sets, developing exploratory data visualization applications and platforms, and bringing forth insights and information in an accessible way to a variety of users, including policymakers around the world.

In this position you will make a meaningful contribution to the development and enhancement of our online platforms, including our flagship tool, the Atlas of Economic Complexity, produced by the Growth Lab. The Atlas is an innovative platform that allows users to visualize a country’s trade and explore growth opportunities for every country and over 900 products.

The backend/ data specialist will collaborate with a growing team of developers and designers working on the visualization of data and analysis from CID’s Growth Lab research. The engineer will be expected to work closely with our current backend/data engineer and among a diverse set of stakeholders to learn, solve, develop, and deploy.

The candidate will take a mature and professional approach to their work, demonstrating adaptability, reliability and strong communication skills. On this team, engineers must be comfortable self-directing their daily activities to meet frequent deadlines across the entire agile software development cycle.
Position responsibilities:
 Learn and work alongside our backend/data engineer and our frontend engineer to build and improve backend APIs that query and deliver data quickly and efficiently for our data visualization tools Help deploy and manage server systems that host our data visualization tools Contribute to the build of data pipelines to clean, process and analyze large and varied datasets Help solve a wide variety of everyday technology issues, encountered by researchers (i.e. scraping data, extracting text from images, visualizing large datasets) Work with our product manager, developers, designer and users across the full software lifecycle: requirements, design, development, releasing and maintenance
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree and 2 years of demonstrated hands-on experience OR a high school diploma and 3 years of demonstrated hands-on experience. (Experience through previous employment positions, internships, or practicums, with the following (in order of preference):
Web backend development (flask / Django / similar preferred)
Data cleaning and analysis tools (pandas preferred)
Experience with the linux command line
Familiar with git and workflows for collaboration (GitFlow, Github Flow or similar)
Experience working within an agile software development cycle
Additional Qualifications
Strong demonstration of engineering maturity, including:
A commitment to writing reliable and maintainable code
Exposing and documenting the underlying trade-offs when making technical decisions, rather than arguing for “right” and “wrong” choices
Reflecting on the broad context of our daily processes, problems, and technical decisions
Demonstrated experience and curiosity learning languages, tools and frameworks that are unfamiliar
Comfortable and willing to communicate technical ideas to audiences with varying technical expertise
Able to adapt to an ever-changing role that’s oriented towards solving current challenges the team is facing rather than staying within a single purview
Interested in economic and social development issues
A can-do, collaborative approach to your work, free of ego and complaining
Additional Information

The employee is frequently required to use hands/fingers for data entry and filing. The employee must be able to lift up to 25 pounds.

Voxware ® is looking for a senior-level Software Developer to help turn an ambitious product roadmap into a fantastic customer experience! If you’re interested in challenging problems and significant product ownership, and making an immediate impact, you’re in the right place.


Who are we looking for?


First and foremost, a strong object-oriented developer who knows a thing or three about application performance.


Our products and projects are Java-heavy and you’ll be hitting the ground running, so solid experience with the language and ecosystem is really indispensible in this case. We do run on Android clients, so Android programming (or eagerness to learn it) would be an enormous plus.


Other technologies you will likely be using or developing with across our stack include:


User Interface

Google Web Toolkit
HighCharts
Database

MongoDB
SQL Server
Oracle
Web Application

J2EE stack (Spring, Hibernate)
Tomcat
REST Services
JavaScript
You have had demonstrable design and coding input into commercial software products of significant scale.


You have excellent troubleshooting skills at the software and systems levels, and are able to independently research solutions.


You’re a fast learner, able to achieve productivity in new tools, APIs, languages, and platforms quickly.


You’re a veteran of multiple software development cycles, with experience in:

Interpreting business and functional requirements.
Providing sound, informed estimates for development tasks
Designing complex software – choosing algorithms, data structures, and programming constructs, languages, and tools to fit the problem you’re trying to solve.
Modeling data.
Writing correct, maintainable, well-documented and commented code, and reviewing others’ code.
Unit testing, especially with JUnit. Also functional and integration testing.
Using source control and versioning systems. (We use git.)
Building, packaging, and releasing code with clear and detailed release notes. We build with Maven, Ant, and Visual Studio, and it wouldn’t hurt to be familiar with C/UNIX style makefiles.
You’re familiar with computer networking, and understand multi-threaded development and concurrency, ideally using Java.


You’re able to communicate clearly – verbally and in writing - and work effectively with colleagues across the company, vendors, and customers.


You’re a lifelong learner with a passion for technology and for finding better ways to do things.


Some pluses include:

Agile software development
Mobile application development
Handheld computing experience
Native (C code) development
Why Voxware?

For our collegial work environment, where you’ll trade ideas every day - and in our occasional fun hackathons - with technophiles like yourself.
For the opportunity to fit new technology into our product where it works best. If you’ve got ideas, we’ll listen.
For our commitment to education and professional development.
For our flexible work-remotely policy; you’ll have an office and plenty of opportunities for face time, but also a company laptop and the ability to create great software from anywhere.
To be part of a market-leading product and a commitment to innovation.
For competitive compensation and benefits, including stock options.
This position will be based in Voxware’s Waltham, MA office. Occasional travel to our Princeton, NJ office may be requested.


You must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship.

We are a firm of proudly independent financial advisors who offer high-quality services to a growing number of Fortune 500 companies. Co-founded by a Nobel Prize winner and based in the Silicon Valley, we are now seeking a Junior Web Developer to join an established software engineering team at our beautiful office space in the Seaport District of Boston, MA.


You will play a key role in system administration, business application development, and workflow automation to design an effective and robust solution for our business teams that is highly usable, scalable, and maintainable.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

Identify, analyze, recommend and implement innovative solutions to improve business processes in CRM, HRIS, and ERP systems
Work collaboratively with business users and other IT groups to design, build, configure, and automate workflows in existing applications
Integrate existing applications with other systems and third-party providers
Partner with other stakeholders to develop and maintain disaster recovery procedures and periodically test those procedures for effectiveness
Seek out ways to utilize applications to improve processes and productivity; make recommendations to support an organization scaling at a rapid pace
Assist in review and implementation of IT general controls and procedures
Provide off-hour support on occasion
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
One to five (1-5) years' related experience
Hands-on experience in object oriented programming
Working knowledge of Salesforce, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, JQuery, RESTful Web Services
Understanding of relational database concepts
Ability to quickly learn new technologies
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams at all levels, as well as with outside vendors and contractors
Excellent written and oral communications skills; ability to clearly define projects, objectives, goals, schedules and assignments
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to explain technical issues to non-technical people
Curiosity, empathy, and understanding of business goals and needs
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience in Jira Service Desk, UltiPro, SharePoint, or Salesforce certified developer strongly preferred
Experience with JavaScript, CSS, HTML, AngularJS, Bootstrap
Experience in Agile development preferred

UI/Front-End Engineer: Early-Stage Startup Focused on the Open Source Community
My client is a very early-stage, extremely well funded startup building a platform and marketplace to support the Open Source community. The Founders have had multiple successful exits (Google acquired their last startup), and they are building a collaborative remote-friendly team. While early-stage, this is a best-of-both-worlds opportunity. You'll be able to make an enormous impact and directly influence the technical direction and overall success of the company, one that is combined with the stability and family-friendly culture of a much later-stage company. Your work will enable companies and institutions that utilize Open Source software to gain insight into the tools they're using (security, reliability, maintenance, etc.), as well as a platform/marketplace to filter money back to the developers and Open Source community.

Senior or Principal Front-End Engineer

BS in Computer Science, or related field.

EnergySavvy is looking to add a Client Engagement Professional to an amazing team. Our cloud software helps electric and gas utilities modernize and improve customer experiences as the energy industry undergoes a period of fundamental transformation. If you’re passionate about cleantech and interested in enterprise software support, you’ll thrive as a Client Engagement Professional at EnergySavvy.
As a Client Engagement Professional, you will help our customers use our software to the fullest potential. You will be the go-to resource for customers and internal stakeholders for insight on how our software works and what it can do. You will learn the software inside out and work with customers and developers to help grow our software in an environment with rapid deployments and constant innovation.
Our client engagement team’s background includes technical project management and software implementation consulting. We hire proven rock stars in these fields, but we also make bets on promising up-and-comers that have shown massive success in other fields or academia. This position will be based in our Boston office.
Responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:
Help manage new SaaS (Software as a service) implementations.
Proactively communicate with customers via phone, email, telepathy, etc. to ensure effective and delightful user experiences.
Triage, research, reproduce and solve day-to-day questions from customers while teaching them to be more independent.
Monitor questions and develop upstream solutions to recurring problems.
Collaborate with developers, product managers and customers to build useful, usable software.
Document new features, create user guides, test new development and generally own user acceptance of new features.
Usher new features through the entire development cycle and drive their success.
Travel up to 10%
Required Skills:
Bachelor’s Degree in a technology-related discipline or a bachelor’s degree in an unrelated field with experience in technical project management or enterprise software support preferred.
1-2 years technical project management or enterprise software support.
Patient, communicative, team player that is detail-oriented and has outstanding interpersonal skills.
Fluency with Windows and Mac operating systems and web technologies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, tenacity and fortitude.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to balance multiple short and long-term projects of varying scopes with customers across the country.
Vigorous communication skills.
Curiosity about and commitment to technology, energy efficiency and your potential.

EnergySavvy is a cloud software company that helps utilities transform their customer experience and operations. EnergySavvy provides personalized customer insights, breakthrough customer engagement, and automated program delivery with the industry's only platform purpose-built to enhance the customer experience and increase operational efficiency. More than 30 utilities and state programs rely on EnergySavvy to enable customer experience transformation in the modern, digital customer era.

Our primary applications; the TMS® and Customs Management® are used to plan, execute, track, and settle billions of dollars of transportation movements every year.

We are a Scrum shop that works closely with our end users and subject matter experts to make sure that the software we build solves real-world problems and isn’t painful to use.

We utilize a number of technologies including some of the usual suspects for storage and application programming (i.e. Oracle and Java, respectively) and a number of web technology tools and libraries (e.g. JSPs, Struts, Flex, jQuery) on the front end of our applications. This means our developers learn and apply skills in everything from interface development to complex back end business logic.

Experience supporting or testing software

Advancement Information Services (AIS) is currently seeking a talented individual to fill the role of Applications Developer. The Applications Developer's primary responsibility will be to focus on ensuring the development of quality software using best practice architecture, coding practice and development processes on a day- to -day basis. The Applications Developer will work mainly with Salesforce proprietary languages (Apex, Visual Force, Lightning, etc.), but will also work with Microsoft.NET languages as well as several different front-end scripting and markup languages.
This position reports to the Senior AIS Applications Developer, and coordinates with analysts and end-users to determine functional requirements and create new applications across various systems. Additionally, the applications Developer provides maintenance and updates to existing applications as needed. The Applications Developer will also partner with cross-functional teams to establish and support the application development and test environments. To ensure that essential services are provided to the university community, the employee will be required to work outside their regular working hours as needed.

Qualifications:
The ideal candidate will have a minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent related work experience, along with an initiative for continuing studies and coursework.
The candidate must also have a minimum of two years’ experience with integrating with and developing Salesforce.com applications. This includes developing using the Apex programing language, creating workflows and formulas, and is familiar with Salesforce.com administration.
The candidate must have experience with current available toolsets and developer methodologies.
The candidate must have at least three years’ experience with at least two of the following technologies: RDBMS (Oracle, SQL Server) (sql, pl/sql, t-sql,), Banner (Student, Finance, AR or Advancement), Object Oriented Programming Language (Java, C#), Scripting Languages (Perl, korn shell, c-shell, python), Web Applications experience (http/https), Web Services, CastIron or other Integration Platform experience, or SQR.
Ideal candidate has demonstrated ability to work well directly with customers and teams in a large environment. Must have excellent written and oral communication skills. Must have the ability to manage multiple projects and activities.
The candidate must be a creative problem solver who can adapt to changes in real time.

job_title: Senior Director of Digital Information Systems
summary:
The Senior Director of Digital Information Systems will lead YouthBuild USA’s efforts to implement and utilize digital technology tools for program work, organizational collaboration, data collection and dissemination. This work is divided into three major categories: Strategy, research, and planning around use of digital technology across the organization; oversight of existing digital information systems; and requirements gathering for new digital information projects.
The Senior Director reports to the CEO and leads a digital team designed to meet the digital technology and communication needs of YouthBuild USA and YouthBuild International. They will supervise the Associate Director of IT, Junior Web Developer (TBD), Digital Information Specialist, and will supervise new members of the digital team including systems support staff, project managers, etc. They will provide guidance and direction to others who are implementing technology solutions to work across YouthBuild USA. They will utilize digital technology to meet the needs of YouthBuild USA and further the mission of the organization.
This position does not have recurring access to vulnerable populations: children 17 years of age or younger, persons age 60 and older, or people with disabilities. A portion of this work influences the direction, management and scope of the AmeriCorps grant.
Requirements
RESPONSIBILITIES
Strategy and Planning
Explores the latest developments in digital strategy and online systems to position YouthBuild growth in these areas.
Evaluates new systems to meet the needs of departments across the organization.
Works with the Communications, Advocacy, Graduate Leadership and Program Teams to produce a digital strategy aimed to increase staff effectiveness and YouthBuild’s impact.
Teams with YBI to develop and design digital systems procedures to meet their needs in line with YouthBuild USA’s systems.
Oversight of Existing Tools
Manages day-to-day operation and technical aspects of YouthBuild USA websites, including custom application development or integration.
YouthBuild.org
Two custom web apps
CIvicrm and Extranet
Supervises junior Web Developer and any necessary consultants to ensure that deadlines and organizational priorities are met.
Ensures that there is detailed and proper documentation for all existing tools.
Engages other departments in intermediate-advanced uses of digital information systems, especially those with our program and student level data.
Collaborates with the Director of Data Services to engage with and provide appropriate data to external evaluators.
Offers expertise to departments evaluating external digital systems for project management and other needs.
Project Planning and Implementation
Leads requirements gathering to understand and meet technical and data needs that emerge from new sources of funding or new organizational priorities.
Partners with other staff members/departments to clearly define specifications for new technology projects and growth to existing projects.
Produces an overall digital information map of the organization in support of senior management making priorities with respect to technology vision, available budget and competing priorities.
Manages website migrations/implementations/upgrades/changes, ensuring objectives are effectively communicated and optimal impact is realized.
Works with departments to systematize their processes using digital tools, where applicable gaining alignment between departments.
Leads project planning across departments for implementation of new technology tools and systems.
Plans and executes system rollouts and training plans.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in engineering, computer science, or web-related field or equivalent experience.
Minimum 5-7 years of supervisory experience.
5-10 years of experience working in technology in a non-profit setting.
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Experience managing technical vendors .
Extensive web technology and database skills.
Familiarity with the web development process and APIs.
Strong familiarity with emerging web technologies.
Knowledge of non-profit technology best practices.
Experience with Drupal, CiviCRM and/or Salesforce a plus.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Some Experience with LAMP stack.
Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team and communities.
The ability to discuss data analysis and technical issues with multiple internal and external partners including private and federal funders.
Strong facilitation skills.
For consideration, please submit your resume and cover letter by Monday, February 26.
Apply for this job

The Workday HRIT developer is responsible for the analysis, design, development, testing, documentation, implementation and support of HR related applications as well as working on and leading small to mid-size HRIT projects. Develop new, or modifying existing, integrations from Workday to internal and external clients using Workday technologies including calculated fields, custom reports, EIBs, Document Transformation, Workday Studio, Web Services, etc.

Administration of Workday security including modifying existing or creation of new, where applicable, to Domain Security Policies, Security Groups and worker role assignments
Support clients on HR related applications, including technology, processes and integrations, to resolve issues
Liaison with other technology groups within BBH in relation to non Workday related aspects of HR applications which can include SSO, infrastructure, email, production support, etc.
Infrastructure related maintenance support on HR related applications which can include after-hours support or weekend work
Skills Required:
3 years minimum of Workday development experience required
3+ years relevant experience in HR systems and solutions such as Workday HCM, PeopleSoft HRMS, SAP HCM or Experience with SQR and SQL technology
Experience with integration technologies as it relates to Workday including but not limited to Web Services, XML, XSLT, SOAP and Java required
Knowledge of Workday HCM required
Experience in the financial services industry at a global organization is highly desired
Understanding of the HR processes and procedures (i.e. compensation, benefits, payroll, time tracking, etc.)
Experience with database tools and functionality, preferably Oracle
Experience with SDLC, requirements and technical documentation, including ability to provide feedback on design of processes
Strong communication, interpersonal, analytical, organizational and problem solving skills
Ability to manage multiple, high priority tasks and adjust to shifting priorities, while meeting deadlines
Must be self-motivated and able to work independently as well as on a team
Ability to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality and integrity
BS/BA degree or equivalent required
Grade-8

Adventive is looking for a Flex Developer to join a fast-paced startup that is transforming Internet Advertising. We are in search for a rock-star contributor that can help us build a web application product that will revolutionize Internet Advertising. We are simplifying rich media ad building, making ads useful, and generating killer ROI for advertisers. in our model everyone is a winner!


Our highly motivated team shares passion for creating cutting edge solutions and building a product with outstanding User Experience. We have proven success with the Agile (Scrum)process which allows us to focus on must-have features and quickly respond to customer needs.


Responsibilities:


• Analyze product requirements/features/user stories and feasibility for delivery within time constraints.


• Estimate, design, implement, and unit test Adventive software.


• Collaborate and share knowledge with other engineers.


Requirements:


• Excellence and passion for web technologies and personal drive to make a meaningful change.


• Minimum 3 years of combined Flash and Flex 4 development


• Proficiency in JavaScript, CSS, SQL and relational databases (PostgreSQL, MS SQL, etc.), Linux, and Apache.


• Experience with PHP 5+ is not required but would be a plus.


• Online Advertising experience would be a plus


We’re also looking for these ‘soft’ skills:


• Self starter who has an ability to work with minimum direction


• Team player with a passion to collaborate with others


• A willingness to own a problem from inception to solution


If you meet these requirements, we offer an agile and creative environment, competitive compensation, and an opportunity to make your mark by completely transforming digital marketing


Note: Adventive will screen all resumes; only applicants whose skills most closely match the job description will be invited for an interview.

Manager of Web Development-1800207
Description
Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
Key Focus/Scope
Manager will oversee team of developers and technical leads in the US Division Shared Services team responsible for developing and maintaining John Hancock’s public facing web sites and mobile applications.
Major Responsibilities
Develop an effective organization which optimizes resources (i.e. tools, methods, and staff) to meet the needs of a rapidly changing technological and business environment.
Participate in efforts to drive the evolution of John Hancock’s web site strategy including the security, SEO, Analytics, and user experience
Work with the product area marketing teams to foster effective business relationships between different teams.
Manage the vendor relationship with the major vendors used within the team, including contract and expectations
Manage the intake, scheduling, estimating and delivery of web site development and support activities
Ensure best practices are utilized across the team for the web site technologies (Adobe AEM CMS, Teamsite CMS, JAVA, J2EE, JSP, Javascript, HTML, CSS)
Develop onshore/offshore staffing models and mentor/develop team members
Manage the staff and contractor resources to effectively and efficiently staff the agile teams within the shared service as well as those in the business units
Track key metrics and SLA’s for service delivery and take appropriate actions to further optimize and extend development services offered
Experience
10+ years experience as a systems professional including the management of systems operations and the successful tactical management of complex projects.
Experience managing web technology and recommending long term direction and strategy
4-6 years overseeing collocated and virtual teams in a location agnostic manner
Knowledge & Skills
Demonstrated leadership skills. Strong motivational, development and negotiating skills.
Strong financial and project management skills.
Proven ability to exercise flexibility and judgment in assessing business issues and risks in a dynamic environment.
Ability to influence individuals across boundaries to achieve objectives. Ability to identify necessary resources, and negotiate the proper levels of support from both technical and client communities.
Agile, SAFE (Scaled Agile Framework), Iterative, Waterfall methodologies as part of SDLC
Strong communication skills and ability to manage personal & team workloads effectively
Adaptable to managing globally; ability to effectively manage virtual teams comprised of both on- and off–shore resources
Key Differentiator
Previous experience working with the Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) Content Management System
Previous experience in a shared services delivery role
Previous experience in Agile development and SAFE (Scaled Agile Framework)
About John Hancock Financial and Manulife
John Hancock is a division of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial service group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers’ needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were over $1 trillion (US$806 billion) as of September 30, 2017. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.
One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports approximately 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and college savings plans. We also offer advice through Signator, a network of independent financial advisors. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.
Agency submissions and contacts are by invitation only and must be initiated by John Hancock's Recruiting Department only. Unsolicited agency submissions will not be honored.

Voxware ® is looking for a senior-level Software Developer to help turn an ambitious product roadmap into a fantastic customer experience! If you’re interested in challenging problems and significant product ownership, and making an immediate impact, you’re in the right place.


Who are we looking for?


First and foremost, a strong object-oriented developer who knows a thing or three about application performance.


Our products and projects are Java-heavy and you’ll be hitting the ground running, so solid experience with the language and ecosystem is really indispensible in this case. We do run on Android clients, so Android programming (or eagerness to learn it) would be an enormous plus.


Other technologies you will likely be using or developing with across our stack include:


User Interface

Google Web Toolkit
HighCharts
Database

MongoDB
SQL Server
Oracle
Web Application

J2EE stack (Spring, Hibernate)
Tomcat
REST Services
JavaScript
You have had demonstrable design and coding input into commercial software products of significant scale.


You have excellent troubleshooting skills at the software and systems levels, and are able to independently research solutions.


You’re a fast learner, able to achieve productivity in new tools, APIs, languages, and platforms quickly.


You’re a veteran of multiple software development cycles, with experience in:

Interpreting business and functional requirements.
Providing sound, informed estimates for development tasks
Designing complex software – choosing algorithms, data structures, and programming constructs, languages, and tools to fit the problem you’re trying to solve.
Modeling data.
Writing correct, maintainable, well-documented and commented code, and reviewing others’ code.
Unit testing, especially with JUnit. Also functional and integration testing.
Using source control and versioning systems. (We use git.)
Building, packaging, and releasing code with clear and detailed release notes. We build with Maven, Ant, and Visual Studio, and it wouldn’t hurt to be familiar with C/UNIX style makefiles.
You’re familiar with computer networking, and understand multi-threaded development and concurrency, ideally using Java.


You’re able to communicate clearly – verbally and in writing - and work effectively with colleagues across the company, vendors, and customers.


You’re a lifelong learner with a passion for technology and for finding better ways to do things.


Some pluses include:

Agile software development
Mobile application development
Handheld computing experience
Native (C code) development
Why Voxware?

For our collegial work environment, where you’ll trade ideas every day - and in our occasional fun hackathons - with technophiles like yourself.
For the opportunity to fit new technology into our product where it works best. If you’ve got ideas, we’ll listen.
For our commitment to education and professional development.
For our flexible work-remotely policy; you’ll have an office and plenty of opportunities for face time, but also a company laptop and the ability to create great software from anywhere.
To be part of a market-leading product and a commitment to innovation.
For competitive compensation and benefits, including stock options.
This position will be based in Voxware’s Waltham, MA office. Occasional travel to our Princeton, NJ office may be requested.


You must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship.

Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE: GCI) is an innovative, digitally focused media and marketing solutions company committed to strengthening communities across our network. With an unmatched local-to-national reach, Gannett touches the lives of more than 110 million people monthly with our Pulitzer-Prize winning content, consumer experiences and benefits, and advertiser products and services. Gannett brands include USA TODAY NETWORK with the iconic USA TODAY and more than 100 local media brands, digital marketing services companies ReachLocal and SweetIQ, and U.K. media company Newsquest. To connect with us, visit www.gannett.com.

Reviewed is looking for a talented developer to join us as we extend our unique homegrown publishing platform and work to scale with our quickly growing user base. We have gone beyond traditional publishing platforms to build a dynamic application to help consumers find the best purchasing options on the products we recommend. The right candidate will help to make this platform better.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter with knowledge of database design and hosting infrastructure, who also is interested in good front-end UI and Javascript applications, and who loves to build useful software. Experience leading a team is a bonus.

We are looking for candidates in the Boston, MA or Pittsburgh, PA area.

What is needed


Proven expertise with Ruby on Rails development, developing well-tested and organized applications
Experience developing JavaScript-driven applications, especially in Angular.js, using single-page-architecture or similar backed by a server-side data model
Excited about optimization, performance and scaling to deliver great content to millions of users
Interest in crafting an excellent user experience, both for the reader and for the publishing teams
Excellent communication skills. We communicate constantly via chat and video about ideas, issues, and to help each other out
A desire to be part of a small team where your opinions, ideas and creativity are valued

Technical skills required


Real-world web development with Rails and/or Node.js, C#, Java, Python, etc.
PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, noSQL
Test-driven development using Rspec, Minitest or similar
Familiarity with Javascript frameworks (Angular.js, or Ember, React) and jQuery
Real-world web development with Bootstrap, HTML, CSS / SASS, and JavaScript / CoffeeScript
Working knowledge of Go and Node.js, or ability to learn
Basic git usage and git-flow workflow
Deployment and management of applications on Heroku and AWS-based infrastructure
Service-oriented architectures and API design and integrations

About Reviewed

Buying stuff is easy. Buying the right thing is hard. That’s where we can help. Reviewed.com, a part of the USA TODAY Network, brings consumers the most scientific and trustworthy reviews available, written by our team of experts. We believe that tough, objective reviews are the best way to analyze products. We provide readers with insightful, practical, and entertaining stories that help them make informed decisions.

Our offices are in Cambridge, MA. We produce meaningful work in a spirited and team-minded environment, with time and location flexibility and good work/life balance.

Reviewed is an Equal-opportunity employer with a supporting and inclusive environment, and encourages applicants from all backgrounds.

Candidates must live in the United States and be able to work legally in the United States.

+ Minimum 6 months of experience with responsive design and grid frameworks for cross-browser compatibility such as Bootstrap or Foundation

Preferred Qualifications:
+ Bachelor?s degree in Computer Science

+ Experience using Typescript

+ Experience working at an advertising, design, consulting agency, or a web startup

+ Experience on mobile or web development teams

+ JavaScript MVC / MVW frameworks (Angular, Backbone or Ember)

Front End Developer
3 month contract
Boston, MA

Liaison with Information Architects and Designers to finalize the usability and feasibility of interface designs.
Create seamless processes for the team by establishing standards and frameworks for effective and efficient integration.
Create and track the plan and activities for the team members on a day to day basis.
Provide training to peers and clients in relevant technologies.
Create accurate, realistic design plan for the project, ensuring that all tracks are effectively planned.

Strong, innovative and initiative-seeking approach to problem solving and finding solutions.
Flexible and proactive/self-motivated working style with strong personal ownership of problem resolution.
Strong communication skills with sound articulation and comprehension.
Ardent desire to explore and learn emerging interactive technologies.


EXPERIENCE GUIDELINES
3+ year’s experience
Experience in Agile/Scrum build environment. Large team experience preferred.
Excellent knowledge of hand-coded HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Adobe DTM, and Adobe Target
Bonus: Hands-on experience working with Object Oriented JavaScript (OOJS), JavaScript libraries and their practical uses in building complex interactive experiences.
Familiarity with MV* frameworks (AngularJS, Backbone.js, or similar) and knowledge of common JavaScript design patterns.
Familiarity of working with frontend build systems and automating the same
Familiarity of Analytics Suits and Adobe DTM and Target specifically, and Marketing Cloud experience preferred.
Understanding of SEO and accessibility and how they relate to development.
Moderate to Strong graphics manipulation/optimization skills using Photoshop.
Hands-on experience working with server-side JavaScript frameworks based on Node.js is a big plus.
EDUCATION
Full Time Bachelors / Masters degree preferred.

The Executive Office of Health and Human Services is seeking an experienced professional Senior Software Quality Assurance (SQA)/Business Analyst to join the Enterprise development team supporting the Department of Transitional Assistance’s enterprise eligibility determination and case management solution called Benefit Eligibility and Control On-line Network (BEACON) and its supporting mainframe legacy systems. Under the direction of the Manager/Supervisor, the SQA/Business Analyst’s primary responsibility will be to prepare test plans, test data, and systems documentation in order to validate changes made to the systems meet the defined requirements.
The SQA Analyst will participate in all phases of SDLC, including but not limited to identifying, tracking resolving defects, generating test data and scenarios, creating requirements and design documents, working with users and technical teams to facilitate JAD sessions, UAT, training and other activities as needed by the Manager/Supervisor. In addition, as part of the SDLC, the Analyst will document the test procedures and provide quality assurance reviews on existing processes and production implementations. The SQA Analyst is responsible for the proper execution of the test scripts and cases to ensure all meet testing objective. Experience using SQA tools is required (e.g. IBM/Rational such as Test manager, ClearQuest) and database querying tools (e.g. Oracle ,TOAD and PL/SQL). The Analyst must also have experience working in a complex environment particularly in a distributed network of web, application, batch, and database servers. The Analyst will provide operational production support to reported issues by triaging, troubleshooting and resolving issues and provide coverage to other technical teams as needed by Manager/Supervisor.
The individual will facilitate activities between the project team and IT service groups to ensure business needs are met; and participate in all phases of the project life cycle as needed by the Manager/Supervisor from development to implementation including post production support. This position is preliminary located in Boston, Massachusetts but may require light travel to other EOHHS offices as needed by the Manager. Working knowledge of BI tools(e.g. Cognos), collaboration portals (e.g SharePoint) preferred.
Responsibilities and qualifications:
6 years minimum testing applications and conduction systems analysis and working with end users to understand business requirements.
Analyze software development deliverables such as requirement documents, detailed design documents and use cases for thoroughness and detail.
Design and execute manual and automated test scripts, exploratory testing, and documenting and reporting the test results.
Identify, track and report software deficiencies.
Use SQL and database querying tools (e.g. TOAD) and PL/SQL to extract data from relational databases.
Participate in Performance, Accessibility, Vulnerability, etc… testing using trade tools and industry best practices.
Assess and revise test sequence and scope based upon test results and/or change in product design.
Identify areas for improving efficiency, shortening of test cycles and automation of test scripts, while recommending solutions for improvement.
Work with end user to define and document requirements for Information Requests (IRs) and create, execute and validate requests to ensure accurate and timely completion.
Assist with the design, development and implementation of test strategies and tools.
Communicate the progress toward daily and weekly goals to the management team.
Provide weekly status reports on work completed to Manager/Supervisor.
Work with all technical staff (Business Analysts, Systems Analysts, Developers, Data Base Administrators, Architects, Technical Infrastructure and Operations) of EOHHS or other agencies or departments to ensure EOHHS System Design standards are met.
Identify production problems through batch log review, consultation with end users and programming staff and develop problem resolution and error correction strategies.
Supports full Systems Development Life cycle: Requirement Definition, Analysis, Design, Development, Testing and Conversion.
Support Developers in the understanding of the Application and the database.
Prepare systems or program documentation: flow charts, file layouts, input/output documentation and program narratives.
Prepare data flow diagrams by analyzing the business needs of end users to determine the flow of data within the organization.
Participate in the activities needed for the operation and maintenance of systems by interfacing with technical personnel and end users and recommending requisite changes.
Identify production problems through consultation with end users and programming staff and develops problem resolution and error correction strategies
Prepare status reports for end users for all user requests including but not limited to IRs.
Monitor systems operation; receives reports of problems; researches, resolves and tracks these problems.
Mentor/train staff in areas of expertise and ensure sufficient knowledge transfer occurs across the team to provide adequate coverage.
 Preferred Experience
 Experience with testing tools, Test Manger, JAWS, FireEyes, etc… and testing complex eligibility management systems.
Working knowledge of Agile Scrum, Rational Unified Process Development Methodology, etc… with focus on requirements and system analysis.
Working knowledge of Electronic Document Management and Collaboration tools, ClearQuest or other defect tracking tools and processes.
Broad knowledge of analysis and design standards and experience with analysis tools.
Ability to review agency policy and procedural documents and ensure the system complies with regulations.
Experience with ORACLE Databases and TOAD for ORACLE software and/or other queries tools.
Experience with Rational Interactive Tools.
Experience mentoring cross discipline colleagues on creation of UP deliverables.
Programming\SQL skills.
Experience with TAFDC, EAEDC, SNAP (FS) and SSA policy.
Experience with RDBMS Databases, IBM MQ Series and data exchange interfaces tools and technology, (e.g. Interchange).
Excellent interpersonal skills necessary to interact effectively with project managers, developers, business analysts, systems analysts, SQA analysts, business users/stakeholders, and data processing personnel of other agencies and companies.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, as well as within project teams, providing relevant system analysis services.
Highly analytical, with the ability to independently analyze, document findings and recommend solutions.

Description:

Excellent problem-solving and organizational skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English (French an asset)

Experience with software development using either Java and/or C#
Experience with REST, JavaScript, NodeJS, PHP, HTML
Familiarity with iOS and/or Android development is a bonus
Experience with one or more of the following: databases (Oracle, SQL Server, DB2), J2EE application servers (WebSphere, JBoss), operating systems (Windows Server, Linux, AIX)
Familiarity with network infrastructure, i.e. load balancers and firewalls
Understanding of privacy concepts, Web security issues and firewalls
Ability to work out of eSignLive headquarters (Montreal) preferred
Up to 15% travel mostly within the U.S. and Canada

C&W Services is offering an opportunity to work at a Class A office building for Boston Properties, one of the largest owners, managers and developers of Class A office properties in the United States. The position offers competitive salary and benefits, as well as a chance to work with a talented network of over 14,000 facilities maintenance professionals nationwide.
Building Engineer I
Reports To: Senior Property Manager
Primary Purpose of Position:
Maintain the integrity of all building systems, operate the building in an efficient manner, and perform a variety of tenant services while maintaining positive tenant relations in accordance with the client's established operational and safety procedures.
Essential Functions:
Perform and/or oversee the day-to-day efficient operation, maintenance and repair of all building and site systems for assigned properties. Building systems include but are not limited to HVAC, electrical, lighting, plumbing, energy management, water treatment, hardware, keying and fire protection.
Perform and/or oversee the installation, fabrication, construction, troubleshooting and repair or maintenance of complex mechanical and electrical equipment independently.
Receive work assignments, plan and/or generate work to be performed and obtain necessary tools, equipment and materials. Complete assignments and paperwork in a timely manner.
Oversee and/or assist Building Engineers and Maintenance Technicians with troubleshooting of building systems as needed.
Assist in the monitoring of contractors, inspecting work and generating deficiency lists.
Provide proper care to the assigned equipment, tools, and uniforms. Keep the shop, penthouse equipment rooms and common areas clean, organized and safe.
Follow and/or oversee inspection and service procedures outlined in the preventive maintenance and loss control programs. Coordinate, conduct and/or provide support in the day-to-day completion, organization and accuracy of preventive maintenance and loss control.
Accurately complete tenant requests, repair work and related records for the respective site/buildings as required. Follow applicable government / local authority requirements (e.g. Orders of Condition) and other records for assigned properties.
Regularly inspect all areas of the site/building(s) and report deficiencies as well as suggestions for improvements and take initiative to correct as appropriate.
Employ service procedures and techniques in accordance with established procedures.
Maintain logs on daily activities and events as required.
Provide technical support to the Lead and Chief Engineer. Assist in the technical training of less experienced staff.
Effectively communicate to the appropriate party/parties the status and activity of building operations and conditions and promptly report any potential or existing problems.
Available for various shifts, to fill in for other staff, and to work extended hours, nights, weekends and holidays to ensure adequate building coverage and perform necessary repairs as needed. Respond to after hours emergencies such as fire, flooding, severe weather (including but not limited to snow and ice removal) power outage and other related situations including clean-up activities per on-call procedures or as requested in critical situations.
Promote and maintain a high standard in the operation and appearance of the properties. Promote, establish and maintain positive relations with tenants via proactive communication, routine follow-up and a high level of customer service.
Non-Essential Functions:
Assist in the monitoring and implementation of OSHA requirements.
May procure vendor/contract prices for mechanical parts, equipment and tools.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Requirements and Qualifications:
High School diploma or equivalent educational certification preferred.
A minimum of 4 to 6 years as a Maintenance Technician / Building Engineer or equivalent field experience required including working knowledge of commercial office building systems.
Comprehensive training and certification in HVAC and other technologies relating to building engineering and/or equivalent job related training and experience.
Ability to work independently with limited supervision in a fast paced environment and deal effectively with multiple, simultaneous deadlines and projects. Ability to organize and coordinate work efficiently, set priorities and optimize the performance of others.
Advanced knowledge of OSHA, NEC and NFC codes and regulations.
Ability to participate in on-call schedule for after hour calls required. This may include working alternative schedules during on-call period (e.g. 7:00am – 3:30pm or 12:00pm – 8:30pm, etc.)
Strong technical and problem solving abilities including those related to mechanical controls and Building Automation Systems.
Intermediate skills necessary to operate computer for general day to day work and communications.
Ability to effectively communicate in writing as needed.
Strong working knowledge of web based work order systems, such as Angus, Interwise, Energy Link or similar required.
Demonstrate exemplary tenant relation skills. Project a positive appearance and attitude at all times.
Flexibility to work at various properties that may be assigned from time to time.
Possess knowledge of safe and efficient operation of all equipment, power and hand tools, including but not limited to, a snow blower.
Valid driver’s license and satisfactory driving record when required.
Licenses(s) for applicable jurisdiction and equipment as required based on location:
Massachusetts Properties - Refrigeration License with the Commonwealth of Massachusetts
DC Properties – DC 3rd Class Steam Engineer’s License
Maryland Properties – 1st Grade Stationary Engineer’s License
Virginia Properties - NIULPE 1st Class Engineer’s Certificate
Operating or Steam engineering license
CFC certification for the type of equipment serviced. (Universal Certification preferred.)
SMT certification or enrollment in program preferred
Physical Requirements:
Regularly required to stand, walk, reach and use arms to perform tasks as well as push and pull objects and grasp with hands.
Regular use of various machinery and tools, including but not limited to, a snow blower.
Regularly required to talk and hear and occasionally required to smell.
Frequently required to sit, stoop, crouch, kneel, crawl, balance, climb stairs and ladders, work at heights and in environments with temperature ranges both while working outside and inside.
Occasionally required to work around vibration or noise as well as dust.
Regularly required to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs. and occasionally required to lift and/or move up to 75 lbs.
Specific vision abilities include close vision, distance vision, color vision and depth perception.
Involves movement between departments, buildings, and floors to facilitate work.
May require the ability to operate a vehicle (i.e. truck, van, utility cart, etc.) or small tractor.

Responsibilities

Keep current with new and developing technologies as they appear in industry, and assist in determining the feasibility of adopting new technologies.
