job_title: Software Engineer in Test (API, Web Services, Python)
summary:
The Adelphic platform, part of the Viant Advertising Cloud™, is a real-time mobile DSP that connects brands to consumers in order to maximize digital advertising investments. The Adelphic programmatic ad server platform executes mobile ad campaigns on behalf of a growing customer base, including many major ad agencies and the trading desks for the largest global holding companies. The platform integrates with all of the major exchanges that offer mobile ad inventory, processing ad requests that the exchanges send on behalf of content publishers and responding with bids. Advanced techniques in machine learning and big data processing enable the platform to understand what audience is best suited for each campaign, and thereby to optimize campaign performance. The Adelphic ad servers and databases are deployed in a distributed, multi-region, cloud-based infrastructure; the architecture enables massive scalability (~50 billion ad requests per day) and low latency (response time under 20 milliseconds). 

This position will focus on expanding and improving the continuous integration process in Adephic Engineering. Following agile methodology, the developer in test will work on user stories to write Python-based system tests that are continuously executed through Jenkins. In addition, they will have the opportunity to build and maintain test tools to automate infrastructure tasks needed by the system tests. The work will involve objected-oriented design, test-driven development, Python & Java coding, and Agile process.

Improve the product through the use of test frameworks and systematic tests to develop, apply, and maintain quality standards
Develop, modify, and execute software test plans
Work with developers to improve and maintain continuous integration processes, automated test frameworks, and automated test suites

Founded in 1999, Viant Technology LLC is a leading global people-based advertising technology company, enabling marketers to better plan, execute, and measure their digital media investments through our cloud-based platform. Built on a foundation of people instead of cookies, the Viant Advertising Cloud™ provides marketers with access to over 1 billion registered users globally, one of the largest registered user databases in the world, and infuses accuracy, transparency, reach and accountability into cross device advertising.


Viant owns and operates Adelphic and MySpace, and is a member of the Xumo joint venture.


In 2016, Viant became a subsidiary of Time Inc. (NYSE: TIME), one of the world’s leading media companies with over 100 influential brands including People, Sports Illustrated, Fortune and Time. In February 2018, Meredith Corporation (NYSE: MDP; meredith.com ) acquired Time Inc. and all its subsidiary companies including Viant, creating a cross channel ecosystem of nearly 200 million unduplicated American consumers every month, including 85 percent of U.S. Millennial women.

At Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR), our mission is to discover innovative medicines that treat disease and human health. To do that, our scientists need cutting-edge, state-of-the-art computing systems.


Today, we are witnessing a revolution. Technology advancement is changing the landscape of drug and target discovery. A decade ago, sequencing a single genome cost $100 million and took years. Today, it takes about a week and $1,000, creating terabytes of data. At NIBR Informatics, we create tools that empower scientists to accelerate drug discovery and improve patients' lives. We build data, business logic, analysis, and visualization platforms and applications for our customers – 6,000 scientists worldwide – that allow them to solve problems that have never been solved before.


As data scientists, we collaborate with chemists and biologists as part of cross-disciplinary teams. We have helped advance treatments by coming up with solutions to answer questions we could only previously ask.


NIBR is making a strategic investment into IT capabilities and is positioning itself to deliver the systems and services that are critical to the future of drug discovery. The IT organization is seeking senior leadership, skilled designers, and energetic developers who share our vision that science serves a greater purpose in improving human health.


For this position, we are looking to hire a UI architect / lead developer to lead the team building UI frameworks and components to be re-used by many at NIBR.


If you are a technical leader and motivator who is excited to see the team deploy new functionality that really makes a difference in peoples’ health then you will thrive and make a real difference at NIBR.


Joining our team means getting the best aspects of both a large company (stability, pay, benefits) and a startup (open to change, ability to wear multiple hats, creative and intellectual environment) at the same time. Think Google Labs but without the project shelving!


Major Accountabilities:

Technical leader and architect for a team of UI developers who build web applications with a focus on internal developer tools
Shared vision of Rapid UI, efficient, and adaptable UI frameworks, and re-usable UI components
Motivates and mentors the team and supports them in being effective on their projects
Hands on and leads code reviews, design reviews, technical conversations, decisions, and strategies
Cares deeply about code craftsmanship, user experience, operational stability and maintainability
Ensures that UI work within their team and across the wider org are using best practices and appropriately adopting technologies
Builds internal systems used by thousands of NIBR scientists around the world

job_title: Senior Director, User Experience and Design
summary:
As the Senior Director of User Experience and Design, you will be tasked with leading the UX organization at EIS by producing and bringing to life best in class user experience and design for our suite of products alongside building a strong understanding and culture of design across EIS. This role requires an exceptionally strong customer focus, a mastery of current and best practice UX design, user research, as well as exemplary leadership, influencing and collaboration skills.


RESPONSIBILITIES :

Lead the UX Design and Research teams to evolve UX as a key functional discipline for EIS.
Work with EIS senior leadership and across our business to help build a culture of UX and design excellence, setting a consistently high bar for execution and delivery of engaging experiences across our digital platforms.
Contribute to EIS’s branding strategy, enhance and manage digital brand identity and associated guidelines to ensure a consistent application across multiple internal and external digital properties
Provide customer-focused leadership by working closely with the business and technical teams to develop approaches, use cases, and high-level requirements that ensure alignment across our professional brands.
Own the end-to-end design process of the team, ensuring on time, detailed, and polished deliverables.
Provide full hands-on design work as needed, iteratively creating interaction flows, wireframes, visual, interactive prototypes, and detailed design specifications.
Develop and build relationships across teams and disciplines to promote collaboration and efficiency across EIS.
Ensure our web and mobile UX support measurable business requirements and goals.
Use analytics, including product usage data, market analyses and customer research findings to drive design decisions. Incorporate data-driven insights to guide UX strategy.
Collaborate effectively with agile, multi-disciplinary teams to evaluate the feasibility of proposed designs and champion great UX, even when faced with technical constraints.
Work with the Product Management, Sales, Customer Service and Technology teams to appropriately assess and optimize the performance of new and existing product features.
Identify, manage and work with external partners to provide advisory services when needed
Present design work to UX, Product, and Engineering teams, as well as stakeholders and executive leadership to gain buy-in on proposed approaches.
Hire, manage, mentor, and develop designers and researchers within and beyond your team.

Required QUALIFICATIONS

8+ years of experience as a UX strategist, designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar.
5+ years as manager of digital design teams.
Experience working with an iteration based, agile/lean development process such as SAFe (Scaled Agile).
Proficiency and fluency in top UX/Design tools and platforms, i.e. Sketch, Figma, Adobe XD, Invision
Good awareness and basic working knowledge of the latest front-end technologies.

Preferred QUALIFICATIONS

Demonstrate a portfolio of work with a proven track record for solving difficult UX design problems, including simplifying customer journeys into intuitive user experiences that support business strategies.
Demonstrate a track record of directing, employing multiple research methods such as contextual inquiry, usability, analytics to gather insights, inform design, drive future innovation and validate approaches.
Experience closely collaborating with technical teams and ensuring designs work within their development libraries and frameworks.
Experience creating services and applications with multiple user touchpoints on different platforms and devices.
Experience with large and complex data sets, content structures, ontologies, classification systems and taxonomies for superior User Experience through application design
Experience as a leader of multi-disciplinary creative teams.
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills including the ability to present business and design concepts clearly and persuasively to colleagues, partners, stakeholders and especially to senior executives.
Ability to work efficiently and demonstrate a bias for action in a fast-paced environment.
Relentless desire for innovation, balanced with practical business needs and customer expectations.

The following shared, organization-wide competencies describe the desired behaviors that will facilitate success at Trellis:
1. Communication - Expresses ideas clearly and constructively (written and spoken, upward and downward, one-on-one and with groups).

4. Professionalism - Treats others with respect; abides by the institutional values; displays a positive and cooperative attitude; adheres to the workplace Code of Conduct and compliance policies.
5. Stewardship - Identifies efficiencies to reduce redundancy and/or elimination of tasks resulting in savings of cost, resources, and or/time.

Bachelor’s Degree.

Compensation will be based on past experience in project management of web design and web application development, as well as actual performance.

job_title: Integrated Behavioral Health Program Manager - Primary Care
summary:
Boston Medical Center (BMC) is more than a hospital. It´s a network of support and care that touches the lives of hundreds of thousands of people in need each year. It is the largest and busiest provider of trauma and emergency services in New England. Emphasizing community-based care, BMC is committed to providing consistently excellent and accessible health services to all—and is the largest safety-net hospital in New England. The hospital is also the primary teaching affiliate of the nationally ranked Boston University School of Medicine (BUSM) and a founding partner of Boston HealthNet – an integrated health care delivery systems that includes many community health centers. BMC provides a full range of pediatric and adult care services, from primary to family medicine to advanced specialty care.
BMC is also committed to our employees, who are a very important piece to who we are. We pride ourselves in providing equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person's race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation or any characteristic protected under applicable law. BMC will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.
The Program Manager is responsible for day-to-day coordination of initiatives within Boston Medical Center Health System’s Integrated Behavioral Health (IBH) initiative, an initiative to strengthen the integration of mental health and substance use services into primary care practices at Boston Medical Center and partner sites in its MassHealth Accountable Care Organization. The Program Manager will be involved in specific projects, including a new initiative on workforce development and training, as well as ongoing clinical quality improvement work. Requires strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
IBH Workforce Development Project:
For the grant-funded Integrated Behavioral Health Workforce Development Project, the Program Manager will support the PI in the design, implementation and evaluation of a training curriculum for primary care practice leaders, primary care providers, primary care staff, and integrated behavioral health clinicians at Boston Medical Center and other local health centers, on key aspects of integrated behavioral health service delivery. Specific tasks include:
Maintaining and updating project work plan, including weekly checklists as needed
Gathering materials and training modules for an integrated behavioral health training website, and adapting to web-based formatting
Maintaining the website
Coordinating with the Continuing Medical Education office and web developers on logistical aspects of website development
Drafting CME accreditation materials
Implementing other aspects of the workforce development plan, including organization of regular webinars, mentoring programs and/or learning collaborative sessions for off-site learners.
Managing evaluation of the trainings, including: Writing IRB amendments and reports as needed; data collection; coordination with statisticians and other supports; ensuring data quality; and co-writing and editing program evaluation manuscripts and abstracts.
In addition, the Program Manager will be responsible for:
Organizing regular and as needed meetings of program staff
Working with the PIs in developing and determining the budgetary requirements of the program.
Working with PI and project evaluators on regular progress reports for submission to all external funding agencies/sponsors
Tracking expenditures and processing payments
Monitoring and maintaining inventory of supplies and equipment, and purchasing products as needed within established budget.
PI schedule management as needed.
IBH Program Quality Improvement:
The Program manager will support the PI and local departmental leaders and quality specialists in the development of local and community initiatives related to quality improvement and access. Specific tasks may include:
Creating a work plan for key quality improvement initiatives
Organizing regular meetings, maintaining agendas, and keeping minutes
Supporting operational managers and quality specialists in practices in implementation of quality improvement measures, including interfacing with analytics staff on reporting needs, and information technology staff on new tools in the electronic medical record.
Program management for a telepsychiatry initiative with local sites
OTHER DUTIES:
Performs office related duties for the IBH Project such as handling faxes, scanning, filing, photocopying, collating materials.
Conforms to hospital standards of performance and conduct, including those pertaining to patient rights, to ensure that exceptional customer service and patient care may be provided.
Utilizes hospital’s behavioral standards as the basis for decision making and to support the hospital’s mission and goals.
Follow established hospital infection control and safety procedures.
Perform other duties as needed.
Must adhere to all of BMC’s RESPECT behavioral standards.

Exempt

Resilient Systems, an IBM company

Software Engineer- Backend Java Developer

The Resilient team’s mission is to help organizations thrive in the face of any cyber attack or business crisis. Our award-winning Incident Response Platform (IRP) empowers security teams to analyze, respond to and mitigate incidents faster, smarter and more efficiently. Resilient is the industry standard solution for incident response. The IRP integrates all other security technologies into a single hub and provides easy workflow customization and process automation. Armed with Resilient, security teams can have best-in-class response capabilities.

Quardev is looking for DevOps director to help manage infrastructure, engineering and code release teams for our client's next gen platform of customer facing digital products in AWS. Usage of MHE digital products is growing in double digits and this makes this role critical to the success of the organization and revenue growth. Currently the DevOps team is comprised of 10 engineers and is growing. The ideal candidate will be technical in nature and lead situations that require quick problem resolution and root cause analysis.
As a DevOps director, you will ensure that the infrastructure architecture and design complies with industry best practices for availability and scalability of MHE applications. You will work with various cross-functional teams like Network, Security, Software, Business Units Senior Management

Responsibilities


Taking partner centric approach, develop and manage enterprise infrastructure architecture and support services by partnering with internal and external teams - keeping them aligned with business objectives. Ensure high availability and security of all the digital products. Align enterprise infrastructure architecture with corporate vision and practices.
Manage Multiple environments, 3rd party integrations and lives continuous process improvement using automation, monitoring and innovation by identifying inefficiencies in current processes; improving agility of the releases through the environments with different teams and adopting industry trends for innovation.
Plan, develop, implement and maintain Service Level Agreement (SLA)/Operational Level Agreements with internal and external teams. Manage operational and support management including escalation and incident management procedures and execution.
Prepare and track infrastructure operational and capital budgets. Manage 3rd party contracts and vendor relationships for tools and services used within the infrastructure.
Partner with cross-functional technology teams (software, security, network, security, etc.) to mature in-house cloud infrastructure projects and software development life cycle by applying industry best practices. Develop a high performing cloud architecture/support team that compliments software architects in delivering highly available solutions for internal and external customers.
Develop process around change management, capacity planning, proactive monitoring, and reporting.
Develop and manage a virtual team responsible for infrastructure architecture and support focusing on driving best-practice standards, technology life-cycle management and future state direction.
Provide leadership during production support issues in order to minimize impact on the customers.

Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field, MBA a plus, or equivalent work experience.
Five plus years of experience in enterprise infrastructure utilizing the Unix / Linux Technologies.
Two plus years of AWS experience. • Five plus years of management experience supporting a 24x7 software portfolio.
Experience working in a fast paced software environment.
Clear understanding of Agile Scrum methodologies.
Excellent blend of technology and business skills.
Exceptional people management, interpersonal and team building skills.
Strong problem solving and analytical reasoning skills.
Excellent documentation, communication, and presentation skills.
Demonstrated experience in managing operations and projects with multiple models of delivery (in-house, managed service, outsourced).
Demonstrated experience in disaster recovery and business continuity planning.
Knowledge of UNIX based operating systems (CentOS, RedHat Linux 6.x) is required.
Knowledge of Web Application servers (Apache, Weblogic / Tomcat) is required.
Knowledge of RDBMS and NoSQL systems (Aurora, DynamoDB, RDS, Redshift) is a plus.
Knowledge of virtualization and containerization (e.g. Docker) technologies is a plus. The candidate must be extremely technical and understand many different Platforms including Java, Messaging Systems, Node.js, RDBMS, NoSql, and Caching Technologies.
Deep knowledge of automation systems including software deployment, release management, different environment types, complete application lifecycle management, product development life cycles, PaaS and IaaS.
Deep understanding of KPI statistics and the ability to comprehend deployment architectures that scale systems to extreme levels.
Proficient in tools such as Puppet, Ansible, Jenkins, and have a proven track record of large scale deployments in both AWS and traditional Datacenters for global environments

Good to have


Experience of operations and engineering outside the USA

This is a DevOps Developer role based in Boston, MA. If you think we are a good match, please send us your resume via the Apply Link on this page. Please show work authorization verification at time of application, this role is not eligible for sponsorship.

OpenClinica develops cutting-edge clinical research software that accelerates pace of healthcare innovation. We have a rapidly growing customer base and are a globally recognized brand in clinical research. This is unique opportunity to work with a small, tightly-knit team to make a big impact that can propel your career.


As a Java Software Engineer your focus will be to bring enhancements and expanded functionality to market for our research data capture platform, using a microservices architecture, a SaaS delivery model, and open, modular APIs. See https://blog.openclinica.com/2016/09/22/openclinica -4/


Much of our code is open source, so you can build a public portfolio of your work and get to collaborate with lots of smart researcher/developers around the world. We’re interviewing qualified candidates right away and the right person will get an offer very quickly.


Your top priorities will be to:

Actively contribute to the OpenClinica platform, architecture, infrastructure, and functionality.

job_title: Software Engineer in Test - MATLAB UI Design Environment
summary:
The MATLAB UI Design Environment team is seeking a highly motivated Software Engineer in Test with a passion for testing user interface capabilities. Being part of a dynamic team, you will be responsible for testing the next generation of tools and capabilities of the web-based GUI Design Environment in MATLAB. Knowledge of object oriented design

Capacity to multi-task several testing activities concurrently A bachelor's degree and 3 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree) is required.
Programming experience in JavaScript The MATLAB UI Design Environment team is seeking a highly motivated Software Engineer in Test with a passion for testing user interface capabilities. Required skill is JavaScript programming.

If you desire a challenge and would like to explore opportunities at Aras, submit your resume and a cover letter for consideration.

Share your resume and a cover letter that explains why you believe you’d be a fit for Virgin Pulse and this position.
Impeccable writing and verbal communication skills are essential to all we do, and we weigh cover letters heavily. We love a cover letter that shows us your personality-just be yourself. We’re mostly interested in learning who you are, what you love to do, and why you’d love to do it here with us. The run of the mill cover letter (or no cover letter) will probably not get you to the next step- just saying.

QA Engineers are responsible for designing and implementing functional, performance, integration, load, and end-to-end tests, and work at both UI and API levels. QA Engineers are expected to be full stack, having skills in figuring out how to test functionality, writing thoughtful manual and automated test cases, and excellent programming skills to implement automation.
Who We Are
Virgin Pulse – part of Sir Richard Branson’s world-renowned Virgin Group – is looking for a talented QA Automation Engineer to help build our next-generation SAAS application. As a member of the Virgin Pulse team, you will be expected to keep up to date with cutting edge and emerging technology, and work closely with our developers and our Product team to deploy, maintain, and operate our testing tools.
At Virgin Pulse, we want to make employees healthier and happier. We accomplish this in many ways, including:
Gamification of exercise and healthy habits, to hook people on being healthy
A rewards program, to keep people coming back
Challenges and competitions - take more steps than your friends!
Wellness tracking - activity, weight, blood pressure, and nutrition information can be tracked, which earns points / badges
Device integration - we work with Fitbit, MyFitnessPal, Nike, Garmin, and our very own, very cool, bluetooth enabled activity device to pull in your data
Why Work Here
Fast-paced environment on a small but awesome team.
Good benefits and a fun work environment.
Lots of companies have a ping pong table, but we actually use ours.
We also support and encourage a healthy lifestyle, with an in-office gym, regular free exercise classes, healthy snacks and drinks, and more.
Like games? Our ps4 is a way of life for some employees.
We have regular running/walking groups, Zumba classes, Yoga classes, and people who are always up for a game of tennis.
Oh, we also offer a highly competitive compensation package with generous vacations and benefits, including annual bonus and 401K matching.
…In short, we rock.
What We’re Doing
Our next generation SAAS platform is using an exciting mixture of technologies: A large scale, public-facing websites in Angular and Angular2, leveraging tools like Pug, Grunt, Bower and NPM to make things automated and repeatable. Our Java-based REST API is built on Spring Boot, Jersey, and Hibernate which serves traffic to both web and mobile consumers. We’re using a combination of both Postgresql, Cassandra and Redis. Redis, specifically, is used extensively in a distributed locking system, responsible for supporting real-time data processing. All of this uses Amazon Web Services extensively.
Continuous Integration is done using TeamCity, and we have regular deployments to our environments (Development, QA, Staging, Production), with integrated unit tests and code coverage analysis.
Essential Functions
Produce test cases
Develop automated regression tests
Partner with developers to determine how to test new product features
Estimate points for completion of tasks in agile environment
Execute manual tests
Report bugs
Troubleshoot issues
Requirements
B.S. or equivalent in Computer Science
Development skills in Java, C#, or Swift
Ability to write well, thought out test cases
A passion to deliver quality code, and to get satisfaction from exploring features and identifying problems.
Detail oriented; Individual must consistently follow through and pay attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience with industry-standard test automation frameworks
Strong customer focus, excellent problem solving, and analytical skills
Experience working in an agile environment preferred
Not afraid to take initiative Must love the Oxford comma, and understand why we love it!

Security Competencies:
Ensure system and data security is maintained at a high standard, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the Virgin Pulse application is not compromised
Ensure industry best practice coding standards are adhered to in particular validate that code released into production at Virgin Pulse is free from bugs and security vulnerabilities, such as those defined and published by OWASP.

job_title: Lead Product Engineer for Online Practice Spaces, ODL Teaching Systems Lab
summary:
Working at MIT offers opportunities, an environment, a culture – and benefits – that just aren’t found together anywhere else. If you’re curious, motivated, want to be part of a unique community, and help shape the future – then take a look at this opportunity.

LEAD PRODUCT ENGINEER FOR ONLINE PRACTICE SPACES, Office of Digital Learning (ODL)-Teaching Systems Lab-Woodrow Wilson Academy (WWA) of Teaching and Learning, to join the Woodrow Wilson Academy of Teaching and Learning, a partnership with the Teaching Systems Lab that is creating a new blended teacher training program. Will serve as a hands-on leader directly collaborating with WWA faculty and students to create new kinds of technology-enhanced learning experiences for the program. Responsibilities include collaborating closely with education faculty, researchers, and game designers to understand user needs, define products aligned with the program's pedagogical vision, create mockups, and ship prototypes; full stack web or mobile application development with a variety of languages, including Ruby, Python, JavaScript, and CSS; leveraging frameworks, libraries, and existing software services; supporting and maintaining software products across the lifecycle, including provisioning, operations, monitoring, and maintenance; managing the budget for infrastructure, service, and license costs; defining team culture and norms for open-source development; recruiting, managing, and mentoring a small team of engineers, possibly including graduate and undergraduate students; identifying and recommending or implementing components supporting teachers and teacher educators in communicating, collaborating, and working together remotely; and attending to whatever else is necessary to bring the project to successful fruition.
Job Requirements
REQUIRED: experience as a software developer and with object oriented programming and scripting languages (Python, Ruby, JavaScript); experience developing in and delivering applications with web frameworks (i.e., Rails, Django), using RESTful APIs, and with automated testing (either server-side or client-side); ability to articulate technical and non-technical issues associated with emerging learning technologies and collaboration tools; and demonstrable evidence of taking projects from start to completion. Job #15384

This is one-year, renewable position working on a project that is anticipated to last through June of 2021.

SmartBear has played a role in the Uber you ordered, the banking app you use, the item you posted for auction, or that flight you just purchased. We are looking for an ambitious new member to of our team to help us grow our latest innovation in the software quality space, CrossBrowserTesting. We’re searching for someone who is passionate about learning everything they can about our users and how we can provide the best experience within the first 90 seconds of them finding us on the web and starting a trial. If you find yourself wanting to climb into users’ minds in order to better understand how they are thinking within your user experience this is the role for you. If you love building complex funnels and understanding the most significant fall off points from one stage to the next submit your resume now. 

Job Responsibilities
Work with a cross functional team of product owners, sales leader, developers, designers and marketing professionals to drive iterate through data driven experiments quickly learning more about the user with each experiment. Communicate the roadmap for these experiments as well as the results of these experiments back to the team in real-time.
Work closely with product management team to create a road-map for enhancements that will improve the experience for the end user within the trial and get them to understand the value of our product.
Conduct data-driven A/B tests using Optimizely as well as internal testing tool in order to learn more about key drivers of conversion leading into and within the trial process.
Use tools like Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Intercom and others in order to formulate a complete understanding of user behavior both pre- and post- conversion.
Hold user testing sessions both virtually and in-person in order to understand the hearts and minds of our end users.
Collaborate with the enterprise sales team to synthesize what reps are hearing within the sales process to implement improvements within lead generation tactics and campaigns.
Work with marketing manager and content marketing associate to create compelling inbound campaigns that fuel top of funnel acquisition growth.
Work to build value-added strategic partnerships with adjacent products or services that build awareness of our product within the market as well as position the business as a key player within the market. Requirements
Previous experience: 3-5 years experience growing a SAAS business through iterative conversion testing.
Solid knowledge of various paid marketing channels and technologies, including paid search (Google AdWords), re-targeting, social network advertising (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, and more), content distribution, and placement networks.
Experience using Marketo, Salesforce, Google Analytics a plus.
Bachelor’s degree.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
High energy and a positive attitude.
Entrepreneurial spirit to drive your product forward.
Authorized to work in the United States (minimum of H1B) #LI-GR1 
SmartBear Is A Destination Employer


- Voted by Glassdoor as one of the " Best Places to Work ", Named to Boston Globe’s “ Top Places To Work ”, and VentureFizz calls us one of “ One of The Hottest Companies in Boston ”.


· Invest In Our Employees – We care about the success of our employees and provide guidance and tools to help them grow their careers and succeed. We seek to continuously learn and evolve and strive to be the company of choice.


· Open and Collaborative Environment – We have an inclusive, creative, passionate, fun and successful environment.


· Award Winning Technology – SmartBear is a market leader and has won numerous, prestigious industry awards for its software solutions, including “Top Innovator and Leader In Software Development”.


· Invested Leadership Team - Our leadership team has a proven record of success, is passionate about the success of the employees and company and focused on supporting the sales organization.


· Unbelievable Offices – We are in a new, state-of-the-art building, on the waterfront, with an modern layout and a giant kitchen and eating area. We have an open floor plan and an abundance of conference rooms. The office is centered on the “Bear Cave”, for impromptu collaboration, company gatherings, monthly drinks, wine tastings and industry Meetups and events. We’ve also left space for fun with a ping-pong table, putting green, bean bag toss and other ways to have a quick break during the day.


· Ideal Location - We are located at Assembly Row, which is the new, hot, technology company destination, with great water views, restaurants, cafes, bars, shopping, movie complex, bike and running paths and is easily accessible by mass transportation. There’s even a community garden where SmartBear grows its own vegetables.


· Great Perks – We offer competitive salaries, top of the line benefits, ample vacation, 401(k) match, great eats – breakfast, lunches, coffee (regular, gourmet, espresso, lattes), drinks, healthy and sweet snacks and a constant flow of popcorn from a retro movie theatre machine.


· Community Service and Philanthropy - SmartBear is committed to giving back to the community. We offer employees a day off to serve the cause of their choice or work in teams to support an organization. SmartBear also contributes time and donates to meaningful organizations, such as aiding at-risk children and combatting homelessness.


· Thought Leader and Innovator – SmartBear strives to be a thought leader and innovator in the technology industry. We frequently support Meetups, are a member of Women In Technology, MassTLC and other premier organizations.

Software Engineer – Cloud Computing - (00048775)
Description
 Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

Do you thrive in fast-paced, high-impact environments? Can you mold cutting-edge technologies into viable solutions? Does the challenge of providing transformational capabilities to address our nation’s most critical needs inspire you?

The Operational Innovation & Transformation Department seeks
software developers with experience in cloud technologies, information security, and Development and Operations (DevOps) strategies. Candidates should have experience with the design and development of various cloud-based solutions, DevOps, Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS), and Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS). The focus of this work is to bring transformational capabilities to our sponsors through prototyping, experimentation, and deep outreach to the operational community.

The selected individual will be responsible for designing and developing application prototypes, reference implementations, and other operationally relevant software in support of MITRE’s Department of Defense (DoD) sponsors, particularly the United States Air Force (USAF). To that end, the individual will be working with both experienced MITRE engineers and government representatives. Duties will include proposing and architecting software to work towards a Continuous-Integration/Continuous-Delivery (CI/CD) pipeline that enhances the full lifecycle of infrastructure, as well as identifying and implementing process improvements to make agencies more efficient.

This work is a critical segment of the department’s overall work program which spans mission-focused experimentation for rapid capabilities innovation, assessment, and acquisition; systems engineering for operational/active warfighters; and mission-centric software/system product lines focused on dismount/operator-centric systems and software/system foundations such as tactical data interoperability, mobile computing, and enterprise IT modernization. The department’s key technical concentration areas include software engineering and development, cloud and DevOps, and network and communications engineering, all grounded in strong systems engineering fundamentals and significant operational domain expertise.

Key Functions:
Design and develop cloud-based software solutions to support Continuous-Integration/Continuous-Delivery capability pipelines
Analyze cloud infrastructures and recommend improvements for performance gains and/or cost efficiencies
Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

Excellent communication, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to thrive in a diverse team environment consisting of MITRE colleagues, project sponsors, government contractors, and military personnel.
Expertise in the software engineering lifecycle, virtualization, cloud computing, system administration, and scripting languages.
Technical knowledge of fundamental concepts of component provisioning, network design, system hardening, and data access controls.
Preferred Qualifications:
At least 1 - 3 years of experience in IT with a broad range of exposure, including cloud computing, continuous integration, automated testing, and deployments
Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Service (AWS), Microsoft Azure, VMWare, and OpenStack
Experience with containers and automated configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, and Amazon Cloud Formation scripts
Experience with object-oriented and scripting languages such as Python, Bash, Ruby, Java, and Go
Ability to analyze cloud infrastructure and recommend improvements for performance gains and/or cost efficiencies
Familiarity with Software Defined Networking (SDN)
Familiarity with government regulations and industry standards data security, such as NIST Special Publication 800-53 or Intelligence Community Directive 503
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or similar field.

Fastly helps the world’s most popular digital businesses keep pace with their customer expectations by delivering fast, secure, and scalable online experiences. Businesses trust Fastly to accelerate the pace of technical innovation, mitigate evolving threats, and scale on demand. Founded in 2011, Fastly powers online destinations including Airbnb, GitHub, Alaska Airlines, Pinterest, Vimeo, The Guardian, The New York Times and Ticketmaster.

The worldwide cloud services market is projected to grow rapidly to $236 billion in 2020, according to Forrester, Inc. As more and more businesses move operations to the cloud, Fastly is well positioned to continue increasing CDN, cloud networking and cloud security market share with edge cloud services that reach beyond content delivery.

We’re building a better Internet. Come join us.

SENIOR SALES ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE

Fastly has already disrupted CDN technology and now we are changing how CDN is sold. Our sales team engages in a consultative selling approach, learns the individual needs of each customer and delivers custom solutions. We focus on creating a positive customer experience in order to build long-standing relationships.

The senior sales team’s focus is driving revenue, adoption and market penetration in enterprise accounts. The ideal candidate possesses a technical sales background that enables them to drive an engagement at the CXO, IT architect and software developer levels. You should be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver on quarterly revenue targets.

If you have a successful track record of selling a highly technical product to consumer web, mobile, media and enterprise companies we would like to hear from you.

RESPONSIBILITIES


Accountable for driving business, and meeting or exceeding quota goals and MBO’s.
Effectively and independently deliver the Fastly company story, value proposition, and product demonstrations
Develop and execute a comprehensive account/territory plan to drive revenue and market share in a defined territory or industry vertical
Prepare and manage proposals, quotes, and contracts
Oversee account management for closed accounts to seek additional revenue opportunities
Accelerate customer adoption and ensure customer satisfaction
Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
Managing all aspects of the sales cycle including: prospecting, sales campaign/meetings, negotiation close, account management

REQUIREMENTS


7 – 10 years of technology (B2B, SaaS preferred) related sales or business development experience with C-level executives
Direct field experience and extensive customer network within Enterprise, Fortune 1000 and large multi-divisional/multinational companies
Experience with media streaming technologies and content delivery network services, interactive services, digital rights management (DRM), content management, web analytics, website performance, cloud storage, mobile content delivery or managed web hosting is highly desired
Strong ability to close sales, manage accurate pipeline and forecast
Independent, self-disciplined and possess strong verbal and written communications skills
BA/BS degree required, major in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus
Ability to thrive in a start-up environment

Why Fastly?


We have a huge impact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Our customers ( https://www.fastly.com/customers ) have a tremendous user base, and we support a growing number of open source projects and initiatives ( https://www.fastly.com/open-source/ ). Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their hearts with others so we can help lend a supportive hand.
We love distributed teams. Fastly’s home base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe. In fact, 50% of our employees work outside of SF! An international remote culture is part of our DNA.
We care about you. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits, like generous parental leave, options for free medical/dental/vision plans, and an open vacation program that enables our folks to take the time they need to recharge (some benefits may vary by location).
We value diversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful — every day.
We are passionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we’re not “one size fits all”. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they’re passionate about.

Fastly provides equal employment opportunity without regard to an applicant’s race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, religion, marital status or veteran status.

Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Fastly. Please inform us if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

One Door helps leading retailers around the world tell great stories through collaboration, localization, and simplification of our in-store execution. The Software Engineering Manager leads a team of engineers that are accountable for developing, enhancing and maintaining enterprise level web applications for One Door leveraging Ruby-on-Rails. At One Door, technology is valued as a differentiator and also as a key component of our success. We strive to improve ourselves by improving the code base, sharing ideas and knowledge, and deliver an amazing customer experience. Check us out at www.onedoor.com for a glimpse into our culture.

 What you'll work on:

You will oversee and manage the day-to-day activities for a team of software engineers working on multiple projects from design through to release.
Provide technical guidance and training to team members. This includes ongoing mentoring and coaching to help team members develop the skill sets appropriate for their role.
Motivate and inspire team members to achieve success.
Participate in hiring, writing performance reviews, and addressing performance issues for team members.
Drive and direct team members in resolving issues and/or troubleshooting software issues.
Foster a collaborative work environment capable of effectively working across departments to meet goals.
Contribute as a senior level developer and lead engineer to support projects that may require a high level of technical and product knowledge and expertise. This includes gathering requirements and functional specifications, writing code, testing, and preparing and/or updating technical documentation.
Work closely with Project Manager(s)/Scrum Master(s) to produce accurate delivery estimates for work tasks. Provides regular project updates to management and Project Manager(s)/Scrum Master(s) and reports on risks and issues.
Maintain a high level of product and technology knowledge to serve as the "subject matter expert" on the Company's application software. May represents the Company to clients and external partners as the technical expert for the engineering team.
Provide collaboration and leadership in helping to define the architectural direction of the Company's products and software applications. Effectively communicates this vision and strategy to team members.
Ensure software development standards and processes are followed and work towards continuous improvement in this area. Provides proactive suggestions on the enhancement of existing software applications to better leverage the latest technology and/or scale usability and help guide their introduction into the engineering team.

You'll have:

8 years of progressively more responsible experience developing enterprise level web-based software applications that include at least 2 years in an engineering management position leading small to mid-size teams through the development process.
Demonstrated experience using Ruby-on-Rails or a high aptitude to learn the technology quickly. Demonstrated experience using HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, REST and JSON. Experience using JavaScript frameworks such as Ember.js or angular.js is a plus.
Experience mentoring and leading a team.
Strong knowledge of source control systems that must include Git and relevant unit test frameworks.
Must be a results-oriented leader who has a passion for technology and growing and developing others.
A forward thinker who is visionary, strategic and open and eager to learning and applying new technologies.
Proven problem-solving skills and the aptitude to overcome more difficult technical issues and challenges. Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects with changing priorities to meet tight deadlines in an agile environment.
Self-directed and proven skill to work independently using a high level of evaluation, originality and/or ingenuity to complete Ability to manage conflict as it may arise.
Experience with interviewing and hiring.
Has a strong sense of pace and urgency.
 Perks and Benefits:

Typical vacation, benefits, and competitive compensation plans you would expect but also some additional perks like engineering improvement day, a hackathon event, 4 weeks paid parental leave, a company contribution for commuter expenses, free Hubway membership, and a great office smack-dab in Boston’s Fort Point Channel, a tremendous amount of responsibility & collaboration, wicked awesome co-workers, Thirsty Thursdays, a fully stocked kitchen, fun company outings, and more.

One Door is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace humans of every background, appearance, race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, and disability status.

The team is responsible for building a variety of web interfaces for our innovative enterprise software products, including novel true-real-time interfaces.

About Brightcove:
Brightcove is the global leader in providing online video to Media and Digital Marketing organizations. Our global services team, BGS, builds highly scalable and complex solutions on our platform for some of the best known media companies in the world and we're expanding. If you have a great Android development background, a passion for online video, a keen sense of creativity and a willingness to work with our clients to build awesome experiences, we'd love to talk.

The Team:
Brightcove’s global services team designs and develops custom video-centric Web and mobile solutions for a variety of customers across the globe. Our mission is to offer designs that enhance the video experience and to utilize the latest technologies to build purposeful products that push boundaries. Our solutions often involve multiple products and services including Brightcove cloud-based services, Content Management System (CMS), Digital Right Management (DRM), Analytics, Advertising, subscription and monetization engines. We like to hire smart engineers with a passion to solve complex and interesting problems and to learn and utilize new technologies.

Job Description:
Our mobile team is looking for a smart and talented Android developer. This position will design, develop and integrate native Android apps (tablet, smartphones, and Android TV) that are centered on video delivery and are integrated with various monetization, analytics, DRM, CMS and Advertising engines. We have built a number of video-centric apps similar to Netflix, Hulu, HBO Go, etc. and we have more to build!

Role Requirements:

Minimum five years of experience in and development of solutions for Web and/or Mobile platforms
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in design, development and enhancement of native Android apps using Android SDK, with at least one published app
Expert-level knowledge of Java and Android SDK (Kotlin a plus)
Knowledge of UI frameworks, MVC and reactive, touch-based UI
Solid exposure to unit testing and continuous integration
Experience with JSON/XML and interfacing with server-side API’s, e.g. REST and GraphQL
Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, concurrency, object-oriented software design patterns and software optimized for embedded systems (storage and latency)
An undergraduate degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Prior experience in multimedia and/or video streaming a plus
Prior experience in integration with CDN, DRM, analytics, media advertising and payment systems a plus

Working Environment

We offer a fun work environment, competitive compensation, stock options, 401k matching, and tuition reimbursement. The role is based in our Boston office right on Fort Point Channel, with a fully stocked kitchen, ping pong and foosball tables. We also offer unlimited vacation.

At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, Street View to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge the technical and business worlds as you design services that our customers love. You'll work with Googlers from Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Finance, to name just a few. You have a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you will be part of shaping Google's next moonshot.


Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.


In this role, you will contribute to the mission of delivering innovative cloud services at scale. Whether building on the Cloud platform, working with our technical infrastructure team, building our apps suite, or working closely with executives of key vertical customers and prospects, you will drive product strategy and partner closely with cross-functional teams to define and deliver on the next phase of dynamic cloud services. You will develop product solutions, M&A;, go-to-market, and significant business relationships to execute on the huge market potential and benefits possible from applying Google’s technologies in the enterprise market.


By applying to this role, you will be considered for all teams working on Enterprise, including Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Developer Product Group, Developer Tools, Verticals (Healthcare, Media & Entertainment, Retail).


One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. With eyes focused squarely on the future, our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting and tailoring our solutions to all the markets where Google does business.


Responsibilities
Understand markets, competition and customer/user requirements in depth.
Identify market opportunities, build business cases, and define product vision and strategy for Google Cloud Platform, APIs, and key verticals.
Work collaboratively with engineers and cutting edge technologies.
Define, lead, and execute a cohesive global “One Google Cloud” strategy related to a specific product or set of products, collaborating as needed across regions, product areas, and functions.

Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a product management, engineering and technology strategy role.
Experience working within Cloud, SaaS and emerging cloud use-cases for web/mobile and enterprise companies.
Experience working on enterprise products.

Preferred qualifications:
MBA or advanced technical degree.
Experience in healthcare, retail, or media and entertainment relative to enterprise software.
Excellent organizational, analytical and influencing skills, with proven ability to take initiative and build strong, productive relationships.

Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, WA, Slalom has organically grown to nearly 4,000 employees. We were named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2016 and are regularly recognized by our employees as a best place to work. You can find us in 25 cities across the U.S., U.K., and Canada.

Interview potential candidates as needed and as time permits
Collaborate with Slalom team members and clients, promote a fun and supportive work environment

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline or equivalent
Proven ability to design and optimize business processes and integrate business processes across disparate systems
5+ years of Web Content Management System experience
Minimum of 3 years of Sitecore platform experience (5+ years preferred)
Minimum of 5 years of .NET experience

Excellent client-facing written and oral communications skills
Sitecore certified developer on version 6.5 or later
Broad understanding of marketing technologies is a plus

Job Title: ​Product Manager

Acquia is transforming the digital strategies of companies all over the world with our open cloud platform. We are passionate and relentlessly committed to helping our clients create digital experiences that are more relevant, personalized, and built for a fast-changing, always-connected, mobile-first world. Headquartered in the US, we have been named as ​one of North America’s fastest growing software companies as reported by Deloitte and Inc. Magazine, and have been​ rated a leader by the analyst community and named one of the Best Places to Work by the Boston Business Journal. We are Acquia. We are building for the future of the web, and we want you to be a part of it.

Acquia is looking for a Product Manager to drive development and adoption of our cloud-based digital experience platform for Drupal and JavaScript developers. Specific products include our local development experience, build pipeline and Node.js infrastructure.

Product Managers at Acquia are right in the middle of the action, engaged with customers and partners, and collaborating with every team in the company.

Collaborating with customers, partners, and customer-facing Acquia teams to understand market problems, identify new opportunities, and improve our customer experience

summary:
Job Description

Resilient Systems, an IBM company

Software Engineer- Backend Java Developer

The Resilient team’s mission is to help organizations thrive in the face of any cyber attack or business crisis. Our award-winning Incident Response Platform (IRP) empowers security teams to analyze, respond to and mitigate incidents faster, smarter and more efficiently. Resilient is the industry standard solution for incident response. The IRP integrates all other security technologies into a single hub and provides easy workflow customization and process automation. Armed with Resilient, security teams can have best-in-class response capabilities.
We are growing rapidly and are looking for a highly motivated, dynamic, talented individual to join our software development group focusing on backend or full-stack web application development

RSLNT1016
RES17010K

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Successful candidates must have the following qualifications. Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science 5-10 years of experience in commercial software development using agile methodologies In-depth knowledge and experience of the full web application stack including Java, database and UI tiers At least 5 years of experience developing in Java Practical experience with Hibernate and REST services Strong software engineering fundamentals and good interpersonal skills

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

Desirable: Experience with Spring, JMS, LDAP, Python, PostgreSQL Experience with MVC UI frameworks, specifically Backbone.js and CoffeeScript
This position is located in the Boston area. It provides a truly unique opportunity to join a successful, rapidly growing organization and fill a pivotal role in its growth and success.

EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Description
The Business Systems Analyst supports Finance, Tax, Human Resources, Order Management, and operates under the direction of the IT Program Manager, to analyze, design, develop, install and maintain business information systems and procedures. Assist in the total project development process while utilizing specific system and business knowledge/expertise necessary to solve production and maintenance problems. Facilitate meetings, provide guidance and technical assistance as necessary. Maintain competency and expertise in projects and systems within the assigned functional areas.
Responsibilities:
Act as a knowledge base and primary point of contact for systems implementation teams, as well as for the users, for the given areas of responsibility. Facilitate identification of opportunities to streamline and enhance business practices across supported functions. Document requirements for system enhancements and customizations as identified by the business users. Create and maintain plans and procedures for support, error tracking, communication, enhancement requests, business analysis, and implementation. Analyze and provide resolution to various problems of moderately complex scope. Act as a liaison between the various business groups and development team. Participate in testing of application upgrades and patches to ensure changes are appropriate and working as designed. Participate in subsequent system implementations in any or all Brooks facilities, including site preparation and planning, testing, training and support. May be assigned to small projects or to phases/portions of larger projects. Must be self-motivated and able to work independently.
Requirements:
Requires a Bachelor’s degree with a minimum 3-5 years’ experience. (Finance or Accounting knowledge is preferred)
Demonstrate an understanding and experience with a large scale ERP (Oracle EBS, SAP, JDE). This includes: functional use of the application, familiarity of roles and responsibilities, understanding of a multi-currency implementation, knowledge of database views and tables. Familiarity with query tools (Oracle PLSQL Developer/TOAD) is preferable.
Experience with other applications is a plus (for example HFM, Hyperion Planning, Vertex, Web ADI, Oracle Discoverer, OBIEE, Tableau, Microsoft Office, Visio, and PowerPoint)
Experience supporting global organization business processes in various aspects including but not limited to: Payables, Receivables, General Ledger, FP&A, Tax, Order Management, and Human Resources.
Other competency areas include demonstrated capability to: Work in an environment of evolving and rapidly changing business and project priorities (to include acquisitions); Function well in a team environment; organized and adept at managing multiple priorities. Requires exceptional customer focus in delivering global solutions.

Headquartered in Lowell, Massachusetts, MACOM is certified to the ISO9001 international quality standard and ISO14001 environmental management standard. MACOM has multiple design centers, Si, GaAs and InP fabrication, manufacturing, assembly and test, and operational facilities throughout North America, Europe, Asia and Australia. In addition, MACOM offers foundry services that represents a key core competency within our business. The foundry provides access to, and control of our broad range of proprietary technologies in an asset light, cost effective structure.


MACOM sells and distributes products globally via a sales channel comprised of a direct field sales force, authorized sales representatives and leading industry distributors. Our sales team is trained across all of our products to give our customers insights into our entire portfolio.


Our global organization of skilled engineers is driven every day to solve the world’s most demanding wireless and wireline application challenges. We’re proud of our more than sixty years’ of hands-on experience designing and building analog semiconductor technology across the RF to Light spectrum.


Engineering Data Systems Developer


Description


This is not your typical IT job. As an Engineering Data Systems Developer at MACOM, you will be part of a small high leverage team chartered to build cross-functional data systems from the ground up to support MACOM engineers world-wide. You could be based in the corporate headquarters in Lowell, MA or in MACOM’s field office in Hillsboro, OR. You will collaborate with other EDS engineers, as well as people in Operations and other Engineering roles to define and develop data analysis/reporting tools and systems aimed at meeting the needs of the organization for years to come. Your skills, interests and knowledge related to database architectures, web programming, systems integration, factory automation and how engineers process information to solve problems and make decisions will be key to your success, as will your attention to detail and your passion for excellence. If the idea of getting in at the foundation level and being a part of building great things resonates with you, this role may be a perfect fit for you.


Responsibilities 
Gain experience coming up to speed on legacy (Java) MACOM data tools/systems. Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering groups to define a variety of data analysis/reporting tools. Then develop, deploy and support the desired set of tools. Assist in designing, developing and deploying EDS solutions capable of accommodating the requirements of the organization with high reliability and high performance for the next 5 years. Integrate legacy MACOM data tools/systems with the Engineering Data Systems environment. Support deployment of Engineering Data Systems servers and data analysis/reporting tools to other MACOM sites and contract manufacturing partners, both domestic and overseas. Participate in setting and then complying with EDS standards for database schema, programming conventions, documentation, version control and revision tracking. Implement robust monitoring systems and methodologies capable of quickly detecting and correcting abnormal system condition/performance before it impacts users or other systems.
Qualifications 
BS in EE, CS or other technical discipline with at least 5 years of experience in an EDS type of role, although standout new college graduates with internship experience will be considered. Detail oriented with strong fundamentals in disciplined programming methodologies. Intermediate knowledge of statistics and probabilities is a plus. Advanced knowledge and practical experience with Linux and MySQL. Advanced knowledge and practical experience with D3, Flask or Django. Advanced knowledge and experience programming in SQL, Java, Perl and Python. Advanced knowledge and practical experience with database design and web programming. Interest, or preferably experience, in “big data” and/or “cloud-based” storage and processing. Excellent verbal and written “360 degree” communication skills. Initiative to address and appropriately escalate problems to achieve rapid resolution. Ability to work effectively with cross-functional engineering peer groups in a dynamic, collaborative, data directed and results oriented environment. U.S. citizenship or “green card” and the ability to travel within the US and internationally. Candidates with the qualifications above, plus a minimum of 2 years of experience as a Test Engineer or Yield Engineer in a semiconductor fabrication environment are highly desirable. The ideal candidate will be a generalist with regard to web programming, application programming, database design or database administration. However, a specialist in one of these fields with a passion to diversify into the other fields would also be desirable.

summary:
About the role

The Solutions Development team designs, deploys and tests solutions such as web services, applications and enterprise portals to meet client needs. This team works closely with the technical leadership and functional teams to fully understand the requirements of the project. Members of the Solution Development team also participate in client relationships, develops proposals and assists in marketing efforts.

A .NET Solution Developer focuses on designing, developing and testing mission critical enterprise solutions and other custom application development projects using the .NET Framework, C#, ASP.NET, SharePoint, WCF, WPF, SQL Server and other advanced components of Microsoft technology using various agile and waterfall based delivery methodologies.

As a Solutions Development Consultant, you will work on designing solution components of medium size and complexity. This includes performing basic support and debugging functions, while maintaining existing applications. You will contribute to our solution knowledge repository and may be responsible for program and/or staff management as needed.

Key Responsibilities:
Participate in development teams as a key contributor, typically following the agile delivery methodology.

Responsibilities may include:
Participate in a development team, producing components for new and existing applications with focus on the Microsoft technology stack

Create technical specifications based on functional requirements

Design and build application/unit tests according to a given test plan

Interface directly with customers, gathering feedback and discussing technical design.

Act as a key contributor in an agile sprint team, performing sprints on new and existing applications.

Perform basic support and debugging in test and production environments

Identify and escalate problems

Maintain and repair existing applications.
About you
You are a talented software developer who is able to communicate clearly with non-technical audiences. While passionate about technology, you have a strong business sensibility and ability to connect well with clients. Your technical background likely includes experience:

Analyzing, designing, developing, implementing and maintaining application code in a variety of contexts

Developing client premise-based and/or web-based software solutions

With application development, complex code development, application testing and component design.

3-5 years of experience working with the .NET framework

Must have excellent communication skills and hands-on experience working on component based applications in a distributed environment

Preferred Experience

At least 1 year working in Agile or Fast Agile methodology

Knowledge or experience in test driven development
