Job Objective

• Convert and implement business functional requirements into fully-functional web, mobile, and back-end systems

• Develop, analyze, review and modify applications through the complete life cycle of product development.

• Integrate with third party, best in class applications.

• Work in Agile teams directly with product managers and business analysts to complete functionality in new and existing applications.

• Code to current standards and follow best practices.

• Maintain, and support mission-critical applications while working closely with team members to provide project and ongoing operational support for applications.

• Participate in support rotation and troubleshoot production issues to insure the continued operations of the business.

This job family translates business and technical requirements into well-engineered, tested, and deployed business application systems. Responsibilities include the analysis, design, development, testing, installation, and maintenance of consumer and back office systems. They interface with customers and other developers to determine the most efficient and cost-effective approach to meet their business requirements. Solutions utilize a variety of hardware and software technologies and may include new code construction, modifications to existing modules, and/or package implementation. Create solutions by designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining software based components and interfaces based on business requirements. They help to move the business forward by providing better and updated services in terms of the development of software and techniques.


Principle Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Solutions Development (Functional Requirements/Design)

Translates Business Requirements in Functional Requirements and Design

• Works with domain architects to understand business and functional requirements for new software features and enhancements. Provide level of effort estimates based on project scope and technical complexity.

• Works with the business to adjust functional requirements based on technical feasibility and to coordinate software launch with overall launch plan.

• Provides subject matter expertise in the analysis, design and preparation of software solutions to meet business needs

• Recommends components for solutions that will work well together across business domains, partner with domain architect or act as the domain architect to ensure adherence to the architectural roadmap

• Accountable for projects or applications meeting business needs are delivered in a timely, cost effective manner considering all budget aspects including total cost of ownership.

• Ensures all deliverables are met related to the change management process.

• Creates technical specifications for new features or enhancements as required. Work with DBA to design new schemas and data access logic. Work with other development teams to design interfaces between the the different systems.

2. Implementation of Solution (Coding & Unit Testing)

Takes Functional Requirements and Designs and Implements the Solution

• Codes, develops unit test plans, and unit test new software features and enhancements. Initiate code reviews with peers and manager. Ensures all code has been unit tested prior to QA code freeze, including interfaces with other systems.

• Develops complete and robust test cases and scripts, ensures defects are properly resolved, QA has certified, and user acceptance is obtained. The test scripts and defects are entered and tracked in our department tools.

• Adheres to development best practices that have been established by the organization.

• Presents implementation approach to peers and manager prior to coding an implementation. Articulate the approach, design pattern(s) and technologies to be utilized.

• Reviews QA system and regression test plans.

• Fixes identified deficiencies by QA promptly and communicates these fixes regularly to the QA staff.

• Develops POC projects to prove out the feasibility of an approach or technology.

• Works with Content Developers to provide technical assistance and implement site creative prior to unit test phase.

• Completes applications development by coordinating requirements, schedules, and activities; contributing to team meetings; troubleshooting development and production problems across multiple environments and operating platforms.

• Writes documentation supporting the implementation of the solution

3. Maintenance/Support

Supports the software that was developed

• Works with other IT groups in the installation and testing of new hardware and software

• Builds solid monitoring and support tools for Service Delivery first level of support

• Provides level 2 and 3 support when necessary

• Provides workarounds for production issues

• Takes responsibility for any production problems and helps solve them

4. Innovation/Trends

Continuously Innovates and Follows Industry Trends

• Maintains up-to-date knowledge of software development disciplines and best practices.

• Researches new technologies and participate in industry communities or attend customer research activities to gain a better understanding of innovative ways to use technologies to help the business

• Recommends software enhancements and additional opportunities based on findings

• Introduce new ideas, technologies, and vendors that can help the customer or the business and increase sales or reduce costs

5. Customer Service/Relationship Management

Stays connected to the business

• Works with Customer Support and IT Service Delivery to investigate and identify system issues.

• Reviews business processes to understand the capability gaps and opportunities

• Recommends Innovations and business processes /systems simplifications

• Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, and challenges others to do the same.

• Builds professional relationships with the team members and function heads.

• Collaborates with team members and members of other teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.

6. Vendor Management

Stays connected to the vendors

• Assist in 3rd party web software vendor evaluations and recommendations as needed.

• Builds professional relationships with third party vendors

• Works with third party vendors to integrate their services with Peapod systems

• Builds solid code around third party APIs and Web Services.

• Creates monitoring systems for tracking third party performance


Requirements

Basic Qualifications:

• B.S. in Computer Science, Engineering or related field. Masters a plus.

• 7+ of software development experience


Skills and Abilities:

• Open-source tools and technologies

• Solid experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, DOM, JQuery, AJAX, REST, & JSON.

• Solid experience with Java, Camel, JUnit & TDD.

• Solid experience with Servlet and JSP

• Solid experience with Java-base MVC framework, ideally Spring

• Experienced in MVC frameworksm(AngularJS, Ember, Backbone), REST , Maven, Grunt.

• Experience with SQL and RDBMS and MYSQL and /or Informix a plus.

• Experienced in NoSQL technologies (MongoDB, ElasticSearch, etc).

• Experienced in Unix/Linux.

• Experienced in scalable, transaction oriented distributed systems architecture.

• Develops and maintain high quality software products supporting the organizations standards

• Ability to manage own work time and priorities in accordance with aggressive timelines and budgets

• Agile Development

Company Overview
Today’s complex interconnected world demands companies to conceptualize and deliver cutting-edge products and solutions to market faster than ever before. Altran, a global product development partner, collaborates with companies to address the business and technical challenges inherent in developing and supporting complex connected systems.
For over three decades, leading companies and emerging startups in some of the most highly regulated and rapidly evolving industries have relied on Altran to inspire innovation, accelerate time to market, improve predictability, and maximize return on product investment. Altran provides a full complement of technology consulting, software and product development expertise, and engineering services to our client partners in the Aerospace, Automotive, Electronics, and Medical and Life Sciences industries.
In North America, Altran is based in Burlington, Massachusetts, with additional offices in Detroit and Silicon Valley. For more information, visit Altran.com

Position Title: Business Intelligence Developer Co-op

Position Location: Mooresville, NC or Quincy, MA


Are you passionate about data? Do you like solving complex problems? Then come and join our Business Intelligence team at Retail Business Services, a proud company of Ahold Delhaize, a startup environment in the middle of a big corporate office. We are looking for creative out-of-the-box problem solvers.


Our Web & Business Intelligence team specializes in development of web applications, information driven reporting solutions and works to align technology solutions with business objectives. This development position exposes associates to both Web and Business Intelligence tools including web technologies, large scale databases, ETL and reporting tools. This position will be responsible for technical design and development of Business Intelligence (BI) solutions, translating requirements into reporting solutions, user acceptance testing in order to deliver effective reporting solutions


Requirements

Qualifications:

• Genuine excitement and passion for developing complex data sets and converting them into the information/insights that drive business decisions at all levels of the organization

• Excellent communication skills

• Experience writing, analyzing and troubleshooting SQL code in relational database management systems (RDBMS), especially Oracle and/or MS SQL Server

• Possess an understanding of business intelligence solutions utilizing MicroStrategy or similar BI tool in a data warehouse or data mart environment

• Experience in data structure, algorithm, operating system and other fundamental Computer Science/Programming concepts


Suggested Skills:

• Working knowledge of statistics, programming and predictive modeling

• Exposure to big data. Hive/Hadoop is a plus

• Knowledge of web presentation architectures and hardware/software implementations for business intelligence

• Knowledge of smart data presentation (scorecards, dashboards, and other advanced analytics)

We Are Lexia Learning
We are Lexia Learning, a Rosetta Stone company. As one of the best-known and most highly respected reading-technology companies in the world, we are dedicated to empowering literacy educators and students through personalized learning and adaptive assessment. Lexia currently helps over 2.5 million K–12 students learn to read and we are looking for passionate, talented individuals to join our mission driven team.
We Are the Engineering Team
We are seeking a talented and experienced Sr Server Engineer to join our fun, passionate and focused team in building products that directly impact the lives of K-12 students and educators worldwide. We thrive in a collaborative, cross-functional environment and enjoy building great products that have direct impact on the education of students and educators worldwide.
This person will be responsible for technical direction and implementation of 3rd party integrations into the core of our product platform. In this highly visible role you will shape the future of how our products integrate using open standards to satisfy our current needs while thinking ahead of what's coming next that could position our products better in the market and ease their adoption. You will help guide our client teams in their adoption as well.

If this sounds like the type of role and team you would like to work in, Lexia Learning is the place for you!
The ideal candidate will work from our Concord, MA office location. Relocation may be offered.
All About You
INITIATIVE: Your passion for your work is evident in the way(s) you take initiative in detecting areas of and associated sustainable resolutions to issues as they arise and to driving projects forward regardless of them.
ACCOUNTABLE: You hold yourself accountable for ensuring the highest level of integrity when it comes to your work and work towards the goal of ensuring the best possible customer experience.
COLLABORATIVE: You understand the importance of a collaborative effort to reach the goals outlined and enjoying working in an environment that encourages input from you and others.
ADAPTABLE: You understand the ever-changing technology landscape and the importance of ensuring your work aligns with the highest of standards.

Essential Job Functions:
Architect, design and develop highly scalable web applications using PHP.
Produce clean, efficient, maintainable, and bullet proof code to maintain high availability of our products.
Support deployment of applications into production and resolve issues by reproducing and determining the root cause.
Interact with external partners, team members (frontend, and mobile) and internal stakeholders to incorporate their innovations.
Conduct feasibility studies and prototypes for integrating latest technology.
Prepare technical specifications to document implementation details.

Participate in and lead code-review sessions to identify potential problem areas and suggest alternative solutions.
Required Skills & Qualifications
Minimum of 6-8 years professional development in a structured language such as Java, C/C++, PHP including the below:
Ability to write well structured, reusable and self-documenting code that other developers can pick up with ease and run with
Ability to code fearlessly knowing that your own suite of unit and integration tests will catch things you didn't think of
Writes code with an eye towards instrumentation and debugging in the wild - thinking about could happen after the code is released, How will you or others easily figure out there is a problem before a customer does

Has demonstrated ability to contribute coding and design techniques to the larger development group

Web server configuration and tuning experience (specially apache)

Shell scripting

Experience implementing OAuth and SAML

Other:
BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
Excellent communication (verbal & written), interpersonal, leadership, and problem solving skills
Disciplined self-starter, able to be highly productive both working alone and in close collaboration within a team
Experience working with and supporting high-level/profile customers
Ability to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic entrepreneurial type of environment

Fastly helps the world’s most popular digital businesses keep pace with their customer expectations by delivering fast, secure, and scalable online experiences. Businesses trust Fastly to accelerate the pace of technical innovation, mitigate evolving threats, and scale on demand. Founded in 2011, Fastly powers online destinations including Airbnb, GitHub, Alaska Airlines, Pinterest, Vimeo, The Guardian, The New York Times and Ticketmaster.

The worldwide cloud services market is projected to grow rapidly to $236 billion in 2020, according to Forrester, Inc. As more and more businesses move operations to the cloud, Fastly is well positioned to continue increasing CDN, cloud networking and cloud security market share with edge cloud services that reach beyond content delivery.

We’re building a better Internet. Come join us.

SENIOR SALES ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE

Fastly has already disrupted CDN technology and now we are changing how CDN is sold. Our sales team engages in a consultative selling approach, learns the individual needs of each customer and delivers custom solutions. We focus on creating a positive customer experience in order to build long-standing relationships.

The senior sales team’s focus is driving revenue, adoption and market penetration in enterprise accounts. The ideal candidate possesses a technical sales background that enables them to drive an engagement at the CXO, IT architect and software developer levels. You should be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver on quarterly revenue targets.

If you have a successful track record of selling a highly technical product to consumer web, mobile, media and enterprise companies we would like to hear from you.

RESPONSIBILITIES


Accountable for driving business, and meeting or exceeding quota goals and MBO’s.
Effectively and independently deliver the Fastly company story, value proposition, and product demonstrations
Develop and execute a comprehensive account/territory plan to drive revenue and market share in a defined territory or industry vertical
Prepare and manage proposals, quotes, and contracts
Oversee account management for closed accounts to seek additional revenue opportunities
Accelerate customer adoption and ensure customer satisfaction
Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
Managing all aspects of the sales cycle including: prospecting, sales campaign/meetings, negotiation close, account management

REQUIREMENTS


7 – 10 years of technology (B2B, SaaS preferred) related sales or business development experience with C-level executives
Direct field experience and extensive customer network within Enterprise, Fortune 1000 and large multi-divisional/multinational companies
Experience with media streaming technologies and content delivery network services, interactive services, digital rights management (DRM), content management, web analytics, website performance, cloud storage, mobile content delivery or managed web hosting is highly desired
Strong ability to close sales, manage accurate pipeline and forecast
Independent, self-disciplined and possess strong verbal and written communications skills
BA/BS degree required, major in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus
Ability to thrive in a start-up environment

Why Fastly?


We have a huge impact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Our customers ( https://www.fastly.com/customers ) have a tremendous user base, and we support a growing number of open source projects and initiatives ( https://www.fastly.com/open-source/ ). Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their hearts with others so we can help lend a supportive hand.
We love distributed teams. Fastly’s home base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe. In fact, 50% of our employees work outside of SF! An international remote culture is part of our DNA.
We care about you. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits, like generous parental leave, options for free medical/dental/vision plans, and an open vacation program that enables our folks to take the time they need to recharge (some benefits may vary by location).
We value diversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful — every day.
We are passionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we’re not “one size fits all”. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they’re passionate about.

Fastly provides equal employment opportunity without regard to an applicant’s race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, religion, marital status or veteran status.

Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Fastly. Please inform us if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

 What you'll work on:

A forward thinker who is visionary, strategic and open and eager to learning and applying new technologies.
Proven problem-solving skills and the aptitude to overcome more difficult technical issues and challenges. Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects with changing priorities to meet tight deadlines in an agile environment.
Self-directed and proven skill to work independently using a high level of evaluation, originality and/or ingenuity to complete Ability to manage conflict as it may arise.
Experience with interviewing and hiring.
Has a strong sense of pace and urgency.
 Perks and Benefits:

Typical vacation, benefits, and competitive compensation plans you would expect but also some additional perks like engineering improvement day, a hackathon event, 4 weeks paid parental leave, a company contribution for commuter expenses, free Hubway membership, and a great office smack-dab in Boston’s Fort Point Channel, a tremendous amount of responsibility & collaboration, wicked awesome co-workers, Thirsty Thursdays, a fully stocked kitchen, fun company outings, and more.

We actively encourage everyone to apply. Job : IT & Systems Control Primary Location : Massachusetts-Dorchester Schedule : Full-time Job Posting : Feb 7, 2018, 2:42:17 PM

Headquartered in Lowell, Massachusetts, MACOM is certified to the ISO9001 international quality standard and ISO14001 environmental management standard. MACOM has multiple design centers, Si, GaAs and InP fabrication, manufacturing, assembly and test, and operational facilities throughout North America, Europe, Asia and Australia. In addition, MACOM offers foundry services that represents a key core competency within our business. The foundry provides access to, and control of our broad range of proprietary technologies in an asset light, cost effective structure.


MACOM sells and distributes products globally via a sales channel comprised of a direct field sales force, authorized sales representatives and leading industry distributors. Our sales team is trained across all of our products to give our customers insights into our entire portfolio.


Our global organization of skilled engineers is driven every day to solve the world’s most demanding wireless and wireline application challenges. We’re proud of our more than sixty years’ of hands-on experience designing and building analog semiconductor technology across the RF to Light spectrum.


Engineering Data Systems Developer


Description


This is not your typical IT job. As an Engineering Data Systems Developer at MACOM, you will be part of a small high leverage team chartered to build cross-functional data systems from the ground up to support MACOM engineers world-wide. You could be based in the corporate headquarters in Lowell, MA or in MACOM’s field office in Hillsboro, OR. You will collaborate with other EDS engineers, as well as people in Operations and other Engineering roles to define and develop data analysis/reporting tools and systems aimed at meeting the needs of the organization for years to come. Your skills, interests and knowledge related to database architectures, web programming, systems integration, factory automation and how engineers process information to solve problems and make decisions will be key to your success, as will your attention to detail and your passion for excellence. If the idea of getting in at the foundation level and being a part of building great things resonates with you, this role may be a perfect fit for you.


Responsibilities 
Gain experience coming up to speed on legacy (Java) MACOM data tools/systems. Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering groups to define a variety of data analysis/reporting tools. Then develop, deploy and support the desired set of tools. Assist in designing, developing and deploying EDS solutions capable of accommodating the requirements of the organization with high reliability and high performance for the next 5 years. Integrate legacy MACOM data tools/systems with the Engineering Data Systems environment. Support deployment of Engineering Data Systems servers and data analysis/reporting tools to other MACOM sites and contract manufacturing partners, both domestic and overseas. Participate in setting and then complying with EDS standards for database schema, programming conventions, documentation, version control and revision tracking. Implement robust monitoring systems and methodologies capable of quickly detecting and correcting abnormal system condition/performance before it impacts users or other systems.
Qualifications 
BS in EE, CS or other technical discipline with at least 5 years of experience in an EDS type of role, although standout new college graduates with internship experience will be considered. Detail oriented with strong fundamentals in disciplined programming methodologies. Intermediate knowledge of statistics and probabilities is a plus. Advanced knowledge and practical experience with Linux and MySQL. Advanced knowledge and practical experience with D3, Flask or Django. Advanced knowledge and experience programming in SQL, Java, Perl and Python. Advanced knowledge and practical experience with database design and web programming. Interest, or preferably experience, in “big data” and/or “cloud-based” storage and processing. Excellent verbal and written “360 degree” communication skills. Initiative to address and appropriately escalate problems to achieve rapid resolution. Ability to work effectively with cross-functional engineering peer groups in a dynamic, collaborative, data directed and results oriented environment. U.S. citizenship or “green card” and the ability to travel within the US and internationally. Candidates with the qualifications above, plus a minimum of 2 years of experience as a Test Engineer or Yield Engineer in a semiconductor fabrication environment are highly desirable. The ideal candidate will be a generalist with regard to web programming, application programming, database design or database administration. However, a specialist in one of these fields with a passion to diversify into the other fields would also be desirable.

Bonus Skills:
Aws (ec2, rds, etc)
Web server configuration and tuning experience (specially apache)
Jmeter or other load testing tools
Shell scripting
Understanding of networking and network hardware such as switches, load balancers firewalls
Experience implementing OAuth and SAML

Other:
BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
Excellent communication (verbal & written), interpersonal, leadership, and problem solving skills
Disciplined self-starter, able to be highly productive both working alone and in close collaboration within a team
Experience working with and supporting high-level/profile customers
Ability to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic entrepreneurial type of environment
Passion for education and language learning highly preferred
Internationalization experience

At Rosetta Stone we speak, learn, and interact differently, we embrace and thrive on these differences! We deeply benefit from the diversity that each individual has to offer. We are dedicated to fostering a culture that celebrates unique backgrounds, ideas and experiences. Rosetta Stone is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state or local laws.

Building Blocks help global companies solve complex problems with digital technologies. We work with clients to identify digital opportunities that will increase revenues, develop relationships and improve efficiencies. Our design, technical and operational expertise then put those opportunities into practice - rapidly, reliably and at global scale.


We have always worked with ambitious organisations who offer their products and services internationally. We understand the need to balance centralised consistency with local flexibility and offerings to support the specific goals of local market teams. We have rolled out 100’s of websites in over 100 different local countries.


Our team sits in Manchester, Boston and Zaragoza. We are a team of 70 people and growing, quickly. Building Blocks is part of Dept - an international network of leading digital agencies. From our offices across Europe and the US, 600 of the most talented and experienced people in our industry combine creativity, technology and data to deliver digital products and services that build brands, grow businesses and make people’s lives easier


Dept is made up of the agencies TamTam, Expand Online, a friend of mine, Second Degree, Building Blocks, Studio Dumbar, Be Excellent, Trust Agents, Unskippable, ebrella, Webfactory and Tricode. The network has 600 employees, a combined turnover of over €60 million, and offices in Germany, UK, US, the Netherlands and Spain.


Overall Purpose of the Role


The developer works with a technical manager and solution architect to deliver high-quality .NET code for projects across multiple client accounts. You will be relied upon to adapt and evolve Building Blocks coding standards to produce world-class enterprise web applications.


You will receive exposure and training on best-in-class enterprise products across many areas such as content management, customer relationship management, enterprise resource planning, commerce, data management platforms and much more.


You will benefit from working with passionate like-minded individuals who enjoy a fast-paced work environment with an emphasis on enjoying what we do and doing it well. You should expect to be challenged, but equally, we expect you to challenge us with your ideas and opinions on how we continue to support our clients with great work.


We are looking for creative individuals who are assertive and detail-oriented. Ideally, you have awareness of the evolving technological landscape – especially in .NET technologies and web development specifically. Active participation in the development community such as open source development, stack overflow, and/or maintaining a blog is desirable.


Key Responsibilities

You will be responsible for solving challenges with code.
You will work with clients and colleagues alike to help translate business requirements into technical specifications whilst being prepared to challenge requirements when there are implications that may not have been identified previously.
You will constantly learn with fellow team members while providing guidance, support and mentorship to those who can benefit from your knowledge and experience.
You will work with the wider project team to deliver well scoped and developed solutions according to the clients’ needs.
You will embrace the opportunity to make an impact on the way we work if you feel there is a better way of doing things.
You will take pride in producing well written, maintainable code that applies the SOLID principals and meets (or ideally exceeds) the requirements without over-complicating the task.
You will embrace what you don’t know and the learning experience to gain knowledge in new areas.

Technical/Specialist Skills and/or Experience

Ability to demonstrate experience with C# and .NET including frameworks such as MVC.
Knowledge of the specific language and frameworks and differences between versions is desirable.
Ability to convert high-level business and technical requirements into a detailed task specification and to execute it within a timely manner.
Knowledge of SOLID principles and practical experience applying them in previous work.
Knowledge of SDLC and how to collaborate with other developers
Experience working with versioned source control such as GIT. Awareness of continuous integration and automated build processes is desirable.
Good communication skills for both internal and client facing discussion.
Experience with HTTP and associate web fundamentals such as server-client development, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, configuration, data access, state management etc.
Familiarity with interoperative integration & application programming interface – particularly RESTful web service integration.
Ability to demonstrate assertiveness and detail-oriented and pragmatic approach to software development.

Extra desirables

Experience with CMS concepts and platforms. Experience or exposure to Enterprise platforms such as SDL Tridion, Sitecore etc would be advantageous.
Familiarity with enterprise concepts such as CRM, ERP, ESB, DMP, PIM etc and practical experience in working with them.
Knowledge of componentized and modular web development.
Familiarity working with front-end JavaScript frameworks but particularly an understanding of when and when not to apply them.
Anything that you feel differentiates you from your peers…
Our Core Principles
We do things properly

We always focus on delivering quality, no matter what the task. We don’t cut corners and always strive to find the right solution for every challenge. We work with integrity and are dedicated to delivering excellence across the entire business.


We aim to be the best

We’re all passionate about what we do, so we focus on continually improving for the good of both our own personal development and the goals of the business. We’re confident in our ability to take ownership and tackle everything with a proactive mindset.


We’re open and honest

We are always approachable and transparent with our communications. Our opinions are open, constructive and respected by all members of the team and the clients we work with.


We trust each other

We all appreciate the contribution of each and every one of our colleagues. We treat each other with respect and dignity, and know that we can rely on each other to provide help, support and guidance whenever it’s needed.


We’re all in it together

We don’t believe in blame, just in finding solutions to tackle even the hardest of challenges. We all have individual areas of expertise, and our success comes from our consistent collaboration.


Remuneration & Benefits Package
Tax-free commuter benefit
Medical & Dental plans
15-days paid vacation
Individual training allowance
Salary negotiable based on experience
Opportunity to play bass or drums. (Metallica fans need not apply )
Apply Now
To apply, email your CV and cover letter to careers@building-blocks.com

Hire Logic is seeking a Mobile Application Developer (Android and/or iOS) specializing in Mobile Solutions and Connectivity with BLE Capable Medical Devices for our Fortune 500 client in Los Angeles, CA.

The ideal candidate will have deep experience in Native Android and/or iOS Mobile Application Development. This role will be responsible to drive architecture and functionality for Mobile Applications with an emphasis on modularity to allow reuse across a suite of applications to enable expanding access, integrating care, and improving outcome for the recipient.

Primary Responsibilities:

Utilize your experience in native Android and/or iOS mobile app development to help determine the Company's roadmap for using current mobile technologies in mobile applications development.
Contribute to product design and development for a new type of medical device user experience.
Look for opportunities to demonstrate new and innovative ways of developing apps.
Improve software capabilities - especially in areas of security, performance & user experience.
Be responsible for driving architecture and functionality for developing mobile application OS devices - with an emphasis on modularity to allow reuse across a suite of applications.
Lead projects with various external partners and subcontractors, working with them to ensure that the work is getting done when it needs to be and with the quality and consistency we strive to deliver to our patients.
Develop a strategy for application deployment in a validated environment. Day to day, you'll use existing mobile test environments to ensure the apps are as bug-free as possible.

Must Haves:

B.A. in Engineering or other Scientific Discipline.
4+ years' software development experience.
2+ years' experience developing software in Java.
2+ years' experience developing native Android mobile apps.
Experience with Android Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) API is a major plus.
Experience working with Android SDK components such as Activities, Fragments, Intents, Layouts, and others.
Experience working with REST, JSON or XML based web services.
Experience with multi-threaded software design and working knowledge of the general mobile software design patterns, architectures, trends, and emerging technologies.
Experience with modern development methods such as Agile or Scrum.
Experience working in a larger company with experience handling multiple development projects.
Experience working on a mobile application through commercial release - experience developing applications available through Google Play Store or iTunes store.
Experience working in a regulated industry such as aerospace, defense, or medical devices.
Experience with software configuration management tools such as Subversion, Mercurial, or Git.
Experience with software defect tracking tools such as Bugzilla, Test Track, or Rational ClearCase.

job_title: Senior Cloud Architect, Tencent Cloud Platform
summary:
Tencent Cloud is seeking a customer facing Senior Cloud Architect with extensive project consulting experience, cloud certification(s), plus full stack design and delivery skills. This senior role will guide critical architecture, reliability gains, and configuration decisions across large scale multi-region high availability implementations. As a knowledge leader, this person will also drive internal product discussions, mentor within the Solutions Engineering Team, and lead in the development and creation of architecture level solution templates and best practices for Mainland China, international, and combined global delivery.

Having worked extensively as a solutions consultant, the right candidate will excel at working with customers to understand their business and technical requirements. They will collaboratively define prioritized implementation plans, ensure that the customer's own engineering and business teams consider all key cloud related critical path actions (such as access controls, private/public network separation, and data replication/recovery zones), and define the necessary functional test and integration requirements,. They will have lead the successful delivery completion of multiple multi availability zone, cross region, PaaS based implementations, and in the delivery of handover documentation to stakeholder groups throughout each project stage.

This person will work closely with the local sales, solutions, and technical teams, to service the global project pipeline. At the same time they will also proactively define industry level solutions, combining Tencent and third party products, to enable wider service adoption.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Become a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the Tencent Cloud Platform Architecture
Lead customer architecture design proposals and implementation delivery
Lead initiatives to integrate third party products and services to achieve design goals
Develop relationships with China based Architect team and collectively engage feature teams
Partner with US based SRE and SE teams, feeding back project experiences and learnings
Contribute to product design, usability, feature development, competitiveness, and leadership

Who we are looking for...

You love working with customers on big projects, realizing ideas, building services, and unlocking the potential of new technology!
You are collaborative, independent, insistent, flexible, and open minded. And you see no conflict in any of these things.
You are knowledgeable, resourceful and show initiative. You always keep the customer’s objectives in mind.
You are positive by nature, a great team player, and both dependable and autonomous.

Requirements
Bachelor degree (or higher), with exposure to computer science, math, engineering, or equivalent practical experience
3+ years’ experience as a Cloud or Solutions Architect, combing multiple IaaS and PaaS products
Awareness of cloud compute cost models, network topology, platform services, and common storage option
Certification is one or more of Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), or another cloud providers
Experience managing and collaborating on long-term implementation projects, with documented results
Lateral and logical troubleshooting, follow-through and problem solving skills, resourcefulness, attention to detail, and communication skills, both verbal and written

About Tencent
Tencent is a publicly traded company focused on bringing high-quality and engaging internet services and entertainment to its users. In China, Tencent is the largest publisher of online games and we work together with world-renown developers such as Activision, Epic Games, Halfbrick Studios, King, and Riot Games.

We are growing our U.S. offices and are looking for top talent to propel us forward. Combining the results-oriented nature of a startup with the resources of a profitable and leading internet company, Tencent America offers a unique opportunity for aspiring individuals to thrive.

We embrace a culture of teamwork & creativity and are driven by our values - Integrity, Passion, Collaboration, and Innovation. We seek individuals who prosper and thrive in this type of environment, and also know how to have fun. We offer competitive compensation, fully paid health benefits, and opportunities for professional growth.

For more information about our company, visit our websites:
Benefits Information: http://careers.tencent.com/global/us/Benefits.html

Product Information: https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/

GENERAL SUMMARY:
Serve as the Account Manager/lead on several assigned Service/Business Units. Develop materials to support events managed by Donor Relations, including all Visiting Committee support and selected stewardship and recognition events, all communication aspects of the Susan F. Smith Center for Women’s Cancers Executive Council (SSCEC) events, and Palm Beach events.
Account Manager will also work on Division projects as assigned, which could include collateral materials, and content for various platforms.
Research, write, and edit a variety of marketing materials to support the needs of the Division of Development & the Jimmy Fund in raising more than $200 million annually. Embody Dana-Farber’s Core Values: Impact; Excellence; Compassion & Respect; and Discovery every day. Add value to the Dana-Farber community by seeking opportunities to collaborate across the Institute. Foster an ethical, positive, results-oriented culture founded on open communication. Responsible for assisting the entire Division with reaching financial goals.
PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop and execute communications strategies that help donor stewardship and recognition, and cultivation events reach their goals. Materials include invitations, program books, program book materials, hand-out materials and more.
Serve as Development Communications main account contact with assigned Donor Relations staff including the Assistant Vice President, Sr. Associate Director, Assistant and Associate Directors, and event officers, as well as volunteers, physicians and donors.
Create and executes Development Communications strategies and materials supporting for Dana-Farber Visiting Committees Symposia, and stewardship, recognition and cultivation events and activities, and additional projects as assigned.
Develop communications plans for each event, including analysis of successes and challenges of the previous year and recommendations for strategies, tactics, and timelines.
Oversee creative execution of projects and provide the copywriting, editing and proof-reading for all written materials and marketing collateral.
Provide project management and collaborate as a strategic partner with Donor Relations to ensure marketing projects are completed on point, on time, and on budget.
Collaborate with Development Communications and Online Marketing colleagues (design, web developers, photography, and production staff) to develop effective creative strategies and smoothly execute projects.
As assigned, research, write, and edit a variety of marketing communications materials to support the needs of the Division of Development & the Jimmy Fund. Specific writing and marketing assignments include, but are not limited to:
Articles for donor newsletters and publications that include Impact, and other print and online/email newsletters (adhering to AP style)
Copywriting (print, online, social media), brochures, collateral, website copy, email blasts, e-newsletters, etc.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reports to Associate Director, Development Communications. There is no supervisory responsibility for this position. This individual will work with a variety of individuals throughout the Institute, including Donor Relations personnel, prospect managers, business unit contacts and directors, and other service unit contacts and directors.
Qualifications
MINIMUM JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or related field required. Three to five years of event support, marketing and copywriting experience in an agency, non-profit, or related industry required; experience in a Development setting preferred, particularly marketing or communications. Experience in the Healthcare sector also preferred.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:
Strong creativity, strong writing abilities – including collateral production, strong proof-reading and editing skills, capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneously while providing client service excellence to multiple business units. Also requires donor relations and stewardship experience, event/project management experience, excellent organizational skills, proficiency in interpersonal business communications and listening skills, strategic marketing and event support planning.

PATIENT CONTACT:
No

WORKING CONDITIONS:
Office in typical office setting. Works on deadline. Some evening or weekend work may be required.

Scope
Monotype is a leading global provider of typefaces, technology and expertise that enable the best user experiences and ensure brand integrity. We offer one of the world’s largest and most highly regarded typeface libraries, as well as innovative solutions that bring the power of type to life. We help a wide range of customers – including consumers, creative professionals, web developers and device manufacturers – to create, distribute and consume beautiful, clear content.
Monotype seeks a Sales Operations Support Representative to join our team. This position is responsible for processing worldwide royalty reporting activities and contract processing. Leveraging internal processes and systems, this role is centered on the insurance that all contracts and royalty orders are processed appropriately and efficiently. This role will manage the order processing and administration of the royalty order process and collection and tracking of royalty reports plus processing contracts through our internal and external systems.
Responsibilities
Royalty Report Processing:
Record royalty reports when received recording under the correct agreement. Ensure royalty report is consistent to prior report.
Review invoice request for completeness then submit royalty reports to finance for invoicing. This must be done processed within strict timeframes to meet required deadlines.
Email reminders to customers if the report is not received as required.
Work through any complex or customer sensitive items with the sales person
 Contract Processing:
Ensures all contracts are processed through our internal approval process and successfully distributed to the contract signer and the internal employee when fully executed.
Follow the contract policy and export policy carefully to ensure it is adhered to as required.
Work with the contract signer and the vendor/customer and prioritize as needed.
Requirements
Associates degree or equivalent experience required. 1 to 3 years contracts administration or royalty reporting experience preferred.
General knowledge of Salesforce or other CRM databases and experience entering and tracking customer information through such systems.
Proven track record of meeting/exceeding performance expectations.
Previous experience working with Sales and Finance to achieve corporate sales requirements.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities and work within deadlines.
Very good written and verbal business communication skills.
Flexible in regards to learning Direct order processing, backing up during quarter end.

ZOLL Medical is a growing, innovation-driven company on the forefront of delivering medical devices to save lives, and software solutions to improve efficiency. With customers in more than 140 countries, we continue to expand our reach, as well as our product offerings. Hospitals, emergency medical services (EMS), and others trust us to provide high-quality products and exceptional customer service. ZOLL products are used every day across the globe to save the lives of people who suffer sudden cardiac arrest. From Real CPR Help® technology—an industry first—to the world’s only wearable defibrillator, our capabilities and features set us apart. But none of this would be possible without the motivation and dedication of ZOLL employees, and we’re invested in their success.

We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package. Join our team. It’s a great time to be a part of ZOLL!

Overview:

Plan, manage and maintain: ZOLL’s Web presence, including ZOLL’s global external and internal web properties; global iPad apps; social media sites; general electronic communication activities; and special projects. Establish tools for electronic marketing lead nurturing and targeted marketing, including set-up, development, and use strategies. Establish strategies for analytics of web and iPad apps, and create reports on all properties. Establish mobile strategies for web properties, including responsive design. Train and support a global team of multilingual website administrators. Help develop and execute a digital strategy for the company. Develop web marketing budget. Supervise a Web Designer and a Web Developer, and outside consultants who have responsibility for specific tasks within these areas.
Responsibilities
The Manager of Digital Marketing Services will help define ZOLL’s web strategy as directed by overall corporate strategy, in cooperation with channel/product marketing Directors. The manager will supervise zoll.com, developing and maintaining the site and directing globalization/localization projects. The manager will supervise marketing automation software and provide guidance and development in automated marketing campaigns, and in integrating the site and software with other ZOLL management tools, such as SalesForce. The manager will supervise/maintain ZOLL’s other Chelmsford-based external websites and serve as a consultant to other public-facing ZOLL sites managed by other ZOLL locations, including helping in the development/migration of other ZOLL sites into the CMS. The manager will also supervise the development and maintenance of ZOLL’s library of multilingual apps and website versions of these apps for use by sales, distributors, manufacturer reps, in-house, and at tradeshows. The manager will also work with new acquisitions in incorporating their web and digital marketing processes.
The manager will also:
Manage the website CMS, including development, upgrades, functionality, training, content management, permissions globally
Supervise, train, and support internal and other locations in the use of marketing automation tools (Hubspot) for digital outbound marketing, inbound marketing, and sales development
Manage Marketing/Sales iPad apps, including strategy, design, and functionality. Coordinate content for these apps with the designated “iPad App Owners,” from the various marketing channels. Manage software development and analytics. Manage all internal and distributor permissions globally
Manage and implement SEO to help the performance of all the ZOLL web properties
Help build and maintain commercial grade web sites, such as distributor microsites, informational sites, and special event sites, which requires knowledge of ASP, ASPX, HTML, Cascading Style Sheets, Java Script, and XSL
Manage and edit the web blog to support SEO strategy
Manage and create PPC ads, including analytics and budgeting
Consult on ZOLL eLearning, including, eLearning modules, LMS development, and providing back-up support for LMS users
Work with ZOLL IT team from time to time on overlapping projects and/or issues
Supervise and help maintain an internal document storage/Intranet site which serves as the basis for app document deployment
Develop demos, animated pieces for websites, and interactive tools
Be responsible, in conjunction with the PR Manager and other division managers with social media responsibility, for developing ZOLL’s social media presence, including identifying social media opportunities across the company’s markets, training Super SMEs (Super subject matter experts) in how to manage social media within their office, training SMEs in how to maintain their own specific social media channels, and helping maintain ZOLL’s social media presence on YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Wikipedia, and others as necessity demands
Research and monitor new platforms (mobile, etc.) to ensure accurate and useful delivery of information on new devices
Monitor the Internet using monitoring software to identify news of interest or concern. Help maintain the ZOLL in the News section of the zoll.com website
Use web analytics to analyze the performance of ZOLL web properties and implement improvements to the site based on findings
Use app analytics to analyze the performance of ZOLL apps and implement improvements to the apps based on findings
Oversee electronic advertising/promotions campaigns, including e-blasts, web banners, e-newsletters, virtual tradeshows, and SmartTag marketing
Manage the process of keeping all websites approved, up-to-date, and accurate
Manage full-time Web Designer and Web Developer to assist in completion of these tasks. Develop annual objectives and conduct annual reviews for these direct reports
Be able to communicate effectively with design and technical staff to gather and communicate requirements and needs; and work in an independent fashion on tasks assigned to meet required deadlines
Hire and manage a number of outside developer/vendors in large projects
Create and manage an annual budget to cover expenses associated with these responsibilities
Travel a few times during the year to development conferences, ZOLL internal meetings, and/or ZOLL tradeshows
Qualifications
Experience managing a team
5+ years of experience in web production, digital marketing, SEO and content management. Technical and/or general familiarity with some or all of these would be most helpful: CMS, HTML, CSS, ASP, ASPX, Java Script; app development and maintenance; marketing automation programs and software; Adobe Creative Suite; Google Analytics, SEO, Web monitoring tools; Microsoft Visual Studio .NET and Microsoft SQL Server; and SQL and database applications
Experience in developing/maintaining social media presence
Solid analytical skills; solid troubleshooting and diagnostic skills, along with the ability to resolve reported bugs
Clear, concise writing abilities
Familiarity with foreign languages a plus, working knowledge a definite bonus
Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Familiarity with cross-browser, cross-device compatibility issues
Ability to work independently on focused projects
Strong communication skills
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
Required/ Preferred Education and Experience:
BA/BS Degree required
Minimum 5-7 years of experience in a similar job required, in addition to project portfolio with strategic plans and samples of work. Prior work in a business marketing environment is required

Other Duties:

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities will be reviewed periodically as duties and responsibilities change with business necessity. Essential and marginal job functions are subject to modification.

The Connotate engineering team is looking for a sustaining/support engineer with a passion for analyzing customer-reported issues and driving all aspects of resolution. The candidate will own customer escalations from end to end and will logically and methodically drive root cause analysis and implementation of high quality software remedies. The ideal candidate will be a skilled full stack .NET developer with experience troubleshooting a wide range of issues and will have extensive experience analyzing application event and error logs.


Connotate’s enterprise software products cover the areas of web content extraction and large-scale data sets, machine learning, analytics, and visualization. We’re looking for a skilled software engineer who is eager to work with customers and solve what are sometimes complex challenges in this arena.


Key Responsibilities
Take ownership of customer issues and see problems through to resolution.
Work directly with customers to clarify reported problems and to collect all information required for analysis.
Perform structured and data-driven troubleshooting, debugging and root cause analysis
Implement software bug fixes and enhancements, coordinating with the broader development team.
Embrace software development best practices, coding standards and testing.
Support technical inquiries from customers, internal stakeholders and external partners.
Provide timely and accurate feedback to customers.
Contribute to knowledge base articles and user documentation.
Requirements
Bachelor’s in Computer Science or equivalent
3+ years of full-stack .NET development experience
Expertise in C#/.NET/ASP.NET/WinForms/WPF
Experience handling customer escalations in Windows, .NET, SQL Server stack
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Excellent understanding of multi-process and multithreaded programming
Strong understanding of relational databases
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Bonus Qualifications
Proficiency in C/C++
C# performance analysis experience
Strong understanding of JavaScript/JQuery/AJAX/HTML5/CSS and DOM
Oracle as well as SQL Server experience

Senior Web Developer (API)


JOB DESCRIPTION


About Us:
We have over 30 million active users and hundreds of clients, including Machine Zone and Amazon, have benefited from 4.0 billion megabytes of app usage driven by our platform.


Besides that, we feature a host of perks, both "traditional" (health insurance, 401K, etc.) and "startup"-type (too many to list, but trust us, you'll love them.) You'd have a blast here, while learning and growing professionally, and making the world a better place for billions of people.


The Role:


We are looking for talented full-stack developers to help both build our cutting-edge platform and lead our engineering team. We are seeking experienced engineers who have both an interest in cutting-edge technology in mobile apps, web development, server-side / API development, analytics on a large (and rapidly growing) amount of data, and the people/teams that make it all happen.


The Responsibilities:

Design, code and test scalable software.
The tech stack is AngularJS/ES2015, Angular Material, Python 2.7/Flask, and Cassandra.
Lead and/or work as part of a team in an agile environment, where rapid learning, iteration, and continuous delivery are a big part of our system.
Architect, design, build, test, deploy, and support scalable APIs to interact with our mobile app and web clients
Work with product managers to design experiments (A/B and split tests), run experiments, and analyze them for results
Help hire, mentor, and develop your teammates
General Requirements:

Passion for software development
Ability to quickly turn around features as part of a team
Interest in interacting with people from other cultures – users of our platform all live in the developing world
Ability to both learn from and teach other engineers, designers, product managers, and other teammates
People skills: ability to listen and be supportive of others, helping to create a collaborative environment
Experience Requirements:

5+ years software development
Experience across the entire stack from the front-end user interface (UI) to the back-end and analytics, including operations
Experience with Python and/or Java, or very strong in at least two other modern programming languages

Technical Support Specialist - 171561
Hologic, Inc. is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of premium diagnostic products, medical imaging systems and surgical products. The Company's core business units focus on diagnostics, breast health, GYN surgical, and skeletal health. With a unified suite of technologies and a robust research and development program, Hologic is dedicated to The Science of Sure.

There has never been a more exciting time to join us. Bright people, working together to pioneer advances in human health care, have created Hologic's success. Our company believes that people are our greatest asset and only by recruiting, hiring, developing and retaining the most talented employees can we continue to be successful. Our work atmosphere is stimulating, innovative and customer focused. We provide employees with state-of-the art tools and technology, a collaborative and passionate work environment and the ability to make a dramatic difference in the world of healthcare.
We are rapidly growing and yet we have never been more focused – on our people, on our growth, on our future.
Description
As a member of the Technical Support team, the Technical Support Specialist will be responsible for supporting external and internal customers for our Breast and Skeletal Health products via phone, e-mail and web.
This position will provide remote support, troubleshooting and issue resolution for Hologic customers (e.g. radiology technologists, clinical specialists, biomedical engineers) and field staff (clinical application specialists) to facilitate the successful use of Hologic products.
This position will play a key role in delivering great customer experiences by providing responsive support which enables customers to maximize Hologic equipment uptime as well as facilitate them meeting their safety and regulatory compliance goals.
Summary of Duties and Responsibilities
Provide technical support and service for Hologic Breast & Skeletal Health customers via, phone, e-mail and web interactions
Perform basic troubleshooting and diagnose technical problems using remote diagnostic tools
Deliver consistent, high quality and responsive support to external and internal customers
Take ownership of reported issues by being empathetic to the customer’s needs
Set expectations and manage reported issues through to their completion while providing regular status updates to the customer
Document, track and manage all support requests, communications and actions in the CRM system
Follow established support processes (e.g. problem resolution, escalation) and best practices to ensure SOP compliance and positive customer experiences
Expedite the resolution of all customer requests to meet our standards for service excellence
Escalate issues to the appropriate resource to ensure timely resolution
Collaborate with other team members and departments to facilitate the problem resolution process
Use the Knowledge Base (KB) for research during problem resolution and regularly contribute content to facilitate the growth of the KB
Recommend the dispatch of Field Service Engineers for issues which cannot be resolved remotely
Maintain a current and requisite knowledge level for your supported products
Attend training and self-study to acquire, maintain and improve job skills
Escalate appropriate service issues and concerns to management as necessary
Identify and embrace opportunities for continuous improvement
Perform other duties and projects as assigned, to meet company and department objectives.
Adhere to the Company's quality and regulatory compliance requirements, without exception, and ensures that all job duties inherent in the position description are performed in accordance with established policies and procedures.

Qualifications
Working experience and knowledge of customer support work processes and best practices needed to deliver great customer experiences
Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to convey complex information and procedures to novice level users
Demonstrated track record and passion for understanding and addressing customer needs
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Must possess the ability to work independently to resolve reported or discovered product issues
Highly organized and detail oriented
Strong follow-up skills with a keen eye towards driving issue resolution
Results driven and dedicated to delivering outstanding work
Proven ability to multi-task, work under pressure, adapt and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Strong knowledge of support tools such as CRM, knowledge management and ACD systems
Must have strong knowledge and expertise using the Windows operating systems. Knowledge of command- line navigation and Linux/Unix is a plus
Experience and working knowledge of network technologies (e.g. TCP/IP) and remote access tools (e.g. VPN, Remote Desktop)
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Basic understanding of medical imaging technology, DICOM and PACS storage systems is helpful, but not required
Ability to identify and assist with the implementation of process improvements

Education
College degree required (Associate level and above). A technical discipline such as computer science, electrical/electronic/biomedical engineering a plus, or an equivalent blend of education and experience in a fast-paced technology environment

Experience
A minimum of 4 years related job experience is required in a customer, technical, or field support role with at least 2 years spent in a technical support capacity for complex software applications or medical devices
Prior experience in a service environment working with customers to resolve problems related to medical workflow with emphasis on DICOM and network workflow, is a plus
Specialized Knowledge
Knowledge of imaging technologies, DICOM and understanding of application integration and mammography workflow is helpful but not required
Working knowledge of mammography equipment is helpful but not required
Familiarity with various medical devices such as MRI, Ultrasound and Bone Density is helpful but not required

 Additional Details
(Including Physical & Mental requirements)
This position requires the ability to maintain consistent and timely attendance for assigned support shifts. Also, requires the ability to work a full-time schedule with flexible work hours for assigned support shifts, including select holidays, as well as the after-hours and weekend on-call rotation

In this position, you will be part of a team of Software Engineers who are engaged in a large scale effort to design, develop, implement and support web based insurance applications. You will implement robust business applications to help us sell our insurance products, interact with our customers, communicate electronically with our agents. You will be expected to maintain awareness of internet trends, technologies and best practices. You must be adept at problem solving, workflow analysis, interpersonal relations, and have excellent oral/written communications skills. You must have the ability to direct others while promoting a spirit of partnership and collegiality across administrative and functional areas of the company. You will be expected to contribute with hands on development. You will also help the architecture team support IT Business Strategy in the context of projects.

Responsibilities Include:
Researching, analyzing, designing, proposing, and delivering solutions that are appropriate for the business and technology strategies.
Conceive solutions and develop solutions.
Work with business and development teams to implement these.
Participation on multiple project teams, including creating value with technology, designing and modeling solutions, component identification, quality reviews, and adherence to guidelines and procedures.
Researching and evaluating software/hardware products to assist in project development and operational support activities.
Work with Architecture team in researching industry trends and directions.
Recommending new tools, methodologies, technologies, data and platforms.
Supporting the selection of tools and components used for an IT project.
Analyzing the current architecture to identify weaknesses and develop opportunities for improvements such as expanding capacity, predictability, reducing time & cost, and increasing effectiveness.

Qualifications:
6 to 10 Years of experience in developing solutions.
Java 8 extensive experience.
Spring framework experience is required.
Experience with developing front end apps [JavaScript/HTML5/CSS3/JQuery].
AngularJS, NodeJS, NoSQL experience.
Strong J2EE and SOA Experience required.
Any ESB, or Mule/or Camel experience.
WordPress experience is required.
EAP 6/7, WebSphere and Tomcat experience.
Drools rules engine.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Property & Casualty experience a plus.
Docker experience is preferred.
Experience with IBM Bluemix/Watson, Alexa API, Google Home, Facebook Messenger BOT API, Market API is a plus.
Need to be a self-starter and able to work independently with minimal supervision.

Education:
Bachelor’s Degree

job_title: PROJECT MANAGER, Marketing & Communications, Interactive Design
summary:
Boston University's Interactive Design division is looking for a talented, smart project manager who will assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility; coordinate internal resources for the flawless execution of projects; assist in development of a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress; ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget. Boston Universitys Interactive Design division is an award-winning web design agency, nestled within the department of Marketing & Communications. The Interactive Design hive is always buzzing with innovative designers, wicked smart developers, and colorful copywriters, all of whom have a deep knowledge and passion for BU culture. If you want to work in a fast paced, rapidly evolving environment but, an environment that provides a terrific work life balance, we want to hear from you!

Required Skills

B.A. /B.S., or equivalent, three to five years of experience working in project management in an agency, design or development-focused organization or technology sector. Understanding of, and experience managing design driven projects with a focus on user experience needs. Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in site builds, design projects, software development and web technologies. Some experience with Agile process is preferred. Experience preferred, but not required, with: WordPress (the development platform of BU), OmniPlan (for scheduling and estimating), ActiveColab (tasking and time tracking). Requires flexibility and adaptability to new technology in a changing environment and a thorough understanding of project management phases, techniques, and tools. Ability to prioritize multiple projects and ability to work well under pressure and on high visibility projects, and the ability to work in a fast paced, rapidly evolving environment.

Required Experience

Scope
Monotype is a leading global provider of typefaces, technology and expertise that enable the best user experiences and ensure brand integrity. We offer one of the world’s largest and most highly regarded typeface libraries, as well as innovative solutions that bring the power of type to life. We help a wide range of customers – including consumers, creative professionals, web developers and device manufacturers – to create, distribute and consume beautiful, clear content.
Monotype seeks a Sales Operations Support Representative to join our team. This position is responsible for processing worldwide royalty reporting activities and contract processing. Leveraging internal processes and systems, this role is centered on the insurance that all contracts and royalty orders are processed appropriately and efficiently. This role will manage the order processing and administration of the royalty order process and collection and tracking of royalty reports plus processing contracts through our internal and external systems.
Responsibilities
Royalty Report Processing:
Record royalty reports when received recording under the correct agreement. Ensure royalty report is consistent to prior report.
Review invoice request for completeness then submit royalty reports to finance for invoicing. This must be done processed within strict timeframes to meet required deadlines.
Email reminders to customers if the report is not received as required.
Work through any complex or customer sensitive items with the sales person
 Contract Processing:
Ensures all contracts are processed through our internal approval process and successfully distributed to the contract signer and the internal employee when fully executed.
Follow the contract policy and export policy carefully to ensure it is adhered to as required.
Work with the contract signer and the vendor/customer and prioritize as needed.
Requirements
Associates degree or equivalent experience required. 1 to 3 years contracts administration or royalty reporting experience preferred.
General knowledge of Salesforce or other CRM databases and experience entering and tracking customer information through such systems.
Proven track record of meeting/exceeding performance expectations.
Previous experience working with Sales and Finance to achieve corporate sales requirements.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities and work within deadlines.
Very good written and verbal business communication skills.
Flexible in regards to learning Direct order processing, backing up during quarter end.

Scope

job_title: Principal Software Engineer - Azure Machine Learning
summary:
Machine learning, data science and artificial intelligence.


We are in the midst of a revolution.


Exponential growth has transformed data into a new natural resource. Every industry has focused on exploiting advanced data analytics for competitive advantage. Applications of advanced intelligence abound: identifying snow leopards in the wile, deep understanding of customer relationships, self-driving vehicles, multi-level process automation & many more.


Our team is working on the next generation of the Azure Big Data platform for data scientists. The next generation enables data scientists to build solutions for Big Data problems using the power of azure high scale compute and services combined with the latest in research from Microsoft and the open source communities.


Our culture is execution focused, collaborative, and passionate. We are looking for great, creative Engineers who can think outside the box.


Familiarity and excitement for designing and building complete full stack products and fault-tolerant services at a true high scale are key to our vision. If you are passionate about building large scale, cutting edge solutions, not limited by any given role, and building world class engineering systems and teams for the AI revolution, then there is an opportunity to join the Azure Machine Learning team in Boston.


What will you do:

Design and Build the next greatest thing in Azure Machine Learning Deliver new technology capabilities to enterprise partners and customers Expand the definition of Azure Machine Learning beyond current scope Actively develop and design UX and backend systems.
Maintain and operate services in the azure cloud.
Collaborate with other engineers and program managers to identify challenges and design solutions Leverage existing open source tools and libraries in your day-to-day work.
Be a leader in the organization Mentor engineers in the team.


Who are you:

You have at least a BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent.
You have 10+ years of experience in software engineering.
You have experience writing distributed, high scale services.
You are familiar with many open source tools and libraries and engaged with the community.
You have implemented non-trivial web-based GUI’s and supporting backends.You have a strong background in leading teams and making others greatYou work and collaborate well with executives and customersYou are an excellent developer who enjoys writing code and tests.
You have experience with Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. xCloudAIx
xAzureMLx

My client is revolutionizing an industry with a powerful platform of inter-connected applications that allow architects, construction industry professionals and corporate owners to collaborate better and leverage the power of 3D / VR coupled with Big Data to dramatically improve project delivery, increase quality, reduce risk, and increase margins.


You will be building out the next-generation of a brand new suite of rich mobile/web applications


I am working with the Director of Engineering who I have worked with for the past few years looking for one or two Senior Web Developers who are excited about solving challenging development problems and delivering high-quality software.
