provide successful realization of business opportunities by delivering timely and cost efficient IT systems that promote the tenet of service-oriented architecture and that reuse existing assets by standardizing, commoditizing, and automating system and business processes to drive cost efficiencies; work with a blended team of full-time employees and onshore/offshore contractors operating at multiple locations across time zones; design, develop, and deliver software solutions utilizing programs such as Core Java, Spring, Hibernate, and Google Web Toolkit; provide service-oriented solutions integration utilizing web-services and knowledge of SOA and web service standards; integrate and automate testing while using source code management best practices; expand and modify system to improve workflow; analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate and improve existing systems and to review computer system capabilities and workflow; develop, document and revise system design procedures, test procedures, and quality standards; and own technology roadmap of the Application Integration platform and work with internal flow owners to incorporate features into the core platform.

Leveraging internal processes and systems, this role is centered on the insurance that all contracts and royalty orders are processed appropriately and efficiently. This role will manage the order processing and administration of the royalty order process and collection and tracking of royalty reports plus processing contracts through our internal and external systems.

Follow the contract policy and export policy carefully to ensure it is adhered to as required.
Work with the contract signer and the vendor/customer and prioritize as needed.

Previous experience working with Sales and Finance to achieve corporate sales requirements.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities and work within deadlines.
Very good written and verbal business communication skills.
Flexible in regards to learning Direct order processing, backing up during quarter end.

job_title: Principal Software Engineer - Azure Machine Learning
summary:
Machine learning, data science and artificial intelligence.


We are in the midst of a revolution.


Exponential growth has transformed data into a new natural resource. Every industry has focused on exploiting advanced data analytics for competitive advantage. Applications of advanced intelligence abound: identifying snow leopards in the wile, deep understanding of customer relationships, self-driving vehicles, multi-level process automation & many more.


Our team is working on the next generation of the Azure Big Data platform for data scientists. The next generation enables data scientists to build solutions for Big Data problems using the power of azure high scale compute and services combined with the latest in research from Microsoft and the open source communities.


Our culture is execution focused, collaborative, and passionate. We are looking for great, creative Engineers who can think outside the box.


Familiarity and excitement for designing and building complete full stack products and fault-tolerant services at a true high scale are key to our vision. If you are passionate about building large scale, cutting edge solutions, not limited by any given role, and building world class engineering systems and teams for the AI revolution, then there is an opportunity to join the Azure Machine Learning team in Boston.


What will you do:

Design and Build the next greatest thing in Azure Machine Learning Deliver new technology capabilities to enterprise partners and customers Expand the definition of Azure Machine Learning beyond current scope Actively develop and design UX and backend systems.
Maintain and operate services in the azure cloud.
Collaborate with other engineers and program managers to identify challenges and design solutions Leverage existing open source tools and libraries in your day-to-day work.
Be a leader in the organization Mentor engineers in the team.


Who are you:

You have at least a BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent.
You have 10+ years of experience in software engineering.
You have experience writing distributed, high scale services.
You are familiar with many open source tools and libraries and engaged with the community.
You have implemented non-trivial web-based GUI’s and supporting backends.You have a strong background in leading teams and making others greatYou work and collaborate well with executives and customersYou are an excellent developer who enjoys writing code and tests.
You have experience with Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. xCloudAIx
xAzureMLx

My client is revolutionizing an industry with a powerful platform of inter-connected applications that allow architects, construction industry professionals and corporate owners to collaborate better and leverage the power of 3D / VR coupled with Big Data to dramatically improve project delivery, increase quality, reduce risk, and increase margins.


You will be building out the next-generation of a brand new suite of rich mobile/web applications


I am working with the Director of Engineering who I have worked with for the past few years looking for one or two Senior Web Developers who are excited about solving challenging development problems and delivering high-quality software.

Responsibilities
IMP is looking for a highly motivated and self-driven SaaS Developer Lead to join IMP's Innovative Technology Practice. You will contribute to the technical development of IMP's service offerings for our high-profile investment management clients. Your role will be not only to help us develop existing applications, but to architect new and innovative tools and solutions to help deliver our consulting projects on time and on budget.
You will participate in technical and design discussions with senior management team members and manage the development lifecycle from prototype to release. You will also work closely with our team to accelerate time to market for new tools and technical solutions while keeping abreast of key technology developments.

Ideal candidate will have knowledge of/experience in:

Cloud infrastructure technologies
Deploying, running and managing web applications
Release management and versioning/source control
Test planning with automated testing solutions
Virtual environments and datacenters
Troubleshooting software systems, optimizing performance, resolving problems, and providing follow-up on all issues and solutions
Working on complex projects that require subject matter expertise
Software engineering best practices

Expertise in Agile development, SCRUM
C#, Java, JavaScript, HTML 5, MS Visual Studio
SQL queries and basic SQL DB management (creating tables, views, triggers and stored procedures)
Experience in developing ASP.NET web applications
DevExpress ASP.NET experience preferred
Experience in Microsoft Azure

Requirements

Undergraduate Degree from an Accredited College or University in Computer Science or related field
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience developing SaaS based applications
Excellent technical design, problem solving, debugging and communication skills
Solid written and oral communication skills

Location
Boston, MA - up to 10% travel may be required.
Benefits

Medical and Dental Insurance
401k with company match
Paid time off (holidays, vacation and sick days)

Application Instructions
Interested candidates should apply with a cover letter and resume (Gail Blandford, Director of HR & Recruiting).
Company Description
IMP (Implementation Management Professionals) is a Boston-based consultancy in the investment management technology space. IMP offers advisory services, system review and selection, and implementation projects across the front, middle and back-office. Known for our deep subject matter expertise in trade order management, compliance, performance and accounting systems, IMP's Consultants understand the commercial landscape and have specialized hands-on experience with the world's leading investment software products. For over a decade IMP has provided customized solutions for asset managers, hedge funds, mutual funds, insurance companies, and global banks that span from hedge funds managing $100 million in assets under management (AUM) to asset management firms with over $2 trillion in AUM.

Position Summary
The AX Administrator is a member of the Insulet AX team and reports to the ERP Development Manager. Working in a dynamic and collaborative team environment, the role supports the health and maintenance of both production and non-production Dynamics AX environments. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated ability in the installation, administration and support of Microsoft Dynamics AX.
Responsibilities
Environment ManagementWork with hosting provider to troubleshoot application and environment issues within the Microsoft AZURE Cloud
Work with hosting provider to create new and decommission obsolete environments
Coordinate/maintain service accounts with OPS team
Deploy, manage and maintain SSRS & Management Reporter.
Install/configure any relevant Third Party ISV solutions
Build Management
Perform builds and maintain build automation (PowerShell)
Deploy builds (model store) to nonproduction environments
Coordinate with hosting provider to deploy builds to production
Application Administration
Assist Help Desk engineers and developers to troubleshoot application issues in all environments
Coordinate with EDI and web services trading partners/vendors.
Performance monitoring and improvements
Security
Develop, maintain and enforce security policies and procedures aligned with best practices for segregation of duties and lead other process improvement initiatives.
Management and review of security logs and table permissions framework (TPF).
Manage security in the (AIF) Application Integration Framework as needed.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Business Administration.
5+ years of system and/or application administration experience.
Solid knowledge of Dynamics AX 2012 core administration concepts.
Knowledge of SQL and RDBMS concepts.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Good documentation skills, procedures, design specs, test scripts, training documents etc.
Minimum of 2 years’ experience with Microsoft Dynamics AX.

Required Skills/Competencies:
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to work on multiple projects in a fast pasted, dynamic environment.
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet committed deadlines and managing changing priorities.
Demonstrate a willingness to learn.
Basic knowledge of PowerShell.
Ability to monitor AX performance, workflow, batch and AIF processes

Desired Skills/Competencies:
MS Certifications.
Fundamental X++ knowledge. .
Expertise in PowerShell.
Familiarity with standard AX version control (TFS) and build processes.
Understanding with Microsoft Azure and AX deployment

MEAN stack Web Developer (Lead or Principal level)

Experience developing Single Page Applications (SPA) using HTML (HTML5), CSS (CSS3), and JavaScript
Strong JavaScript experience and familiar with many modern JavaScript frameworks

Must have a strong background working in a Scrum / Agile environment

Come work with similar technology-minded folks who care about creating clean, quality code within a company that is going through a technology revolution!

The Software QA Analyst Officer position is for a software professional working on Enterprise Servicing Platform (ESP) related initiatives. ESP is a critical component of State Street solutions for IMS ORI and Global Services clients. The position requires a strong background in application development and testing and a good understanding of leading IT technologies in particular RDBMS and Web Development. The work requires a candidate to be competent in all aspects of the software development lifecycle.
The successful candidate will be expected to collaborate with peers on cross functional teams (primarily agile) to deliver a high quality solution. The candidate will work directly with the project team to understand the business requirements that will help define the overall test strategy and test plans and execute test cases via automated tools. The candidate will also interact with peers in the QA organization to proactively determine and resolve upstream and downstream impacts.
The candidate is expected to be hands on working directly with users and analysts and developers to understand business processes and the applications under test. You will be an important participant in the success of the corporation in delivering high quality software to our clients.
In this role the candidate will:
•Develop specific tests for each application encompassed in the full system the related integration of applications and user acceptance level testing: both manual and automated tests as warranted
•Provide guidance and direction to program managers end users and technical staff on internal or external factors that impact test strategy
•Participate in the metrics gathering process in order to propose and implement ongoing improvements
•Ensure proper procedures and controls are in place throughout the testing process
•Participate in production implementation “walkthroughs” for complex implementations as needed
•Participate in production check out activities for complex implementations as needed
Preferred Experience:
Bachelors Degree in an applicable field
Minimum 3 years experience in an applicable field
•Previous financial services experience and demonstrated understanding of relevant State Street business processes and systems (i.e. trading operations risk etc.)
•Strong attention to detail
•Quality assurance experience in a software environment through all stages of product development
•Proven problem solving and communication interpersonal and analytical skills.
•Ability to manage multiple deadlines
•Experience with software engineering standards metrics and quality assurance principles.
•Knowledge of automated testing tools
•Competent SQL query skills and experience working with database technology.
•Knowledge of defect tracking systems and their effective usage environment.
•UNIX LINUX or other open systems operating system knowledge and experience.

XebiaLabs is seeking a creative and driven player/coach to oversee our global website presence. The ideal candidate will have a passion for bringing design, messaging, and web technology together into one frictionless and modern user experience. You will develop and execute our online presence across all channels, including websites, landing pages, and microsites and will provide leadership for a cross-functional team. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of managing, designing, implementing and measuring the online presence of a growing technology brand.


Responsibilities
Lead our online presence and brand experience
Ensure highly optimized web traffic and conversions
Build a strong presence and user experience across all online channels
Implement frictionless user experience from first website hit to sign-up and optimize web lead generation and conversions
Drive multiple website design and development projects including integration with other systems
Develop global web appearance, architecture and strategy including SEO/SEM
· Manage all aspects of our web presence hands-on and across a cross-functional team
· Monitor, analyze and report on website performance
Requirements
5-10 years web marketing experience
Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement
Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform and motivate
Strong project management skills with proven track record in effectively combining messaging, creative and technology
Deep understanding of web technologies balanced with an eye for outstanding design
Experience managing multiple websites including microsites, multi-language and multi-device sites
Fanatical about frictionless user experience of the website· Hands-on design and online content optimization experience
Experience with CMS (e.g. WordPress, Drupal), HTML5, CSS3 / SASS, JS / jQuery, PHP, MYSQL, Bootstrap and a strong understanding of responsive design practices
In-depth SEO /SEM and web performance reporting (Google Analytics)
Experience with integrating websites with other systems including marketing automation and other back-end applications
Aptitude for pulling meaning and direction from data. Capacity to handle large data sets and to have a knack at boiling them down to meaningful direction that drives action and success
Technical proficiency necessary to credibly lead other with success in team management including: hiring, developing, coaching, delegating tasks and managing resources
Strong team player who thrives in diverse teams and a dynamic high-growth environment
Relevant degree and experience in the B2B technology market
About XebiaLabs
Delivering software applications to production faster and more reliably has become imperative to the future success of any business. XebiaLabs was founded in the early days of DevOps to help large companies accelerate their software releases with more reliability no matter how diverse the infrastructure or how complex the processes.


Top ranked by leading industry analysts, our enterprise DevOps platform has been adopted by the largest and most demanding companies in the world, providing them with the intelligence, automation and control they need to deliver software faster and with less risk. Our team includes some of the early DevOps visionaries and thought leaders who literally wrote the book on Continuous Delivery. Our industry veterans are passionate developers and enterprise IT pros who know how to connect the dots for enterprise scale DevOps.


Headquartered in the US, founded in the Netherlands, with additional offices in the UK, France, Germany and India, XebiaLabs has been on an exponential growth trajectory, and is propelled by the excellence of its employees. Join a team of fun and driven professionals as we help shape the DevOps market and develop the next generation of DevOps software!


Applications and Information:
Please send your resume to careers@xebialabs.com

The Systems Consultant is a senior member of the ADM-Architecture group and is responsible for developing service-oriented architecture (“SOA”)/enterprise service bus (“ESB”) and business process management based solutions across the Company and for maintaining the technical infrastructure.
Specific duties of the position will include:
provide successful realization of business opportunities by delivering timely and cost efficient IT systems that promote the tenet of service-oriented architecture and that reuse existing assets by standardizing, commoditizing, and automating system and business processes to drive cost efficiencies; work with a blended team of full-time employees and onshore/offshore contractors operating at multiple locations across time zones; design, develop, and deliver software solutions utilizing programs such as Core Java, Spring, Hibernate, and Google Web Toolkit; provide service-oriented solutions integration utilizing web-services and knowledge of SOA and web service standards; integrate and automate testing while using source code management best practices; expand and modify system to improve workflow; analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate and improve existing systems and to review computer system capabilities and workflow; develop, document and revise system design procedures, test procedures, and quality standards; and own technology roadmap of the Application Integration platform and work with internal flow owners to incorporate features into the core platform.
Minimum requirements are:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or its equivalent based on a combination of education and/or experience, and 6 years of experience in the development of IT systems.
Must have: demonstrated expertise in the architecture, technical, analytical, and financial domain; experience developing and delivering software solutions utilizing the following technical programming skills: Core Java /Spring /Hibernate or any JPA; any open source ESB or any commercial ESB; websphere Message Broker or any other message oriented middleware; general ESB/Integration patterns; strong messaging/JMS skills including MQ Series; Active MQ, or similar; any Cache solutions including Terracotta, Oracle Coherence, or eXtreme Scale; developer-level knowledge in DB/SQL and PL/SQL; Java Security including Saml or JAAS; and web services and Rest Integration; demonstrated in-depth knowledge of related enterprise best practices, standards, and libraries; extensive hands-on experience with web-services and knowledge of SOA, web services standards, XML, and other approaches to service-oriented integration; extensive hands-on experience with source code management best practices, continuous integration, and automated testing; strong presentation and communication skills; demonstrated track record of strong problem solving abilities and the ability to work well under pressure; experience with application integration domain in the financial services sector; demonstrated experience in the design and implementation of an enterprise wide messaging system; experience in Web application technologies including HTML, Java Script, CSS, JSP, and Servlet; experience in integration tools including WMB, Data Power, and WTX; and experience with a Financial Industry Message Format such as SWIFT or similar. (Unless indicated otherwise, State Street is seeking the ability in the skills listed above with no specific amount of years of experience required. All experience can be gained concurrently.)

Wayfair is looking for an iOS architect to join our team. We have a team of 25 iOS engineers and we are looking to add an architect who will be a leader within our framework team to write great code and positively shape code frameworks and quality processes. Wayfair's iOS apps for Wayfair, Joss & Main, and AllModern have over 100,000 users per day and account for over $100M in revenue per year.

Projects:
Be a major contributor to app architecture and the team's technical direction by influencing team coding and quality practices.
Write high quality Swift code. Contribute to Wayfair’s open source iOS projects.
Work with the team to create new iOS apps and write new features and UI in our existing iOS apps.
Build delightful user experiences with beautiful UI, engaging animations, and optimal performance.
Provide mentorship and leadership for code consistency, good architecture practices and effective unit/UI testing.

You Have:
In depth understanding of Swift and Objective-C design patterns. We'd like to see 5-7 years of hands on coding experience.
Significant experience with the iOS SDK.
A proven ability to work in a large team and improve the codebase.
Proven debugging and performance testing skills.
Performed code/architecture reviews.
Educated and mentored team members. Set technical standards.
Contributed to open source projects.
Great communication skills and a sense of humor.
A desire to be part of an excellent mobile team.
Several apps already listed in the app store.
Experience writing apps that consume RESTful services.
A great understanding of Object Oriented Design, MVC, and web architecture.
Knowledge of SQL and a web language like PHP, Python, Java, or C# is a plus.
Experience writing apps for retail is a big plus.

A Few of the Perks:
Be part of a team of great iOS developers.
Have a measurable and highly visible impact on the revenue of a multi-billion dollar public retail giant
Amazing company culture where we try new things, measure results, and actually have a work-life balance too.
Equity grants.

Learn more:
Check out our open source projects: https://github.com/wayfair.
Check out our iOS apps: https://itunes.apple.com/us/developer/wayfair-llc/id525522335 . About Wayfair:
Wayfair Inc. offers an extensive selection of home furnishings and décor across all styles and price points. The Wayfair family of sites includes:
Wayfair, an online destination for all things home
Joss & Main, where beautiful furniture and finds meet irresistible savings
AllModern, your home for affordable modern design
DwellStudio, a design house with a decidedly modern vibe
Birch Lane, a collection of classic furnishings and timeless home décor
Wayfair generated $3.4 billion in net revenue for full year 2016. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts with operations throughout North America and Europe, the company employs more than 5,600 people.

*** This position is ONLY for on-site in our Boston, MA headquarters***
Wayfair does not accept unsolicited candidate referrals or resumes / CVs from third-party vendors, including recruitment agencies. Wayfair will not be responsible or liable for any fees or costs associated with such unsolicited submissions.

The candidate is expected to be hands on working directly with users and analysts and developers to understand business processes and the applications under test. You will be an important participant in the success of the corporation in delivering high quality software to our clients.
In this role the candidate will:
•Develop specific tests for each application encompassed in the full system the related integration of applications and user acceptance level testing: both manual and automated tests as warranted
•Provide guidance and direction to program managers end users and technical staff on internal or external factors that impact test strategy
•Participate in the metrics gathering process in order to propose and implement ongoing improvements
•Ensure proper procedures and controls are in place throughout the testing process
•Participate in production implementation “walkthroughs” for complex implementations as needed
•Participate in production check out activities for complex implementations as needed
Preferred Experience:
Bachelors Degree in an applicable field
Minimum 3 years experience in an applicable field
•Previous financial services experience and demonstrated understanding of relevant State Street business processes and systems (i.e. trading operations risk etc.)
•Strong attention to detail
•Quality assurance experience in a software environment through all stages of product development
•Proven problem solving and communication interpersonal and analytical skills.
•Ability to manage multiple deadlines
•Experience with software engineering standards metrics and quality assurance principles.
•Knowledge of automated testing tools
•Competent SQL query skills and experience working with database technology.
•Knowledge of defect tracking systems and their effective usage environment.
•UNIX LINUX or other open systems operating system knowledge and experience.

XebiaLabs is seeking a creative and driven player/coach to oversee our global website presence. The ideal candidate will have a passion for bringing design, messaging, and web technology together into one frictionless and modern user experience. You will develop and execute our online presence across all channels, including websites, landing pages, and microsites and will provide leadership for a cross-functional team. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of managing, designing, implementing and measuring the online presence of a growing technology brand.


Responsibilities
Lead our online presence and brand experience
Ensure highly optimized web traffic and conversions
Build a strong presence and user experience across all online channels
Implement frictionless user experience from first website hit to sign-up and optimize web lead generation and conversions
Drive multiple website design and development projects including integration with other systems
Develop global web appearance, architecture and strategy including SEO/SEM
· Manage all aspects of our web presence hands-on and across a cross-functional team
· Monitor, analyze and report on website performance
Requirements
5-10 years web marketing experience
Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement
Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform and motivate
Strong project management skills with proven track record in effectively combining messaging, creative and technology
Deep understanding of web technologies balanced with an eye for outstanding design
Experience managing multiple websites including microsites, multi-language and multi-device sites
Fanatical about frictionless user experience of the website· Hands-on design and online content optimization experience
Experience with CMS (e.g. WordPress, Drupal), HTML5, CSS3 / SASS, JS / jQuery, PHP, MYSQL, Bootstrap and a strong understanding of responsive design practices
In-depth SEO /SEM and web performance reporting (Google Analytics)
Experience with integrating websites with other systems including marketing automation and other back-end applications
Aptitude for pulling meaning and direction from data. Capacity to handle large data sets and to have a knack at boiling them down to meaningful direction that drives action and success
Technical proficiency necessary to credibly lead other with success in team management including: hiring, developing, coaching, delegating tasks and managing resources
Strong team player who thrives in diverse teams and a dynamic high-growth environment

About XebiaLabs
Delivering software applications to production faster and more reliably has become imperative to the future success of any business. XebiaLabs was founded in the early days of DevOps to help large companies accelerate their software releases with more reliability no matter how diverse the infrastructure or how complex the processes.


Top ranked by leading industry analysts, our enterprise DevOps platform has been adopted by the largest and most demanding companies in the world, providing them with the intelligence, automation and control they need to deliver software faster and with less risk. Our team includes some of the early DevOps visionaries and thought leaders who literally wrote the book on Continuous Delivery. Our industry veterans are passionate developers and enterprise IT pros who know how to connect the dots for enterprise scale DevOps.


Headquartered in the US, founded in the Netherlands, with additional offices in the UK, France, Germany and India, XebiaLabs has been on an exponential growth trajectory, and is propelled by the excellence of its employees. Join a team of fun and driven professionals as we help shape the DevOps market and develop the next generation of DevOps software!

The Systems Consultant is a senior member of the ADM-Architecture group and is responsible for developing service-oriented architecture (“SOA”)/enterprise service bus (“ESB”) and business process management based solutions across the Company and for maintaining the technical infrastructure.
Specific duties of the position will include:
provide successful realization of business opportunities by delivering timely and cost efficient IT systems that promote the tenet of service-oriented architecture and that reuse existing assets by standardizing, commoditizing, and automating system and business processes to drive cost efficiencies; work with a blended team of full-time employees and onshore/offshore contractors operating at multiple locations across time zones; design, develop, and deliver software solutions utilizing programs such as Core Java, Spring, Hibernate, and Google Web Toolkit; provide service-oriented solutions integration utilizing web-services and knowledge of SOA and web service standards; integrate and automate testing while using source code management best practices; expand and modify system to improve workflow; analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate and improve existing systems and to review computer system capabilities and workflow; develop, document and revise system design procedures, test procedures, and quality standards; and own technology roadmap of the Application Integration platform and work with internal flow owners to incorporate features into the core platform.
Minimum requirements are:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or its equivalent based on a combination of education and/or experience, and 6 years of experience in the development of IT systems.
Must have: demonstrated expertise in the architecture, technical, analytical, and financial domain; experience developing and delivering software solutions utilizing the following technical programming skills: Core Java /Spring /Hibernate or any JPA; any open source ESB or any commercial ESB; websphere Message Broker or any other message oriented middleware; general ESB/Integration patterns; strong messaging/JMS skills including MQ Series; Active MQ, or similar; any Cache solutions including Terracotta, Oracle Coherence, or eXtreme Scale; developer-level knowledge in DB/SQL and PL/SQL; Java Security including Saml or JAAS; and web services and Rest Integration; demonstrated in-depth knowledge of related enterprise best practices, standards, and libraries; extensive hands-on experience with web-services and knowledge of SOA, web services standards, XML, and other approaches to service-oriented integration; extensive hands-on experience with source code management best practices, continuous integration, and automated testing; strong presentation and communication skills; demonstrated track record of strong problem solving abilities and the ability to work well under pressure; experience with application integration domain in the financial services sector; demonstrated experience in the design and implementation of an enterprise wide messaging system; experience in Web application technologies including HTML, Java Script, CSS, JSP, and Servlet; experience in integration tools including WMB, Data Power, and WTX; and experience with a Financial Industry Message Format such as SWIFT or similar. (Unless indicated otherwise, State Street is seeking the ability in the skills listed above with no specific amount of years of experience required. All experience can be gained concurrently.)

Wayfair is looking for an iOS architect to join our team. Wayfair's iOS apps for Wayfair, Joss & Main, and AllModern have over 100,000 users per day and account for over $100M in revenue per year.

Build delightful user experiences with beautiful UI, engaging animations, and optimal performance.

You Have:
In depth understanding of Swift and Objective-C design patterns. We'd like to see 5-7 years of hands on coding experience.
Significant experience with the iOS SDK.
A proven ability to work in a large team and improve the codebase.
Proven debugging and performance testing skills.
Performed code/architecture reviews.
Educated and mentored team members. Set technical standards.
Contributed to open source projects.
Great communication skills and a sense of humor.
A desire to be part of an excellent mobile team.
Several apps already listed in the app store.
Experience writing apps that consume RESTful services.
A great understanding of Object Oriented Design, MVC, and web architecture.
Knowledge of SQL and a web language like PHP, Python, Java, or C# is a plus.
Experience writing apps for retail is a big plus.

A Few of the Perks:
Be part of a team of great iOS developers.
Have a measurable and highly visible impact on the revenue of a multi-billion dollar public retail giant
Amazing company culture where we try new things, measure results, and actually have a work-life balance too.
Equity grants.

Birch Lane, a collection of classic furnishings and timeless home décor

job_title: Principal Software Engineer - Azure Machine Learning
summary:
Machine learning, data science and artificial intelligence.


We are in the midst of a revolution.


Exponential growth has transformed data into a new natural resource. Every industry has focused on exploiting advanced data analytics for competitive advantage. Applications of advanced intelligence abound: identifying snow leopards in the wile, deep understanding of customer relationships, self-driving vehicles, multi-level process automation & many more.


Our team is working on the next generation of the Azure Big Data platform for data scientists. The next generation enables data scientists to build solutions for Big Data problems using the power of azure high scale compute and services combined with the latest in research from Microsoft and the open source communities.


Our culture is execution focused, collaborative, and passionate. We are looking for great, creative Engineers who can think outside the box.


Familiarity and excitement for designing and building complete full stack products and fault-tolerant services at a true high scale are key to our vision. If you are passionate about building large scale, cutting edge solutions, not limited by any given role, and building world class engineering systems and teams for the AI revolution, then there is an opportunity to join the Azure Machine Learning team in Boston.


What will you do:

Design and Build the next greatest thing in Azure Machine Learning Deliver new technology capabilities to enterprise partners and customers Expand the definition of Azure Machine Learning beyond current scope Actively develop and design UX and backend systems.
Maintain and operate services in the azure cloud.
Collaborate with other engineers and program managers to identify challenges and design solutions Leverage existing open source tools and libraries in your day-to-day work.
Be a leader in the organization Mentor engineers in the team.


Who are you:

You have at least a BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent.
You have 10+ years of experience in software engineering.
You have experience writing distributed, high scale services.
You are familiar with many open source tools and libraries and engaged with the community.
You have implemented non-trivial web-based GUI’s and supporting backends.You have a strong background in leading teams and making others greatYou work and collaborate well with executives and customersYou are an excellent developer who enjoys writing code and tests.
You have experience with Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to askstaff@microsoft.com.

xCloudAIx
xAzureMLx

My client is revolutionizing an industry with a powerful platform of inter-connected applications that allow architects, construction industry professionals and corporate owners to collaborate better and leverage the power of 3D / VR coupled with Big Data to dramatically improve project delivery, increase quality, reduce risk, and increase margins.


You will be building out the next-generation of a brand new suite of rich mobile/web applications


I am working with the Director of Engineering who I have worked with for the past few years looking for one or two Senior Web Developers who are excited about solving challenging development problems and delivering high-quality software.

· BS/MS in computer science or equivalent experience

· At least 7 years experience in web application development

· Strong understanding of object-oriented programming, the MVC paradigm

· Experience working with Agile teams and SCRUM principles

· Strong knowledge of the web application architectures, trends, and emerging technologies

· Relational database experience

· Experience with Amazon Web Services desirable


Technologies you will work with:

· MySQL/PostgreSQL

· Git

· Modern JS technologies (React, Angular, Knockout, jQuery, AJAX, etc.)

· redis

· SOLR

· AWS


If you are interested in hearing more about the role and company please connect with me on LinkedIn and send me a message regarding your interest OR you can send me an email here with an updated copy of your resume as well as the best time and number to reach you for a quick call.


- Justin Wissman

https://www.linkedin.com/in/justinwissman

Responsibilities
IMP is looking for a highly motivated and self-driven SaaS Developer Lead to join IMP's Innovative Technology Practice. You will contribute to the technical development of IMP's service offerings for our high-profile investment management clients. Your role will be not only to help us develop existing applications, but to architect new and innovative tools and solutions to help deliver our consulting projects on time and on budget.
You will participate in technical and design discussions with senior management team members and manage the development lifecycle from prototype to release. You will also work closely with our team to accelerate time to market for new tools and technical solutions while keeping abreast of key technology developments.

Ideal candidate will have knowledge of/experience in:

Cloud infrastructure technologies
Deploying, running and managing web applications
Release management and versioning/source control
Test planning with automated testing solutions
Virtual environments and datacenters
Troubleshooting software systems, optimizing performance, resolving problems, and providing follow-up on all issues and solutions
Working on complex projects that require subject matter expertise
Software engineering best practices

Desired skills/knowledge

Expertise in Agile development, SCRUM
C#, Java, JavaScript, HTML 5, MS Visual Studio
SQL queries and basic SQL DB management (creating tables, views, triggers and stored procedures)
Experience in developing ASP.NET web applications
DevExpress ASP.NET experience preferred
Experience in Microsoft Azure

Requirements

Undergraduate Degree from an Accredited College or University in Computer Science or related field
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience developing SaaS based applications
Excellent technical design, problem solving, debugging and communication skills
Solid written and oral communication skills

Location
Boston, MA - up to 10% travel may be required.
Benefits

Medical and Dental Insurance
401k with company match
Paid time off (holidays, vacation and sick days)

Application Instructions
Interested candidates should apply with a cover letter and resume (Gail Blandford, Director of HR & Recruiting).
Company Description
IMP (Implementation Management Professionals) is a Boston-based consultancy in the investment management technology space. IMP offers advisory services, system review and selection, and implementation projects across the front, middle and back-office. Known for our deep subject matter expertise in trade order management, compliance, performance and accounting systems, IMP's Consultants understand the commercial landscape and have specialized hands-on experience with the world's leading investment software products. For over a decade IMP has provided customized solutions for asset managers, hedge funds, mutual funds, insurance companies, and global banks that span from hedge funds managing $100 million in assets under management (AUM) to asset management firms with over $2 trillion in AUM.

Security

Good documentation skills, procedures, design specs, test scripts, training documents etc.
Minimum of 2 years’ experience with Microsoft Dynamics AX.

Ability to work on multiple projects in a fast pasted, dynamic environment.
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet committed deadlines and managing changing priorities.
Demonstrate a willingness to learn.
Basic knowledge of PowerShell.
Ability to monitor AX performance, workflow, batch and AIF processes

MS Certifications.
Fundamental X++ knowledge. .
Expertise in PowerShell.
Familiarity with standard AX version control (TFS) and build processes.
Understanding with Microsoft Azure and AX deployment

Specific duties of the position will include:
provide successful realization of business opportunities by delivering timely and cost efficient IT systems that promote the tenet of service-oriented architecture and that reuse existing assets by standardizing, commoditizing, and automating system and business processes to drive cost efficiencies; work with a blended team of full-time employees and onshore/offshore contractors operating at multiple locations across time zones; design, develop, and deliver software solutions utilizing programs such as Core Java, Spring, Hibernate, and Google Web Toolkit; provide service-oriented solutions integration utilizing web-services and knowledge of SOA and web service standards; integrate and automate testing while using source code management best practices; expand and modify system to improve workflow; analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate and improve existing systems and to review computer system capabilities and workflow; develop, document and revise system design procedures, test procedures, and quality standards; and own technology roadmap of the Application Integration platform and work with internal flow owners to incorporate features into the core platform.

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or its equivalent based on a combination of education and/or experience, and 6 years of experience in the development of IT systems.

summary:

Required Experience

Scope
Monotype is a leading global provider of typefaces, technology and expertise that enable the best user experiences and ensure brand integrity. We offer one of the world’s largest and most highly regarded typeface libraries, as well as innovative solutions that bring the power of type to life. We help a wide range of customers – including consumers, creative professionals, web developers and device manufacturers – to create, distribute and consume beautiful, clear content.
Monotype seeks a Sales Operations Support Representative to join our team. This position is responsible for processing worldwide royalty reporting activities and contract processing. Leveraging internal processes and systems, this role is centered on the insurance that all contracts and royalty orders are processed appropriately and efficiently. This role will manage the order processing and administration of the royalty order process and collection and tracking of royalty reports plus processing contracts through our internal and external systems.
Responsibilities
Royalty Report Processing:
Record royalty reports when received recording under the correct agreement. Ensure royalty report is consistent to prior report.
Review invoice request for completeness then submit royalty reports to finance for invoicing. This must be done processed within strict timeframes to meet required deadlines.
Email reminders to customers if the report is not received as required.
Work through any complex or customer sensitive items with the sales person
 Contract Processing:
Ensures all contracts are processed through our internal approval process and successfully distributed to the contract signer and the internal employee when fully executed.
Follow the contract policy and export policy carefully to ensure it is adhered to as required.
Work with the contract signer and the vendor/customer and prioritize as needed.
Requirements
Associates degree or equivalent experience required. 1 to 3 years contracts administration or royalty reporting experience preferred.
General knowledge of Salesforce or other CRM databases and experience entering and tracking customer information through such systems.
Proven track record of meeting/exceeding performance expectations.
Previous experience working with Sales and Finance to achieve corporate sales requirements.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities and work within deadlines.
Very good written and verbal business communication skills.
Flexible in regards to learning Direct order processing, backing up during quarter end.

job_title: PROJECT MANAGER, Marketing & Communications, Interactive Design
summary:
Boston University's Interactive Design division is looking for a talented, smart project manager who will assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility; coordinate internal resources for the flawless execution of projects; assist in development of a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress; ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget. Boston Universitys Interactive Design division is an award-winning web design agency, nestled within the department of Marketing & Communications. The Interactive Design hive is always buzzing with innovative designers, wicked smart developers, and colorful copywriters, all of whom have a deep knowledge and passion for BU culture. If you want to work in a fast paced, rapidly evolving environment but, an environment that provides a terrific work life balance, we want to hear from you!

Required Skills

B.A. /B.S., or equivalent, three to five years of experience working in project management in an agency, design or development-focused organization or technology sector. Understanding of, and experience managing design driven projects with a focus on user experience needs. Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in site builds, design projects, software development and web technologies. Some experience with Agile process is preferred. Experience preferred, but not required, with: WordPress (the development platform of BU), OmniPlan (for scheduling and estimating), ActiveColab (tasking and time tracking). Requires flexibility and adaptability to new technology in a changing environment and a thorough understanding of project management phases, techniques, and tools. Ability to prioritize multiple projects and ability to work well under pressure and on high visibility projects, and the ability to work in a fast paced, rapidly evolving environment.

Required Experience

Scope
Monotype is a leading global provider of typefaces, technology and expertise that enable the best user experiences and ensure brand integrity. We offer one of the world’s largest and most highly regarded typeface libraries, as well as innovative solutions that bring the power of type to life. We help a wide range of customers – including consumers, creative professionals, web developers and device manufacturers – to create, distribute and consume beautiful, clear content.
Monotype seeks a Sales Operations Support Representative to join our team. This position is responsible for processing worldwide royalty reporting activities and contract processing. Leveraging internal processes and systems, this role is centered on the insurance that all contracts and royalty orders are processed appropriately and efficiently. This role will manage the order processing and administration of the royalty order process and collection and tracking of royalty reports plus processing contracts through our internal and external systems.
Responsibilities
Royalty Report Processing:
Record royalty reports when received recording under the correct agreement. Ensure royalty report is consistent to prior report.
Review invoice request for completeness then submit royalty reports to finance for invoicing. This must be done processed within strict timeframes to meet required deadlines.
Email reminders to customers if the report is not received as required.
Work through any complex or customer sensitive items with the sales person
 Contract Processing:
Ensures all contracts are processed through our internal approval process and successfully distributed to the contract signer and the internal employee when fully executed.
Follow the contract policy and export policy carefully to ensure it is adhered to as required.
Work with the contract signer and the vendor/customer and prioritize as needed.
Requirements
Associates degree or equivalent experience required. 1 to 3 years contracts administration or royalty reporting experience preferred.
General knowledge of Salesforce or other CRM databases and experience entering and tracking customer information through such systems.
Proven track record of meeting/exceeding performance expectations.
Previous experience working with Sales and Finance to achieve corporate sales requirements.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities and work within deadlines.
Very good written and verbal business communication skills.
Flexible in regards to learning Direct order processing, backing up during quarter end.
